Short Summary
Short Bio:

Alyssa is a Military spouse and singer/songwriter born in Mason City, Iowa. She moved at the age of five to Denver, Colorado. As a child, she moved around the US and Canada with singing as a major part of her life. Over time she became a seasoned, versatile, powerhouse vocalist. She is passionate about music and recently made the move to California. She performed the National Anthem for opening ceremonies at the Santa Barbara Polo and Racquet Club. She is working on original music for her upcoming LP that she is recording with Scott Wilson of Saving Abel, at Sunshine Recording Studios.
She performed in several bands throughout Iowa, Colorado, Virginia and North Dakota. She performed at the Highland Street Festival in Denver
column2: she performed the National Anthem for opening ceremonies at the Rocky Mountain Summer Music Festival in Colorado Springs and later performed at the festival with her band. She appeared as a guest radio host for Tri-lakes Radio in Southern Colorado and performed and collaborated with numerous artists/bands. She performed on KCOS Digital Media simulcast radio show ""The Beat Goes On"", appeared as a guest and performed on a Live Stream Facebook show, ""Morty On the Move”. In addition, she has worked with several bands and venues as a booking agent and was a music advocate in Colorado.

column1: As a young child Alyssa performed for Maria Holly, the late Buddy Holly's wife in Clear Lake, Iowa. She competed in Bill Riley'a Talent Roundup at the North Iowa Fair in Mason City, Iowa. She performed on the Tom Slick Show in Denver and the Taste of Colorado. Internationally Alyssa performed at The Highway, Purples and Little Memphis in Windsor, Ontario Canada. Additionally she competed in the International Freedom Festival and the Essex Singing and Fiddle Competition. As a young teen she lived in Nashville and performed on the original Music Row on a regular basis, alongside her mother.

Furthermore, in 2007 she won a Wild Card round at the Rocking Horse in Minot, North Dakota and opened for Country Music ACM Award winners Sawyer Brown. In 2018 she opened for AMA Award winning Rock band, Firehouse, at The Venue located in Denver. In 2019 Alyssa guest performed with Scott Wilson of Saving Abel at Herman's Hideaway during his show with Michael Alexander (Michael Alexander and the Big Whiskey). She opened for Billboard Award &
column2: 2x ASCAP Award winner J.R. Richards of Dishwalla, legendary hip hop artist Coolio with the band Pretty Vague and opened for Billboard chart topping rock band Hinder, at Sunshine Studios Live in Colorado Springs.

column1: Why is this Important to me?

• When I was a little girl, my mom competed in the Nashville Recording Workshop singing competition and made it to the finals in Nashville, Tennessee. She performed at the Grand Ole Opry. She performed on that stage. That is a dream for many vocalists, artists and bands out there. When she came home and we watched her video tape, I was already inspired by her, however, this was a different sensation. There was a little girl named Ashley who sang on that show, which ignited my flame. Since then, I have a burning desire to do this. It is more than just a dream, it is my passion. It is my love. I used to write ""Thank You"" speeches for the Grammy's and practice in the mirror. I would practice harmony parts to my favorite bands for when I got to share the stage with them. I used to cry myself to sleep because I wanted it so bad. As an adult, I realized that if I want it, I have to go out there and get it. This is important to me because I would be able to better provide for my family. I would be able to be more involved with doing things for our troops, my favorite charity organizations and help raise awareness to things I am passionate about. I would be able to fulfill my hearts desire and inspire others to go after their dreams and show them that no matter what kind of a background you come from, you can achieve anything by hard work and determination.
• Thank you very kindly for believing in me, for your contributions and for your continued support on my music journey. You are all part of my motivation. This is for me, but this is also for you.
<h3>What I Need &amp
<ul>

• My goal is $25,000. This will fund my startup to complete recording of my full length album, a music video, photo shoot, music distribution and merchandise. If by chance there is anything leftover, it will go towards a tour startup, so that I may join you for a night of music in a nearby city.

• The perk packages are Military themed. They include an assortment of official Alyssa Ruffin merchandise and music. I also dedicated a special package to my Father, who was a Marine Corps Veteran, fisherman, Minnesota Vikings fan and Chef. He passed away in September 2018 from Prostate Cancer. I am very excited about his perk package!
• If the goal isn't reached, all funds will still go towards everything previously mentioned and I will continue to raise funds however I can, until I reach my overall goal.
The Impact
<ul>

• Scott Wilson is a music industry professional. He is the bass player for BMI Award Winning Rock Band Saving Abel and the former bass player of Grammy nominated Rock Band Tantric. When Scott isn't out there living the dream, he is working at Sunshine Studios Live alongside Christina ""Sunshine"" Corbitt. Attached to Sunshine Studios Live is Sunshine Recording Studio, where Scott and his partner Richard Easterling spend their time producing artists. Scott Wilson has an average of 7 artists signed to major record labels, every single year.
<li>Scott and Christina believe in Alyssa. They have given her well earned opportunities to perform on their stage at Sunshine Studios Live to open for major artists there such as
column2: J.R. of Dishwalla, Coolio and Hinder.

column1: <h3>​Risks &amp
<ul>

• The challenges I face are simple. I am a Military spouse. I am a mother. I will spend several days, weeks and even months away from my family to record in Colorado in order to finish my record and to go on tour.
• Being a Military spouse for the past 10 years, as a family we are already trained for separation. We know how to make it work. We have a plan in place for when this takes off.
• Thanks to technology, we will be able to video chat. I will also make trips home during tours, when it allows. They can also make trips out to shows. Everyone is excited!
​Other Ways You Can Help
<ul>
• Want to help financially but can't afford a package listed or just want to send a different dollar amount? I also have venmo, paypal and accept funds through Facebook messenger.
• Prefer sending cash or check? Email alyssaruffin@gmail.com or charles.d.ruffin@gmail.com for details.

• Tell your family, friends and bosses about me, about my fundraiser and share it with everyone you know and often!! Share it to groups. Be sure to include a message in all of your posts. Let them know I am your friend, niece, cousin, fellow musician, whatever roll I play in your life, simply just tell them.
• Don't forget to save the campaign and share every few days.

Overview:

My name is Muck Sticky, and I am an independent recording artist and filmmaker. After the success of our recent film 'Dig That, Zeebo Newton', I've decided it's time to get back in the studio and record my 15th album (20th catalog title).
About:

Most of you know, I've never had the luxury of relying on big record labels or corporate sponsors to fund my creative projects. I rely on fans like YOU by offering limited edition items for pre-sale to help fund my creative projects. After the success of the 'Wacky' album campaign, along with the massive support on the 'Zeebo Newton' movie campaign, I need your help to finish my new album 'HIGHER LEVEL'.

This album marks my twentieth year of making music, so this is a HUGE deal for me. Sometimes I struggle with the pressures of handling everything that comes along with being an independent artist, but when I see the love and support so many of you show it inspires me to keep going.
This album also marks the first time I will be pressing VINYL copies. We will be offering a LIMITED EDITION vinyl 'Higher Level' album, as well as a currently untitled ""greatest hits"" vinyl album.

I will personally make sure each and every one of you receive what you pay for, and there are some cool extra perks like ""video chat listening party"" where we hang out online while I play the new album for you before it is released to the public. So please check out the perks, and choose the best one that fits you.
<h3>What We Need &amp

My studio computer of twelve years recently crashed, so it's been an expensive process rebuilding to get back to recording. But I am glad to say, that with the help of some great friends, I am back to business. And the music is sounding better than ever. But I need a budget to finish it.
I still need the funds to cover the CD &
column2: vinyl pressings, as well as the recording/mixing/mastering time and process. Plus, we plan to shoot several new music videos for the new album. Before the computer crashed, we filmed and released the two new music videos ""Like This"" and ""Ballin' On Them Haters"". But I also had a few songs and videos I lost. So I have some recovery work to do on those.

column1: The Impact

My music is all about having fun and enjoying life, and making the best of the tough world we live in. It makes me feel good to make other people feel good, and I think the world needs more people who are pleasant, kind, and share good vibes.

My last album was released in 2016, and it's taken me a while to create a few movie projects since then. So my music has been on hold. With your help on this campaign, it will give me the jump start I need to get back to making music full time again.

If you remember the 'Zeebo' or 'Wacky' campaigns, you know we had a major success with both of them. I'm excited about the music on this new album, and I can't wait to share it with all of you. So please join me on this journey to make a new album and contribute at whatever level you can.
I promise to deliver the BEST album I've EVER MADE!!! And we will do it together!!!
<h3>Risks &amp
Of course there are risks and challenges with any project, but considering this is my fifteenth album I think it is safe to say I can complete it with your help.
We've had several great IndieGoGo projects in the past, and those turned out great.
Making an album is much easier than making a full-length feature film about my life story, and we did that. With MAJOR SUCCESS. Just google 'Dig That, Zeebo Newton'.
Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute today, please don't feel like you can't help. There are MANY other ways you can help. Share this campaign with anyone you feel would be interested in joining our mission to bring fun music to the world. Play our fun music and videos with other people for free on YouTube.com/MuckStickyTV. And share my social media pages @MuckSticky on all platforms.
But if you can contribute, even just a bit, I greatly appreciate it. Thanks a bazillion! Keep the good vibes circulating! Let's make an album...

Hi, Ich bin Christoph, Meister für Veranstaltungstechnik und technischer Leiter in einem Kulturzentrum, Tontechniker, Musikproduzent, Dozent für Veranstaltungstechnik und Musikproduktion, Songwriter, Bassit, Gitarrist, Sänger, Papa. Ihr seht, ich halte mich viel in der Nähe von ""richtigen"" Künstlern auf, doch wie bin ich dort hingekommen?

Ich lebe Musik schon seit ich denken kann, komme aus einer musikbegeisterten Familie und bin schon als Kind auf vielen Bühnen gewesen. Ich spiele in Bands seit ich 16 Jahre alt bin. Musik hat mir viele Türen geöffnet und Begegnungen rund um den Globus ermöglicht. Heute stehe ich hier und möchte - zum ersten Mal - ein Soloprojekt vorstellen. Wie ihr am Namen meines Musikprojekts sehen könnt war ich fast immer der Sidekick, jemand, der den 'eigentlichen' Künstler unterstützt. Bei diesem Projekt, welches ich Euch vorstellen möchte, habe ich alles selbst gemacht, Songs geschrieben, arrangiert, Instrumente eingespielt, gesungen, produziert. (Naja okay, also ein wenig Unterstützung von talentierten Freunden und Kolleg*innen hatte ich schon... :)

Auf das Ergebnis, mein Debut Soloalbum, bin ich sehr stolz und möchte es Euch daher hier auf Indiegogo präsentieren. 10 wundervolle Songs, rockig, mit Texten die eine wichtige Aussage haben. Musik kann Menschen zusammenführen und ehrlich sein. Sie kann helfen, die Risse die durch unsere Gesellschaft gehen kleiner zu machen. Sie kann inspirieren und uns durch schwere Zeiten führen.

Die Präsentation über Crowdfunding habe ich ganz bewusst ausgesucht, denn sie passt zur Entstehung des Albums und nutzt die Vorteile des technischen Fortschritts. Es gibt nur mich als Songwriter und dich als Hörer, ohne fette Plattenfirma, Verlage oder Vertrieb.

Ich würde mich sehr freuen wenn du die Kampagne unterstützt. Ich möchte 1.600 € für die Produktion von CDs und richtigem Rockbandmerch einsammeln. Bei dieser Summe liegt der Break für eine sinnvolle Produktion. Das Finanzierungsziel ist allerdings flexibel, so dass du dein Shirt, die CD oder den Download Code auch bekommst, wenn wir das Ziel nicht erreichen. Du kannst auch andere Dinge bestellen, oder ich komme mit der Band vorbei und spiele auf deiner Geburtstagsparty! Also schau dich ruhig um, es gibt viele coole Perks zu entdecken.

A Propos Band, es gibt tatsächlich ein paar verrückte Jungs, die die Songs mit mir live performen. Wir werden in diesem Jahr loslegen und die Bühnen der Republik erobern, vielleicht auch in deiner Stadt.
Vielen Dank für deinen Support!
SIDEK!CK

Hi, I am Christoph, Master in Event Technology, TD, Sound Engineer, Producer, Professor, Songwriter, Bass and Guitar Player, Singer, Songwriter, Father of Two based in Hannover, Germany. Ever since I was a Boy I performed Music on Stage, and I started playing in Rock Bands at the Age of 16. Music helped me discover the World and took me around the Globe in different Lineups and different Positions. But, as you can see by the Name of this Project, I was mostly just the Sidekick. With this Album, I am taking the Step into Leading the Band. I always had a huge Love for Music and writing Songs. My Dream was to one day record a Solo Album all by myself. I am very grateful to say this Dream has been fulfilled this Year. The Album is ready, Ten beautiful Songs well written, arranged, recorded and Mastered.

Now I am not a big Star with a huge Record Company backing me. I wrote and recorded all these Songs on my own, and to finish this Project, I want to publish them in the same way, with no Man in the Middle. One of the great Advantages the digital World has to offer is to have this Direct Connection. It's just me, the Musician, and you, the Listener.

Music has the Power to unite People and help us through troubled Times. Music always helped me, and with these Songs I would like to give something back, to try to heal the Cracks running through our Society but also to speak out against Hate and Egoism. By Supporting this Campaign, You will not only be rewarded with the Full Album, Shirts, Hoodies or Gym Bag. You also help getting SIDEK!CK out there on the Road. Although this is a Solo Recording, there is a killer Live Band waiting to be unleashed. In 2020, we will start Touring again, maybe even in your Hometown!

Here on Indiegogo, I would like to offer my Music to you, along with some Merch every proper Rock Band is offering. I would mean the World to me if you showed your support by buying not only the Music but also a Shirt or a Hoodie. You even get the Opportunity to book SIDEK!CK for your private Event!

This Campaign has a flexible Funding Goal, so you will get your CD, Shirt or whatever you order. The Break even is carefully calculated at € 1.600 just for manufacturing CDs and Merch. If we reach 3000+, we will also shoot a professional Music Video!

Some of You might not be able to support this Campaign financially. If so, there's still many Ways you can Help! Share this Campaign to Friends who might be interested. Thank You for Supporting SIDEK!CK!

Auf das Ergebnis, mein Debut Soloalbum, bin ich sehr stolz und möchte es Euch daher hier auf Indiegogo präsentieren. 10 wundervolle Songs, rockig, mit Texten die eine wichtige Aussage haben. Musik kann Menschen zusammenführen und ehrlich sein. Sie kann helfen, die Risse die durch unsere Gesellschaft gehen kleiner zu machen. Sie kann inspirieren und uns durch schwere Zeiten führen.

Die Präsentation über Crowdfunding habe ich ganz bewusst ausgesucht, denn sie passt zur Entstehung des Albums und nutzt die Vorteile des technischen Fortschritts. Es gibt nur mich als Songwriter und dich als Hörer, ohne fette Plattenfirma, Verlage oder Vertrieb.

Ich würde mich sehr freuen wenn du die Kampagne unterstützt. Ich möchte 1.600 € für die Produktion von CDs und richtigem Rockbandmerch einsammeln. Bei dieser Summe liegt der Break für eine sinnvolle Produktion. Das Finanzierungsziel ist allerdings flexibel, so dass du dein Shirt, die CD oder den Download Code auch bekommst, wenn wir das Ziel nicht erreichen. Du kannst auch andere Dinge bestellen, oder ich komme mit der Band vorbei und spiele auf deiner Geburtstagsparty! Also schau dich ruhig um, es gibt viele coole Perks zu entdecken.

A Propos Band, es gibt tatsächlich ein paar verrückte Jungs, die die Songs mit mir live performen. Wir werden in diesem Jahr loslegen und die Bühnen der Republik erobern, vielleicht auch in deiner Stadt.
Vielen Dank für deinen Support!
SIDEK!CK

Hi, I am Christoph, Master in Event Technology, TD, Sound Engineer, Producer, Professor, Songwriter, Bass and Guitar Player, Singer, Songwriter, Father of Two based in Hannover, Germany. Ever since I was a Boy I performed Music on Stage, and I started playing in Rock Bands at the Age of 16. Music helped me discover the World and took me around the Globe in different Lineups and different Positions. But, as you can see by the Name of this Project, I was mostly just the Sidekick. With this Album, I am taking the Step into Leading the Band. I always had a huge Love for Music and writing Songs. My Dream was to one day record a Solo Album all by myself. I am very grateful to say this Dream has been fulfilled this Year. The Album is ready, Ten beautiful Songs well written, arranged, recorded and Mastered.

Now I am not a big Star with a huge Record Company backing me. I wrote and recorded all these Songs on my own, and to finish this Project, I want to publish them in the same way, with no Man in the Middle. One of the great Advantages the digital World has to offer is to have this Direct Connection. It's just me, the Musician, and you, the Listener.

Music has the Power to unite People and help us through troubled Times. Music always helped me, and with these Songs I would like to give something back, to try to heal the Cracks running through our Society but also to speak out against Hate and Egoism. By Supporting this Campaign, You will not only be rewarded with the Full Album, Shirts, Hoodies or Gym Bag. You also help getting SIDEK!CK out there on the Road. Although this is a Solo Recording, there is a killer Live Band waiting to be unleashed. In 2020, we will start Touring again, maybe even in your Hometown!

Here on Indiegogo, I would like to offer my Music to you, along with some Merch every proper Rock Band is offering. I would mean the World to me if you showed your support by buying not only the Music but also a Shirt or a Hoodie. You even get the Opportunity to book SIDEK!CK for your private Event!

This Campaign has a flexible Funding Goal, so you will get your CD, Shirt or whatever you order. The Break even is carefully calculated at € 1.600 just for manufacturing CDs and Merch. If we reach 3000+, we will also shoot a professional Music Video!

Some of You might not be able to support this Campaign financially. If so, there's still many Ways you can Help! Share this Campaign to Friends who might be interested. Thank You for Supporting SIDEK!CK!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Hannover, Germany",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/s-i-d-e-k-c-k-debut-soloalbum/pica

Well here we are. Welcome! Deep Cricket Night is an independent Chicago band creating all original music that’s deeply steeped in aspects of Rock, Americana, Alt-Rock and Dark Folk creating a unique sound all their own. 

We’ve recently finished recording and mixing our 5th record of new music titled Blue Insomnia Hex and are beginning the process of mastering it.  

We've decided in addition to streaming and other digital outlets that we’d like to take a special leap and do a limited run BLUE vinyl pressing. 

So that’s where you the listener/fan/supporter come in. Since we’re an independent band with no label support we’re on our own to bring you this collection of amazing new material in a limited edition BLUE vinyl album pressing.

Lance, Jaime, Greg, Bill &
column2:
Dave appreciate you checking out our campaign!

Thank you!!!

Estimated time of delivery: Nov - Dec 2019

www.facebook.com//DCNLHD/

www.sonicbids.com

www.deepcricketnight.com

It's Done!!

After four+ years of work and collaboration, my children's CD is done being recorded and mixed! As I write this, 21 songs are entering the final mastering process and will be headed for the press in early December. Included are many new, original songs as well as a few re-worked favorites, such as You are my Sunshine and Good Night Irene (with updated lyrics...). I have had the pleasure of collaborating on these songs with Shimshai, Aimee Ringle, Samara Jade, Cornflower and others~ as well as getting some local children into the studio, including my own three young ones. It's been a lot of fun... and a lot of work! :)
These songs are for the children... and for all of us.

The intention of this CD has been to provide children with high-quality, beautiful, conscious music~ And my hope is that it will be enjoyable by all ages. These songs are designed to be calming and inspirational, so that adults who listen along with youth will also enjoy them! :)
Order for the holidays, for yourself, or loved ones!
To support the final mastering of the tracks &
column2: the printing of physical CDs, please pre-order your copy or make a donation here! To pre-order, please check out the ""perks"" listed and select the level/number of CDs you'd like to order.

column1: How will the funds be used?

I've done all the recording and a majority of the sound engineering work on this project myself, which has brought some of my costs down, but  it’s still taken a lot of investment to get the project this far. Printing CDs will cost about $1500, and the final production costs  will be $700-$1200. If I raise more than my goal, it will go to reimburse my music production fund, so I can get started sooner on the next CD of my music... (I've got about 20 more original songs on the back burner, waiting for their turn to be recorded!).
Other Ways You Can Help...
<ul>
• Please share this campaign with your friends and networks. The Indiegogo share tools make it easy...
• Prayer and positive intentions work wonders~ Thank you for your good thoughts!
<
column2: 3 Thank you for your support. It makes all the difference! &lt

0,"

     Starting out I never thought I'd be a rapper. Growing up as a kid I was always that dork in theatre who's true potential couldn't possibly be recognized until I ""glew up"" I was an outcast so i immersed myself in my craft.The one place I could feel like a somebody. My dreams have always come before everything. So once I could leave my small hometown on the eastern shore of Virginia,  I moved to NYC to become a broadway star. Or so I thought..  I received a scholarship from the American Musical Dramatic Arts Academy and attended but little did i know my studies and aspirations were just my own way of ignoring my past that would always effect me. I soon dropped out because of a wide range of mental health issues. Mainly a severe case of PTSD. To this day I haven't been back home, I miss my mom, dad and sister but they understand that I cant just live in a never ending trigger. So I live in New Jersey with my incredibly supportive girlfriend Meghan. Who also happens to be my manager. 

     I'm a 22 year old female rap artist with an intense catalog behind me that focuses on mental health. My music is about fighting against the harsh waves of humanity. I have a completely original sound. I have an aesthetic that matches my music, and the ambition to make my wildest dreams come true. Imagine a mixture of Eminem and Demi Lovato with lyrics like NF. I've put my blood, sweat and tears into these pieces of work and just need someone to see the potential in what I've conceived. I want to spread the message of overcoming trauma with the help of music. I want to help the population of people dealing with ptsd from trauma (sexual assault, car accidents, break-ins, serving in the military, the death of a family member, spousal abuse, child abuse, anxiety, depression, etc) I truly believe that world wide mental health is crucial to our futures, and our childrens future. It's the biggest issue we face and we need a truthful representation of what we deal with. 

     I created SkyDxddy as an alter ego after coming to terms with my long list of mental health problems. Creating music people can listen to and feel powerful from is something I've always loved doing since I was little. I recently  changed my name from Hannah to Sky in attempts to move onto a new chapter in my life and recently became a full time rap artist after my girlfriend heard my music and introduced me to the greats of hip hop.  Anyone is capable of turning darkness into light. Anyone can be a strong badass thats capable of absolutely anything and ever since I created SkyDxddy and have seen my music have an impact on actual people who have also gone through similar experiences, my life's changed. I'm ready to make a difference and help the people who feel lost like I did.  I've been speaking to a well known name in the industry and they see my potential, but they want to see if I have what it takes to make the money to invest in myself fully. To become SkyDxddy fully. All I need to do is to create music videos for my first EP, ""Into the Dark"". Which can be streamed on any platform. I'm raising money for production costs for Digital Thunderdome Studios to create an incredible first video, promoting on official websites and pages(Worldstar, No Jumper, Lyrical Lemonade, etc)

      With this money I'll be able to take the next step in my career and get even more exposure on my music already released as well as start creating my new EP  ""Behind Closed Doors"" I want it to be clear that if you can't contribute here, streaming my music on Spotify will skyrocket my career as well. We live in an age where the power is in the people. They control what becomes relevant and what we listen to. I urge you to give music that means something a chance and google me. It will show you all the platforms you can listen to my music on that as crazy as it seems is already changing lives.

*If you took the time to read all of my story, thank you from the bottom of my heart. I hope you show your support in any way that you can.  ( streaming on Spotify, contributing to my campaign) Thank you  so much for your time.*
column3:
>Lets change the world together.  -SkyDxddy

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
It All Started With A Couple Chords

It's amazing how when somebody invests into you, what can come out of it. It really began when my father invested his time when I was younger to start teaching me chords on my grandfather's Martin guitar. I still remember the cracks in the wood and how that guitar was the best thing I had ever heard. I also spent a lot of time with my grandmother growing up and she taught me the joy of music. She would always be singing, either acapella or while playing the piano. This started me on a musical journey that has meant so much to me over the years.

When I started writing my own songs, this opened up a whole new world to me. This was a brand new avenue of artistic expression that I fell in love with. It became a way for me to capture what I was feeling in the moment and put it into a piece of music. I loved singing random words while recording on an old laptop and listening back to hear if anything good was in there. Till this day I still do that exact same thing.

Through my years of making music I've always wanted to create a full length record of songs that I really believed in and needed to share. These songs have finally come together in a record that will be called 'The Redlander'. With my Indiegogo campaign, it gives you the opportunity to take part of this musical experience too! I believe this is a way for the music to gain more value and also become a greater part of your life.
What To Do And What You Get!

You will be able to contribute by choosing from the many different perks I have made available on this campaign. I have options that include digital downloads, an autographed copy of The Redlander, a T-shirt that will only be for campaign backers, recorded cover songs, handwritten lyric sheets, having a song written from your idea, having your name in the album credits, a chance to win one of my guitars, house concerts, having your business as a sponsor and more!
(You can also check out the Add On Perks during check out and the Virtual Tip Jar options)

By becoming a backer it will also help cover the expenses it takes to bring music into the world. Without having a label behind me for funding, that part is left up to me to take care of and it can be tough to do. The goal for this campaign is $5,000 and all contributions will go towards some of the main recording costs like producing, mixing, mastering, and distribution
column2: on top of Indiegogo fees. Anything over that will help in other areas like studio players and promotion costs.

column1: The Impact

Your support in this is what makes this project so much more special to me. In the past I did a campaign similar to this for my first EP and it made all the difference by partnering with others to bring it to life. I made that EP back in 2012 and I still have people that tell me how much those songs mean to them. Music truly is powerful and I love that it can touch a person's heart. I can have a hand in that, and you can as well. Moving forward with these new songs means bringing new art into the world and creating something that will last for years to come. I'm excited we get to do this together and can't wait for you to hear The Redlander!
Other Ways You Can Help!
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
<ul>
• Let your friends know about this campaign!
• Make sure to share this post!
• Let me know if there are any special rewards you would like to have, and I'll do my best to make them happen.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
Sammanfattning
Ett år sen. Bosse pratade om hur han älskade att prata med människor som levt länge och att skriva låtar. Och Lotta sa: Vi gör det!
Idag har vi 14 nyskrivna musikaliska skrönor fyllda av humor, värme och allvar och med start i oktober turnerar vi med föreställningen Skillingnytt. Sångerna
column9: >om vanliga människor
column11: >som levde fram till 1900-talets första hälft.
column13: >Om hyggliga Hugos möte med folkets agitator Kata Dalström, om Asta som såg elen komma till Ullatti, om Gunnar som började sitt liv som död...

column1: Skillingnytt är det festligaste kompositionsprojekt vi har jobbat med! Vi vill så väldigt gärna få föreviga alla de här berättelserna genom att spela in dem och släppa dem på skiva &
<h3>Vad vi behöver &amp

Vi behöver hjälp med själva produktionen (inspelning, redigering, mix, master) plus musiker. Sen tillkommer kostnader för skivtryck, digital distribution, PR och marknadsföring och sådant. Det står vi delvis för själva och delvis söker vi bidrag/sponsorer från andra håll.

Vill du backa oss kan du förköpa signerade skivor, få Bosses debut-EP och bok, livestream eller hemmakonserter med Bosse eller kanske en rykande färsk, nyskriven Skillingnytt-sång om någon historia från ditt förflutna?
Och så får du galet mycket tacksamhet. Vore så fint att få spela in de här låtarna!
Kostnader
<ul>
• Inspelning, redigering, mix, master + musiker (utöver vi själva) minst 55 000 kr ◀◀◀ Detta ber vi om hjälp med
<li>Skivtryck &amp
• Avgifter crowdfunding 4 000 kr
Läs mer om vad vi gör om vi inte når målet nedan.  ▼
Mer om Skillingnytt
Hela Skillingnytt andas en inspirerande nyfikenhet på människan och på den tid som har varit. En vädjan om att vi ska lära av vår historia.

Sångerna tar upp allt från festliga anekdoter till tragik och maktförtryck. Berättelserna kommer från Kiruna i norr och Sörmjöle i söder. De handlar om vanliga människor som en del av en turbulent historia. Om den urgamla traditionen med sikfiske i Torneälven. Om migrationen till Nordamerika och Brasilien. Om tvångsförflyttningen av samer. Om svåra förlossningar för 100 år sedan. Om tantkalas på 30-talet.
Alla berättelser tolkas i våra nutida ögon och målas till musikaliska skrönor i Skillingnytt. Totalt har vi skrivit 14 sånger och dem vill vi föreviga på skiva och digitalt.
Vi vill inspirera människor till att fortsätta berätta, för berättandet är så härligt festligt! Och vi, hela mänskligheten, har mycket att vinna på att vi ta vara på vår historia.
Om vi inte når vårt mål
Om vi inte når vårt mål för crowdfundingen ska vi...
... i 1:a hand få andra bidragsgivare/sponsorer som täcker upp till målet crowdfundingen.
... i 2:a hand producera en skiva så långt pengarna räcker. Kanske att vi behöver välja bort några av sångerna och ha färre instrument. Hursomhelst ska det bli ett fullängdsalbum (minst 10 sånger).
... i 3:e hand - om vi inte får pengar nog att producera ett fullängdsalbum med minst 10 sånger - betalar vi tillbaka alla pengar vi fått.
Fler sätt att hjälpa fram Skillingnytt
Man måste inte ge pengar för att hjälpa. Du får gärna
<ul>
• tipsa andra om kampanjen (prova Indiegogos delningsknappar, de är bra),
• komma på föreställningar,
• säga Heja! om vi möts och inte minst:
• Ta vara på din historia och berätta! ❤
Mer om oss

Vi heter Lotta Karlsson och Bo Selinder. Tillsammans skapar vi musik och scenkonst där både humor och allvar har en självklar plats. Du kan läsa mer om vad vi gör på tomatproduktion.se och mer om Bo Selinder och hans låtskrivande på boselinder.se.
","Sammanfattning
Ett år sen. Bosse pratade om hur han älskade att prata med människor som levt länge och att skriva låtar. Och Lotta sa: Vi gör det!

Idag har vi 14 nyskrivna musikaliska skrönor fyllda av humor, värme och allvar och med start i oktober turnerar vi med föreställningen Skillingnytt. Sångerna bygger på sanna minnen om vanliga människor som levde fram till 1900-talets första hälft. Om hyggliga Hugos möte med folkets agitator Kata Dalström, om Asta som såg elen komma till Ullatti, om Gunnar som började sitt liv som död...
Skillingnytt är det festligaste kompositionsprojekt vi har jobbat med! Vi vill så väldigt gärna få föreviga alla de här berättelserna genom att spela in dem och släppa dem på skiva & digitalt. ❤
Vad vi behöver & vad du får

Vi behöver hjälp med själva produktionen (inspelning, redigering, mix, master) plus musiker. Sen tillkommer kostnader för skivtryck, digital distribution, PR och marknadsföring och sådant. Det står vi delvis för själva och delvis söker vi bidrag/sponsorer från andra håll.

Vill du backa oss kan du förköpa signerade skivor, få Bosses debut-EP och bok, livestream eller hemmakonserter med Bosse eller kanske en rykande färsk, nyskriven Skillingnytt-sång om någon historia från ditt förflutna?
Och så får du galet mycket tacksamhet. Vore så fint att få spela in de här låtarna!
Kostnader
Inspelning, redigering, mix, master + musiker (utöver vi själva) minst 55 000 kr ◀◀◀ Detta ber vi om hjälp med
Skivtryck & digital distribution 16 500 kr
Avgifter crowdfunding 4 000 kr
Läs mer om vad vi gör om vi inte når målet nedan.  ▼
Mer om Skillingnytt
Hela Skillingnytt andas en inspirerande nyfikenhet på människan och på den tid som har varit. En vädjan om att vi ska lära av vår historia.

Sångerna tar upp allt från festliga anekdoter till tragik och maktförtryck. Berättelserna kommer från Kiruna i norr och Sörmjöle i söder. De handlar om vanliga människor som en del av en turbulent historia. Om den urgamla traditionen med sikfiske i Torneälven. Om migrationen till Nordamerika och Brasilien. Om tvångsförflyttningen av samer. Om svåra förlossningar för 100 år sedan. Om tantkalas på 30-talet.
Alla berättelser tolkas i våra nutida ögon och målas till musikaliska skrönor i Skillingnytt. Totalt har vi skrivit 14 sånger och dem vill vi föreviga på skiva och digitalt.
Vi vill inspirera människor till att fortsätta berätta, för berättandet är så härligt festligt! Och vi, hela mänskligheten, har mycket att vinna på att vi ta vara på vår historia.

what's going on!

We have all been through a year together that has dramatically changed us all. I am thankful to have maintained my health but, as many musicians and artists have experienced, I lost nearly an entire year of my typical performance income. Music venues and musicians alike have struggled to stay afloat and come up with creative ways of connecting to their fans and audiences. It has been challenging to grow in this time but, for myself, I have found many new musical inspirations and confidants. The past 13+ months have allowed me to explore my musical tastes and connect with fellow musicians I've always wanted to create with.

I am amidst working on a brand new Remember Jones album. I have written or co-written every song on this album, working alongside many musicians and collaborators in and out of studios. Though I've released two albums before, this would be my first, completely original, STUDIO album release. i am EXCITED! nervous! scared! HYPED! ALL THAT!

I have vigorously toured my past original music and original contributions, as well as my theatrical presentations of the music of Amy Winehouse, Queen, Joe Cocker, Kanye West, Jeff Buckley and more. These experiences have introduced so many people to my music and my style of entertainment
column2: this new album hopes to broaden that base and to bring me to places I have yet to see.

column1: what i need / what you get!

I am looking for your help in funding this album for me. Having lost all of my touring income in 2020 and most of 2021, creating this for you has proven nearly impossible. I am looking to raise $35,000 through your contributions. Truthfully, this is only a fraction of the overall cost but this will help make ALL of the musicians, producers, engineers, studios, and designers feel secure in their work. This is a challenging time to ask for favors, I know it. So many of you have already done so much for me this past year and beyond. It's also hard for me to ask favors of fellow creators
column2: they deserve to be taken care of just as much as you take care of me.

column1: Alongside this new album will be new branding for Remember Jones: digital marketing, website, graphic designs, album design, clothing designs for shows, production for shows, light/sound enhancements, new stage performances, live musicians, and other crazy shit I've conjured up with all of the free time in the past year! I have been VERY inspired and your help will bring me to the heightened level I need to be at!

With your donation to this album there will be several exciting perks, my favorite of all being a special, intimate, listening party of the album IN MY HOME before anyone else can hear it. You'll be introduced to several people who helped bring the album to life and hear stories of every song in a special performance space that's being created inside my home! Other perks include private performances, new merchandise, listing in the liner notes, and pre-ordering your copy of the CD, vinyl, and more!
*DONATE IN THE FIRST 24 HOURS and I will PERSONALLY SIGN all CDs and VINYLs! AVAILABLE FOR FREE FOR FIRST 24 HOURS ONLY!*
why this makes a difference

As a music lover, you may already know that the industry is very tough on independent artists. Most listeners resort to streaming their music which does not fairly pay artists. Touring, which has been non-existent for the past year +, is the best way to connect with fans and new audiences and the best way to sell merchandise. One of my greatest pleasures is personally signing a vinyl that someone has bought at the end of a show. They may never know the work that went into creating that piece of art but they are trusting ME and my musical confidants with purchasing this addition to the home music library. It makes me feel so lucky in those moments!

This would be my second IndieGogo campaign. In 2016, I put myself out there to raise money for the debut Remember Jones album. Asking for $12, I raised nearly $20k -- and this was before any songs were written or recorded, and before I experienced touring nationally. This was the basis of getting Remember Jones on it's feet. I am back to that feeling - of starting new, re-branding, re-creating, evolving, and ready to share with my fans, my family!, the re-birth!
your help beyond donations!

Full transparency: social media algorithms make it harder and harder to connect with you personally. We are always trying to find ways to stay in touch and it is a DAUNTING task. Not only are we making music but we are doing all of this work to get you to hear it. Maybe you can't donate as much as you'd like or maybe you can! Either way, your help sharing this with friends or personally contacting other fans and family members is worth just as much as the financial give. Maybe you know someone that has the ability to help an independent artist but may not have heard of Remember Jones? Your help connecting with them will go a very long in helping us reach our goal!

Make some noise about the campaign! I ain't too proud to beg in these times -- this year has been IMPOSSIBLE for musicians. This album is more ME than ever before - please use any of the tools provided by IndieGogo and share to whoever you can! We have ONE month to reach this goal or exceed it - and I believe it's VERY possible! <

A Long Time Coming!

I've been waiting to release these nine original songs to you for a little while now. If you enjoyed my 2014 EP Crocus Song, or the 2 tracks from Transfiguration Day, prepare for something a bit more mature, candidly reflective, with a bit more of a story to tell. The recording process for this album began in 2017 at the Old Confidence Lodge in Nova Scotia with a project called Transfiguration Day.  Now, it's just wrapped up at All Saints Church-Community Centre in Toronto! Covid-19 is a real kick-in-the-pants financially, so I'm asking for a bit of help with releasing this album. Alongside making the tracks and a physical copy available, I hope to have a video ready for the release so we can all sit down and enjoy the music and images together when it comes out -- just the way I've been hearing things in my head for years! Expect a release by June 2021.
Crocus Song is available here (name your price!): https://thomasmccallum1.bandcamp.com/album/crocus-song
Transfiguration Day:  https://transfigurationday.bandcamp.com/releases
<h3>What We Need &amp
<span style=""font-weight: normal
<ol>
• Recording, Mixing (~$2000)
• Mastering (~$800)
• Video production ($1200)
• Artwork ($200)
• Duplication ($500)
• If you donate you can recieve perks like personal music lessons, a house concert, your name listed in the CD, and the album itself!
The Impact

When I debued these songs at Full Circle Festival in 2017, Mike Kerr called it one of the best sets of the festival. They're not particularly sad songs - nobody gets too too hurt - but a lot of people said they'd cried during the set. If anything can elicit that kind of emotion nowadays, it must be worth something. Maybe we could go somewhere with that kind of energy. A group cry could do us some real good.
My previous project, Crocus Song made its way to the Bedouin of the Jordanian desert and the Sami reindeer-herders of Scandanavia, who sent their words of appreciation.

With this album I want us to think about what it means to know one another by knowing our desires. It begins with ""Canada"", where the desire to run from one's worst fears and lonliness result in getting a lot of work done, and ends on ""Mariner"", based on real events, where the narrator wonders how he can go on after having to abandon the boat he built himself. How do our desires propel us, and how do we account for the sacrifices we all make?
<h3>Risks &amp
Once we get the ball rolling there's no stopping it. The music industry is in shambles, and there's nowhere to really sell CDs. The risk is the same as ever -- art can be seen as useless.

If we don't hit the funding mark we'll release this in stages and cobble them together eventually, but in terms of this project, ""eventually"" is long gone. Should the goal not be reached, the project will be more self-funded. The video aspect will be reduced.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you just can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:
<ul>
• Please share everything ""Thomas"" online!
• Ask a parent, guardian, or wealthy associate to donate.
• Send positive vibes - I get them.

Hello WORLD, my name is Timorris Lane, your Global Ambassador of Love. I'm a singer originally from Cleveland, OH, and currently live in the big apple, NYC. I've spent the last 6 months recording my debut album, an EP made up of 5 exclusive songs, and here I am, ready to shoot my first major music video.

My musical journey began, in my youth, singing in church with my entire family. This organic experience soon  blessed me with the opportunity to perform with the Cleveland Boy's Choir for over the span of a decade.  After school I moved to Atlanta, GA to pursue my first major moves with singing professionally. I started working with Nicci Gilbert from Brownstone, engaged some of my favorite producers, like B. Cox, and really began figuring out where my pace was within the industry.

column4: > know you're going to love it and sync with my musics universal vibe.  I believe that it offers a variety of style, while still remaining at its core, honest and true to who I am and represent.

column1:
First and foremost, this campaign is to raise money for my premiere music video, simultaneously, connecting my fan base and supporters to my platform as a Global Ambassador of Love through my music.  This venture is super important because it propels not only the visual of the song's message, but the EP in its entirety.  As my breakout to the world, it has to be the best it can be as it sets the tone for my entire music career.

","TOP OF THE WORLD!

Hello WORLD, my name is Timorris Lane, your Global Ambassador of Love. I'm a singer originally from Cleveland, OH, and currently live in the big apple, NYC. I've spent the last 6 months recording my debut album, an EP made up of 5 exclusive songs, and here I am, ready to shoot my first major music video.

My musical journey began, in my youth, singing in church with my entire family. This organic experience soon  blessed me with the opportunity to perform with the Cleveland Boy's Choir for over the span of a decade.  After school I moved to Atlanta, GA to pursue my first major moves with singing professionally. I started working with Nicci Gilbert from Brownstone, engaged some of my favorite producers, like B. Cox, and really began figuring out where my pace was within the industry.

My next focus was to relocate to Los Angeles, where I started showcasing my original music.  I was given opportunities to sing background for BeBe Winans, Glladys Knight, Rod Stewart, and there met and sang for one of my biggest musical influences, David Foster (that was CRAZY!!).  I left LA wanting to be closer to my family and to plugin to what NYC has to offer...and the rest is history!

I am extremely proud of the EP I am preparing to release. I  know you're going to love it and sync with my musics universal vibe.  I believe that it offers a variety of style, while still remaining at its core, honest and true to who I am and represent.

First and foremost, this campaign is to raise money for my premiere music video, simultaneously, connecting my fan base and supporters to my platform as a Global Ambassador of Love through my music.  This venture is super important because it propels not only the visual of the song's message, but the EP in its entirety.  As my breakout to the world, it has to be the best it can be as it sets the tone for my entire music career.     What We Need & What You Get Filming my breakout music video is going to take funding for the following:
Location
Videographer
Equipment
Production
Crew
Promotion

The bulk of the funding is going to securing an amazing director, location and all required equipment to execute my project from conception to completion. This includes a crew of devoted friends and supporters, as well as, additionally hiring a choreographer, stylist, and proper promotion.
Perks
Donations of any amount will instantly connect you to my movement as a Global Ambassador of Love.

Who doesn't dream of singing in Carnegie Hall?!

By giving to our campaign, you are helping to make that very dream come true for students of North Oldham High School.

  • The NOHS Choir will be performing in Carnegie Hall January 25, 2016.
  • The choir will be premiering a brand new composition by world renowned composer, Carol Barnett entitled, ""Mortals and Demons: A Bluegrass Te Deum.""  For more information on the piece and performance, visit http://bit.ly/NOHSCarnegie.
  • Our choir program is one of a few select programs from this region to premiere this piece that will feature 300 singers and be accompanied by Grammy-winning bluegrass artist, Dailey &
What We Need &
column2:
What You Get
  • Every performer that participates in this once in a lifetime opportunity is responsible for $1395.
  • The students in the NOHS Choir come from all walks of life.  For some, $1395 would be a very large burden on their family, for others an impossible expense to cover.  Your contribution will help assure that no student is unable to go to NYC because of financial issues.
  • We would love to offer thanks to our contributors.  Please see our list of perks to find ways to promote your company or score tickets to our spring musical, ""Monty Python's SPAMALOT!""

The Impact

Our goal in this campaign is to raise at least $5000.  By doing this, we will be covering a significant amount of funds for several of our students.  The more we raise, the more accessible we make quality educational experiences in the arts possible for our students.

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just cannot contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to promote our cause on social media!

Jan Kus Quartet Album Recording

Dear all,

My name is Jan Kus (pronounced Yan Koos), and I am a 27-year old Slovenian-born, New York City-based jazz saxophonist, composer, and arranger. I have performed throughout Europe (Slovenia, Croatia, Italy, The Netherlands, Belgium, Greece, Slovakia, Cyprus,...), and at various venues in New York, South Korea, and Puerto Rico, over the course of my career.

I have made New York my home for the last 3 years, and perform constantly on the city's jazz scene as a member of various projects, and as a bandleader of my own group, the Jan Kus Quartet. You can read more about me and my work at www.jankusmusic.com.

The Jan Kus Quartet, a group of some of the finest young musicians on the New York jazz scene (Sean Fitzpatrick - piano, Dan Martinez - double bass, Joel Mateo - drums), first got together in September 2013, to perform my original music that I have been writing since the time of my arrival to NYC. 
""Merging the influences from their various native cultures and living environments (the rhythmical complexities of the Balkans, the dancing joy of the South American musical traditions, and the backbeats of the streets of New York), this dedicated group of musicians strives to create its own unique musical landscape, taking the listener on a trip – physically, mentally, and spiritually. "" (more information about the band here - http://www.jankusmusic.com/jan-kus-quartet/)

It has been a true joy to watch over this last year, how the music developed to levels that I haven't even thought of myself, being the composer of most the pieces we perform.

That's why I think the time is right to finally create a snapshot in time, and record this music forever(!!), while it's still ""hot"". I feel we are amidst a really unique moment with this particular group of musicians, and I firmly believe that we can, together with your help, create a really unique album on the landscape of jazz music and music in general.


I have always believed music should be a people's thing, and this crowd-funding platform gives you a unique opportunity to connect with it even before the album is created. I see it as a wonderful exchange - you, the contributors, help us create the album, which we then in return give back to you.
The album will be co-produced by a NYC-based artist management company, Leitmotiv Arts, which will also provide some of the many interesting perks we have in store for you as a reward for your contribution (more on that in the Perks section).


I cannot tell you enough how much your support would mean to me and the whole band...
Seeing you contribute to the project will most definitely motivate me and my fellow musicians to give our 100% (if not MORE :) ) to every aspect of this project.

Let's work together and make this music come to life!!

Thank you,
Sincerely,

Jan Kus

What We Need &

COSTS

The money we are trying to raise will be used towards the following steps in the process of the creation of the album:
-Mixing
-Musicians' fees
-Creation of promotional materials
-Art work
-Printing of the album (of the disc itself)
-Publicity expenses

We are doing our best to keep all of these at a minimum, but believe us, 6500$ is really the minimum when you're trying to make all of that happen, especially at a level of high quality. 


REWARDS (PERKS)

In return for your generous contribution, we will reward you with some pretty unique and interesting perks, such as:
-Signed copies of the album
-Extra footage from rehearsal and the studio
-Concert tickets and hangout with the band
-Concert tickets for Carnegie Hall shows
-Private lessons
-Bonus tracks
-Private concerts

The Impact

By making this project come to life, you will help an up-and-coming band of very productive and dedicated musicians, at its most crucial moment. This album will open many doors to us, ranging from better performance opportunities, to increased public output, and it will eventually lead to much more music by this group of musicians in the future! Besides that, we will hopefully reach many of you throughout the time of this campaign, and motivate you to start following the band's activities, which will eventually, again, lead to a higher and better artistic contribution of these musicians to the world of music.
Risks &
column2:
Challenges

The biggest risk and challenge we are facing with this project is not reaching our set goal....

Me and other members of the band have a very wide network of friends and colleagues, spawning over 4 continents, so there is definitely enough people out there to make this happen. But, what we need now is ACTION*!
So please take the 5 minutes to make your contribution, and even if you contribute a small amount, I'm sure we can raise the 6500$ by the end of the campaign, if we all contribute at least a bit! (this is the beauty of crowd-funding campaigns in my opinion - people working together to help create something new and positive)

column1:
That's why it is even more important for us that you KEEP SPREADING THE WORD
about this project, even after you have made your contribution.

We are confident that we have a GREAT product and a great project. We thank you in advance for being a part of it.

In the event that we do not meet our target goal, we will endeavor to find the remaining balance from other sources, so you can be confident that your donation WILL MAKE a difference and help make our dream come true!
If we, however, exceed our set goal, I personally guarantee you that we will invest every last dollar collected into further promotion of this band and its music, as well as our future projects.

Thank you.

*We understand that there may be technical difficulties in making your financial contributions online, especially from abroad. If you encounter such difficulties or wish to discuss other ways to contribute, please contact our managing agent at LeitmotivArts@gmail.com

If you want to support this protection, but, for whatever reason, can't make a financial contribution, we're glad to let you know there are OTHER WAYS TO HELP THIS PROJECT! :)

This is a crowd-funding campaign - so, the bigger the crowd, the more funds we can potentially get. Please help us by spreading the word  - share the campaign link, forward the emails, and invite your friends to support the project. Your help would mean a lot to us!
Thank you.

Video Disclaimer: No instruments were harmed during the making of this video.
About the Santa Fe Youth Symphony Association
• The Santa Fe Youth Symphony Association (SFYSA), now in its 21st season, provides music instruction and performance opportunities to nearly 200 Santa Fe youth in orchestra, mariachi, and jazz.
• SFYSA strongly believes that ALL students should have the opportunity to participate in music education, regardless of their ability to buy or rent a string instrument.
Why We Need Your Help
<ul>
• Instruments and strings don't grow on trees, and...
• SFYSA spends over $6,000 annually on instrument repairs and instrument rentals so that our string students can have easy access to an instrument.
• Instruments are provided completely free of charge by SFYSA to students and we need your help to continue making this offer.
• SFYSA currently has nearly 200 instruments in its inventory, however, we are unable to use all of them because of lack of funds to make all necessary repairs.

• Because of the constant variation of students and instrument sizes, it is almost always necessary to rent instruments from outside providers. Thus, even if all SFYSA owned instruments were repaired, we would still require funds for instrument rentals.
Example of Expenses
<ul>
• Average monthly cost to rent ONE instrument: $30
• Average yearly cost for ONE student to use a rented instrument: $270 (average 12 per year)
• Single instrument replacement: $350-700 (average of 2 per year)
• Bow replacement: $50-80 (average of 10 bows per year)
• Bridge replacement: $70-$100 (average of 3 per year)
• Instrument repair (body work): $100-300 (average of 2 per year)
Perks! What You Get
<ul>

• We have put together a list of ""perks"", which are items and/or services that our organization can offer you with minimal expenses. Perks include everything from a year's worth of tickets to SFYSA concerts, to the opportunity to sing with our Mariachi groups, as well as your own private concert!
• You are also invited to donate ""just because"", you are not required to accept perk offers.
Can't Donate Online?
You can also submit a donation with a check. Please make checks out to ""SFYSA"" or ""Santa Fe Youth Symphony Association"" and mail to 1000 Cordova Pl. #190, Santa Fe, NM, 87505.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Help us by getting the word out and share our campaign with your friends.
• It's easy to share! Just find a share button on this page to post to Facebook, Twitter, email and other social media venues.
THANK YOU

Short Summary
Hi there. Welcome to my Indiegogo campaign.

My name is Tosin (aka Tosinger)  MA Arts Admin SCAD Grad Alum.  A dreamer and a go-getter. Since I graduated, I began to work on my creative talent of music while pursuing social entrepreneurship. I have not had a 9 to 5 and have been using my time and talent to give back. I am also an indie Afro~soul singer/songwriter based in Atlanta, Georgia (originally from Nigeria via the UK). I started working independently on a new album titled 'Organically Singing', a collection of fresh original  inspirational afrosoul music to kick off my non-profit 'Adopt A Guitar Inc' 2015 charity drive. I have however been stuck mid way of production for funding reasons. The proposed month of release is June 2015.This is where I need your help.
How much is needed and where it is going?
$2,750 to complete the production, studio time, mixing + mastering for the remaining 7 songs. I have been able to source funds and personally hustle for the 5 songs I have already recorded.
$1,250 for album printing, digital placement/marketing (material) and distribution

$1,000 for Adopt A Guitar Inc to buy flutes, acoustic guitars/ukuleles and small percussion instruments for super talented underprivileged students in select African schools (Last year as seen in the campaign video, I reached out to 'Playing For Change' as a partner, this year, I intend to partner with UR4Africa to give the gift of music) To learn more about the project please visit www.adoptaguitar.com
The Impact

Your contribution will go a long way in helping towards the completion of this awesome album, unique music which is being made for a good cause, to give hope, life, encourage those who otherwise are thinking of giving up, to give the much needed opportunity and platform for aspiring underprivileged talented young musicians in African countries who are so talented and need to be developed but do not have the means. Your support will help get the tools, these music instruments to  foster creativity, self-expression and self-respect for these great kids.

You give and in return, you get handmade goodies, downloads of great music, virtual hugs and the inspiring and valuable satisfaction that comes from the act of kindness. Who knows you might be empowering the next Jimi Hendrix or Michael Jackson :) . In the words of Mother Teresa ~

column2: >Every contribution helps. The work with Adopt A Guitar Inc never stops.

column1: <div><span style=""background-color: initial

>

Blessed are those who can give without remembering and receive without forgetting ~

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

I would appreciate if you would kindly also:

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Appreciations from the bottom of my heart.

Tosinger

www.tosinger.com

<h3 style=""text-align: center
<h3><span style=""font-weight: normal
column4: >For the fans of Sad Robot, you know much like Rome- we weren't built in a day.  We started by laying bricks.

column1: <h3><span style=""font-weight: normal
column4: >This band has been our passion and has encompassed our life for about 4 years. All those years of late night writing, and refining have led us to this point.

column1: <div><span style=""font-weight: normal
<h3><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px

column2: >Our hard work has resulted in 2 full length albums and multiple single releases, ,
column3: >management, several tv placements(FOX, ESPN), tours, SXSW, performing at the Staples Center, First place at LAMN Jam competition(previously won by Aloe Blacc, The Mowglis), #1 ON KROQ Locals only for 5 straight weeks, and more.

column2: >We've been able to do this all without the help of a label or any other support, just a love for creating music and occasionally cupcake fundraisers.

column8: > life changes occurred to us in 2014 which led us to write the most honest, challenging, and best group of songs
column10: > ever been able to produce. This is not just an album though, but our first ever story, combining our love of indie rock, orchestral music, dance, and film into one

column1: <h1 style=""font-size: 36px
<div><h4>
<span style=""font-weight: normal
column3: >We began to visualize the story of ROYAL BLOOD while
column4: >simulataneously writing the melodies and beats.
column6: >With the music and lyrics completed, we combined the two into a tragic, beautiful story of love and loss. An album inspired by our real lives with a short film .  This is a musical leap forward for us and the most inspired we've ever been in our lives.

column1: <div>
<b style=""font-size: 24px
<h3><span style=""font-size: 16px
column5: >Writing / recording the album and filming a beautiful short film is difficult enough, however- the real struggle is what happens after all that.  You need a fan base to engage, a budget for marketing your album, a PR team to make people aware of who you are, artwork, physical copies of your album, and TOURING.  All of this we need your help with so we can no longer say our dreams are impossible because of money or waiting for a label.

column1: "" I have never let myself be held down by challenges and have overcome anything I have set my mind to.  Which is why I am fully confident that your contribution to our album and full concept of ""Royal Blood""  will not only help us achieve our goals but your help in spreading the word of Sad Robot and our music will get us to that 'next level' all bands dream about"" - Katherine
The Impact

The impact you have on us is undeniable.  We write from the heart and our endless days of writing, recording and producing is not just for us- for self expression, but for our fans.  After 4 years of hard work and great payoffs-  this is not just another band who get together as friends- write together and in often times, break up when the struggle comes.  We have dealt with our share of success and struggle.  But that struggle creates even higher determination.  We believe in who we are and our message and our music and stand behind everything we do.  And for you and with you, we can do it together.
$10,000 is what we need for:
<ol>
<li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Mixing our album-  the album is done and recorded- now it's time to mix it

column1: <li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Physical copies of our album- digipack cd's as well as our first ever- Vinyl release

column1: <li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Royal Blood film- in our short film, we have a budget for gear rental, location rental and feeding our actors

column1: <li><span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Marketing and PR services-  help us get reviews, magazine mentions, radio play and more.  Everything you need to make the world know you exist.

column1: • Touring- travel expenses - lodging- gas- food- you name it
<li>Artwork-  you write &amp
column2: record an album- but someone has to design it

column1: • Merch- help us create some amazing merch to promote Royal Blood
What you get:

Besides being our true and dedicated fans and forever having our gratitude , check out the Perks section for a detailed list of what we can physically give you for your donations and time.  Even if you have little to offer, a small no perks contribution would help us as well.  
Thank you so much!

Other Ways You Can Help

Donations are absolutely amazing and everything we could hope for but spreading the word in building our fan base is the ultimate.  We would love your help in sharing our music and our cause and this campaign.  If you follow us on Facebook/Twitter/Youtube/Instagram-  we would love your help in getting the word out about us and our music and increase our Social Media status.  It's crowded out there so lets cut through the clutter together.  We would love a team of people to help make building Sad Robot their passion as much as it is ours.
","Sad Robot
For the fans of Sad Robot, you know much like Rome- we weren't built in a day.  We started by laying bricks.
This band has been our passion and has encompassed our life for about 4 years. All those years of late night writing, and refining have led us to this point.
BRIEF HISTORY

Our hard work has resulted in 2 full length albums and multiple single releases, , management, several tv placements(FOX, ESPN), tours, SXSW, performing at the Staples Center, First place at LAMN Jam competition(previously won by Aloe Blacc, The Mowglis), #1 ON KROQ Locals only for 5 straight weeks, and more.
We've been able to do this all without the help of a label or any other support, just a love for creating music and occasionally cupcake fundraisers.
WHERE WE ARE NOW

Some signifigant life changes occurred to us in 2014 which led us to write the most honest, challenging, and best group of songs we've ever been able to produce. This is not just an album though, but our first ever story, combining our love of indie rock, orchestral music, dance, and film into one artistic statement.
ROYAL BLOOD

We began to visualize the story of ROYAL BLOOD while simulataneously writing the melodies and beats. With the music and lyrics completed, we combined the two into a tragic, beautiful story of love and loss. An album inspired by our real lives with a short film .  This is a musical leap forward for us and the most inspired we've ever been in our lives.
The Challenge

Writing / recording the album and filming a beautiful short film is difficult enough, however- the real struggle is what happens after all that.  You need a fan base to engage, a budget for marketing your album, a PR team to make people aware of who you are, artwork, physical copies of your album, and TOURING.  All of this we need your help with so we can no longer say our dreams are impossible because of money or waiting for a label.

I have never let myself be held down by challenges and have overcome anything I have set my mind to.  Which is why I am fully confident that your contribution to our album and full concept of ""Royal Blood""  will not only help us achieve our goals but your help in spreading the word of Sad Robot and our music will get us to that 'next level' all bands dream about"" - Katherine
The Impact

The impact you have on us is undeniable.  We write from the heart and our endless days of writing, recording and producing is not just for us- for self expression, but for our fans.  After 4 years of hard work and great payoffs-  this is not just another band who get together as friends- write together and in often times, break up when the struggle comes.  We have dealt with our share of success and struggle.  But that struggle creates even higher determination.  We believe in who we are and our message and our music and stand behind everything we do.  And for you and with you, we can do it together.
What We Need & What You Get
$10,000 is what we need for:
Mixing our album-  the album is done and recorded- now it's time to mix it
Physical copies of our album- digipack cd's as well as our first ever- Vinyl release
Royal Blood film- in our short film, we have a budget for gear rental, location rental and feeding our actors
Marketing and PR services-  help us get reviews, magazine mentions, radio play and more.  Everything you need to make the world know you exist.
Touring- travel expenses - lodging- gas- food- you name it
Artwork-  you write & record an album- but someone has to design it
Merch- help us create some amazing merch to promote Royal Blood
What you get:

Besides being our true and dedicated fans and forever having our gratitude , check out the Perks section for a detailed list of what we can physically give you for your donations and time.  Even if you have little to offer, a small no perks contribution would help us as well.  Thank you so much!

Other Ways You Can Help Donations are absolutely amazing and everything we could hope for but spreading the word in building our fan base is the ultimate.  We would love your help in sharing our music and our cause and this campaign.  If you follow us on Facebook/Twitter/Youtube/Instagram-  we would love your help in getting the word out about us and our music and increase our Social Media status.  It's crowded out there so lets cut through the clutter together.  We would love a team of people to help make building Sad Robot their passion as much as it is ours.",6.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Los Angeles, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/sad-robot-royal-blood/pica

","Short Summary

Dave Pomfret’s music career really began at the age of 13 when he received his first electric guitar from his brother Rick. That gift, along with days & nights of hockey, baseball & dreams of girls led Dave to form The Munday Nuns in the mid-80’s with Gene Champagne, Mike Trebilcock & Erkki Raid. “The Nuns” rocked the Hamilton music scene.

Dave’s solo debut NO RUSH has garnered significant critical acclaim & high praise from Hamilton’s music community. This allowed him to be nominated for Male Artist of the Year & Folk/Roots Record of the Year at the 2009 Hamilton Music Awards.
But Dave has many more songs to share with the world and it looking for support to fund his upcoming album ""A Devil's Urge"".

What We Need & What You Get It would be great to get $5,000 to record ""A Devil's Urge"", including all the recording time, graphics and production of the album. A re-print of Dave's ""No Rush"" album will also be in the works.
Other Ways You Can Help If you aren't able to contribute financially to the project, please make some noise on social media and with your friends! Please share!",1.0,0,"1 Campaign

Fred Wesley Wants to Give You the Blues ...

...in a good way, with an irresistible album that was partially inspired by Bobby Blue Bland and will feature Fred's veteran band, massive Fred Wesley horn arrangements with a beefed up horn section and special guest blues artists.
I'm Joya Wesley, Fred's daughter and manager, asking all my fellow Fred lovers and music lovers for your financial participation in this exciting CD project.

The album represents a return to his roots and will celebrate the Blues with all that Fred is, all the experience he has acquired, and all the music he has made, heard and felt in the 55 years since he first left his home in Alabama to tour the chitlin' circuit as a 17-year-old sideman with Ike and Tina Turner.

About Fred
<div>

Fred Wesley is the legendary bandleader, trombonist and author revered worldwide as one of the founding fathers of funk, along with former colleagues James Brown, Pee Wee Ellis and George Clinton. He also is leader of the standard-setting band, the New JBs.

His critically-acclaimed memoir Hit Me, Fred: Recollections of a Side Man (Duke University Press, 2002) chronicles through hilarious stories a half-century of music through the eyes of one of the world’s most-sampled, yet most humble, musicians.

Born in Columbus, Ga., and raised in Mobile, Ala., Fred began his career as a teenage trombonist with Ike and Tina Turner. He later was music director, arranger, producer, trombonist and a primary composer for Brown from 1968-1975, when he joined Parliament-Funkadelic and Bootsy’s Rubber Band.

With Brown, Fred became  “the world’s most famous sideman, orchestrating the sinuous grooves and contributing the bold, surgically precise solos that defined the language of funk.” His distinctive sound as a trombonist and distinctive feel as an arranger later played into taking funk to the next level with George Clinton and Bootsy Collins.
<div>Fred has recorded a dozen solo albums including the cult favorite <i>House Party
column2: he is featured in the recent HBO documentary Mr. Dynamite, as well as Soul Power, the Oscar-winning When We Were Kings, and countless other funk documentaries and books. In addition to touring with his band, he makes numerous guest appearances and gives master classes around the world.

column1: Also a veteran of the Count Basie Orchestra, Fred has worked with scores of other artists including Ray Charles, Vanessa Williams, Pancho Sanchez, Dee Lite, Christian McBride and Donald Harrison. He also collaborated with clarinetist David Krakauer and the Canadian artist Socalled to create the klezmer-funk-hip hop project Abraham Inc.
About the album
<div>

""The first music I ever heard was the blues,"" Fred says in his book, recalling the juke box that played blues all night, just inches from his head, in the Blue Diamond Cafe, a juke joint right next door to his boyhood bedroom. ""The blues is the underpinning of all the music I have ever made.""

Although his first love -- jazz -- and the music that made him famous -- funk -- have dominated his life's work, he has harbored a love for old-school, silly-serious blues tunes like the Earl King classic ""Trick Bag,"" which he recorded in the '90s and frequently performs to this day.  He especially loved and was impacted by a Bobby Blue Bland release from his youth, Don't Cry No More, which featured fat horn arrangements by then-bandleader Joe Scott.

Fred's plan now is to take 13 such tunes -- both classics such as ""Big-Legged Emma's House"" and new compositions by Fred and friends in the same vein -- give them different blues rhythm arrangements, then add massive horn arrangements. Handling lead vocals himself in his own, inimitable Southern style, he will cut the tracks with the versatile musicians who have made up his New JBs for 25 years, along with the Chops Horns and other special guests.
Personnel:
Fred Wesley, lead vocals, trombone
Ernie Fields Jr., flute, tenor and/or bari sax
Phillip Whack, tenor sax
Gary Winters, trumpet
Bruce Cox, drums
Dwayne Dolphin, bass
Peter Madsen, piano
Reginald Ward, guitar
PLUS
Chops Horns
Surprise special guest blues artists
The production plan
<div>

The main recording session is tentatively scheduled for July. The  fundraising goal is $40,000  to cover recording costs including studio time, travel, musicians' fees, artwork and other post-production expenses.
Other Ways You Can Help
<div>

Whether or not you can make a donation, you can still help make this campaign a success by spreading the word. Talk it up in real life, and please use the Indiegogo share tools to help us make some noise on Facebook and Twitter. Thanks!

Whether or not you can make a donation, you can still help make this campaign a success by spreading the word. Talk it up in real life, and please use the Indiegogo share tools to help us make some noise on Facebook and Twitter. Thanks!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
