<h1>“<i>It's not about the Richter Scale
about the earthquake.”
My name is Dashel Millihart and I make Free Range Folk Rock.
That's music for folks to listen to when they want to feel good about
feeling good about being alive. All of the quotes you see here
are lyrics from songs I've come up with.  I am not alone in
calling this time, “The Platinum Era.” What else can we call a
time when the Best Things Ever are everywhere? “Going Platinum”
used to be something record sales did. “Going Viral” is the new
“Going Platinum.” The requirement is the same: touch a million

people.  I say this: ""Funk a million people.""  In fact, Funk the Platinum Era in the first place!  That's what I say.

“'Everything has been said,'
has been said.”
It's easy to feel worthless in the Platinum Era. Megalithic Hope
is up against the Best Desperation Ever as we struggle and wait and
fight over the little to do that remains. In the Platinum Era, going
above and beyond the call of duty is listed in the job requirements.
Minimum wage.  Infinite expectation.  Rockstars only, please.
<h3>“<i>'Nothing' really means
'Anything.'”
My way to get along isthis: I like to enjoy things. I like to endow
them with my joy. Things always gift me something too--especially
things that don't get enjoyed very often. In my thirty-three years on
earth, I have enjoyed enjoying things so much, I used to get wrapped
up and forget to enjoy myself. This made me sad for a long time even
though I didn't notice.
“Humility is the new pride.”
That's why I'm into singing. See, music is so good for you that,
when your singing, all you can do is enjoy yourself. I stick to
singing about truth so people can stick to loving the truth instead
of fixating on its “creator.” I didn't invent these ideas. I am a
translator, an explorer.
<h3>“<i>Everybody's issue is everybody
is you.”
The fact is, I don't feel so comfortable enjoying myself when I
think about people having a hard time enjoying themselves. This is
not a guilt thing. My joy is not made wrong by someone lacking
theirs. It is, however, lessened when it sees absence of joy. My joy
begs to curl up in my pocket, insisting the party hasn't started. She
tells me to wake her up when 70-year-old grasshoppers can afford to
survive the winter without taking out the trash for ants with hills
near picnic tables.
<h3>“<i>No matter who you murder,
you're gonna be you for the rest of your life.”
Getting ahead is so important--and so visible--in the Platinum
Era, that it's easy to stay on guard. Doing something as simple as
pulling in front of me in traffic will trigger my sense that you have
cut in line on my journey to, like, “Get Mine.” I have to hate
proof that I'm falling behind. I do my best to remember I really have
it easy, but I do get angry, despite my being clever.  I
hear-tell America is addicted to pharmaceuticals...seems to me we're
addicted to winning. I sure as hell am. I'm so addicted to winning, I
want everybody on this planet doing it at the same time.
<h3>“<i>The only way to bring the
whole world to its knees is to do, do, do, do, do: the right thing.”
The fastest way to make yourself a winner is to make someone a
loser. I'll admit it, all along I let my subconscious do my dirty
work. It never does work out though.  One day someone makes you
the loser and then you pile on yourself right after, realizing you deserve
it.  Well, you're wrong, alleged loser.  The truth is, the
only losers out there are people who want other people to be
losers. The only lazy folks out there are folks too lazy to
understand what's really behind the death of motivation.
<h3>“<i>Who wants to worship
sacrifice?
<h3><i>You've got the sunset in your
I've worked full-time jobs for a decade while I supported a
boutique recording career that made me no money. It kept my soul
alive but it assaulted my spirit to make things I loved on the side,
like a thought-crime. I put my heart into a day job whose
expectations quickly crept into my life until I had so little room
left that I felt I had to choose between creating music with
integrity or selling it well.
...Truth is perpetual sunrise.
Why? The Truth is Love.”
At least, I thought I had a choice. By spending all my time
creating, I've kept this music from this world. I've kept these
spirits waiting. Besides, this music needs production. These songs
are dank, funky, my best work ever. I believe these songs are music
that, if done right, you will dance to. To fulfill their potential, I
am asking you to pay me to do this work. My two most recent albums
are free at dashel.com. I'd like this one to be free, too...but to
eat the foods and pay people to work, this time I'm going to need
you.
""Summer is on the way.""
I have made this campaign Flex-Funding because I'm going to record
it whether I can pay for musicians and studio time or not. I have
spent three years writing these careful, direct assaults on my own
self-ignorance, and I plan to take a full month to record them. This
will happen in October. November we mix and master. CDs ship in
December. It's an aggressive goal but a timeline that takes advantage
of being funded. If the funding goal is not achieved, I expect to
have discs in your hands on the morning of April 1, 2016. I am
sufficiently equipped, myself, to manage decent recordings. I have
sources who will work for free. This means I HAVE TO pay them.
My budget is simple ($):
Taking as an unknown variable the exact cost of goods of perk
fulfillment (P), I have built that cost into each perk to guarantee
it affords its own passage. However, the final value will remain
unknowable until the campaign ends and I tally the specific perks,
which have disparate margins. Any money disbursed before the end of
the campaign will have its cost of goods individually set aside, and
only those expenses that are vitally necessary or temporally
advantageous will be undertaken during the campaign. Suffice it to
say for the budget, perk fulfillment is the first and highest
priority, subtracted immediately.
With what remains after setting aside for fulfillment, I will
split the figure at the golden ratio, taking the smaller portion for
my fee (F) (at fully funded by average perk levels this should be
about $4000.00). The larger portion (same conditions, about $7300.00)
will, after setting aside 15% (or $1000) for mastering (M) and 15%
(or $1000) to buffer emergency cost overruns (E), be used as
operational funds (O) and paid to artists, engineers, studios, and
other necessary collaborators as it suits the organic nature of the
recording process. I will make it work with whatever you entrust to
me and I have built this budget dynamically, on proportions that I
will apply universally. Here are some equations for those proportions
It is my desire to pay people what they are worth and that
includes myself this time. For those who contribute on the $1000.00
and above level, you are buying a certain level of input already, and
I will give authentic audience to your suggestions.
If you have read all of the above and are still reading now, I am
privileged that you did so. Our paths have cross'd, now, anyways. Why
not give in and give, yo? Thank you.

two different 18th c. French cellos and a modern American instrument. Currently
I am using a beautiful Czech instrument made by Karel Vavra. These
instruments have been good friends to me and I know I would not be where I am
today had I not had access to these cellos. However, in August my loan
will expire and I will need to return my current cello to its owner. Without my
own instrument to fall back on, and with not enough funds to secure my own
instrument, I am hoping to find an audience willing to assist me in raising the

column5: >Musicians often speak of the relationship they form with their instrument

column1: for the cellist, the process is much like building a relationship with another
person. Like a human relationship, the quality of the workmanship has much to
do with the success. Professional-grade cellos are hand-carved from the finest
select woods, carefully crafted by skilled artisans over several months. To
bring out the best in such an instrument, the musician spends countless hours
perfecting his craft, developing the proper way to hold the bow as well as his
fingers in order to produce an exact sound. He learns from the examples of his
mentors, he listens carefully to their instruction, and he dedicates himself to
being the best he can be.

column5: > Cellist and cello learn how they communicate with and relate to each

column1: other. The musician trains his ear to listen to the instrument’s musical
response.  There are other aesthetics, the cut of the wood, the color of
varnish, and the pattern used by the luthier that can result in an immediate
attraction—or lack thereof—to an instrument.  But the way it resonates,
the “personality” of the instrument, is found in the sonic qualities that
result when played by a particular musician.  Is it rich, dark, sonorous,
or brilliant?  All of these come from playing the cello and learning its
voice.  Like people, no two instruments have the same personality.
it sometimes takes patience to find the right match.  It is important for
the musician to learn the qualities of the instrument with which he wants to
spend his professional life.

fundraising concert and what ever I am able to raise here will be added to
that. I am fortunate to have a fine bow, so the cello is my sole need.

column5: >How much does a professional grade cello cost?

column1: question that is very difficult to answer! Like many artists, I’ve often
dreamed of performing on an old Italian instrument and I am fortunate to have
had the immense pleasure of playing on several Stradivarius cellos. However,
the incredible scarcity and beauty of these instruments forces their prices to
greatly exceed any reasonable sum for a musician— selling for millions of
dollars (with new records being set every year). Even the cost of insuring such
an investment is beyond the ability of great artists. Great modern instruments
vary in price from $40,000 to $100,000, which I believe are often the best choice
for a young musician.

<div>
","Hi! My name is Philip and I am a
cellist-- a cellist in immediate need. As I put the finishing touches on my
doctoral degree from the Eastman School of Music I am preparing to embark on an
exciting journey as a classically-trained professional cellist.
And almost all the pieces are set in
place: I graduated with distinction from the Cleveland Institute of Music and
Eastman School of Music (where I was awarded the coveted Performer's
Certificate and earned a certificate in Art Leadership and Entrepreneurship),
have been recognized in both national and international competitions, had the pleasure
of performing across three continents (including appearances in Carnegie Hall,
the Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts, and famed halls in Berlin, Germany
and Yokohama, Japan) , and recently accepted work as the Assistant Principal
cellist of the Palm Beach Symphony and cellist for the Broadway Across America
tours. On a personal note, I've met, and married, a beautiful violinist to perform alongside and we have recently welcomed a son into our lives.
Yet one major element of my career is still uncertain-- I am a cellist without
a cello!
Twelve years ago, I was awarded a
scholarship through a private non-profit organization that provided me with
access to very good instruments. Through that scholarship I have greatly
benefited from being able to play on a number of different cellos including,
two different 18th c. French cellos and a modern American instrument. Currently
I am using a beautiful Czech instrument made by Karel Vavra. These
instruments have been good friends to me and I know I would not be where I am
today had I not had access to these cellos. However, in August my loan
will expire and I will need to return my current cello to its owner. Without my
own instrument to fall back on, and with not enough funds to secure my own
instrument, I am hoping to find an audience willing to assist me in raising the
funds necessary to secure a professional-grade instrument.
Through the exciting and modern
concept of crowdfunding, I hope to offer a unique an personal way to support my
music-making. Any contribution, no matter how small can make a meaningful impact
that will last an entire career. In exchange, every supporter will have a stake
in my project and benefit by exposure to beautiful music.
Building
a relationship
Musicians often speak of the relationship they form with their instrument
for the cellist, the process is much like building a relationship with another
person. Like a human relationship, the quality of the workmanship has much to
do with the success. Professional-grade cellos are hand-carved from the finest
select woods, carefully crafted by skilled artisans over several months. To
bring out the best in such an instrument, the musician spends countless hours
perfecting his craft, developing the proper way to hold the bow as well as his
fingers in order to produce an exact sound. He learns from the examples of his
mentors, he listens carefully to their instruction, and he dedicates himself to
being the best he can be.
Cellist and cello learn how they communicate with and relate to each
other. The musician trains his ear to listen to the instrument’s musical
response.  There are other aesthetics, the cut of the wood, the color of
varnish, and the pattern used by the luthier that can result in an immediate
attraction—or lack thereof—to an instrument.  But the way it resonates,
the “personality” of the instrument, is found in the sonic qualities that
result when played by a particular musician.  Is it rich, dark, sonorous,
or brilliant?  All of these come from playing the cello and learning its
voice.  Like people, no two instruments have the same personality.
As in personal relationships,
it sometimes takes patience to find the right match.  It is important for
the musician to learn the qualities of the instrument with which he wants to
spend his professional life.
I am attempting to raise $35,000,
which I understand is a large sum of money. However, with modern cellos being
sold for $45-$100K, the amount I am raising is only a portion of the costs
involved. To date, I have secured $10,000 through my own savings and
fundraising concert and what ever I am able to raise here will be added to
that. I am fortunate to have a fine bow, so the cello is my sole need.
I certainly do not believe that I
should be offered something for nothing. I am working tirelessly to offer
worthwhile and meaningful perks to anyone that is able to assist me towards my
goal.
It
is impossible to underestimate the importance each of my supporters plays in
may career.
Frequently
Asked Questions
How much does a professional grade cello cost?
This is a very good
question that is very difficult to answer! Like many artists, I’ve often
dreamed of performing on an old Italian instrument and I am fortunate to have
had the immense pleasure of playing on several Stradivarius cellos. However,
the incredible scarcity and beauty of these instruments forces their prices to
greatly exceed any reasonable sum for a musician— selling for millions of
dollars (with new records being set every year). Even the cost of insuring such
an investment is beyond the ability of great artists. Great modern instruments
vary in price from $40,000 to $100,000, which I believe are often the best choice
for a young musician.
What other expenses are
there?

$75 to re-hair a cello bow (normally needed three times yearly)                             $100 three months of instrument insurance                                                                  $300 for a new set of cello strings (recommended twice yearly)                            $500 for a replacement bridge                                                                                       $2,500 for a cello case                                                                                                    $5,000
average modern bow
Full price - for a plane ticket to travel with your cello                                                    (and no, Delta won’t let you collect the miles for your wooden friend!)
Other
Ways You Can Help
I
certainly understand that not everyone can contribute financially.
Anything you can do to get the word out and share news of
my campaign! Please use a link to spread the words to other music lovers.
""Like"" us on Facebook and invite other to do the same!
Visit our websites: www.duo-b.com and www.philipborter.com

Short Summary

Urban Coyote is a collaboration that began between vocalist Emily Florence Dykes and drummer Allyson Rogers. Longtime friends, Emily and Allyson are FINALLY making a record together despite living on opposite ends of the continent!
If that wasn't exciting enough, Grammy-nominated jazz legend Jelsa Palao will be producing the vocals in Los Angeles and SINGING ON THE ALBUM with us. (What??!) Yes, it's going to be amazing.

We'll be recording several of Jelsa's original songs, reimagined in bossa/samba styles, as well as under appreciated Latin-jazz classics like Universo au Meu Redor, Agua de Berber, and Dindi. Emily will fly to Ottawa to record the instrumental tracks with some of Ottawa's finest musicians, Jelsa will attend the Canadian sessions via the magic of Skype, then the two singers will lay down the vocal tracks back in LA, with Jelsa in the producer's seat.
The flights are booked, studio time is reserved, and the musicians are hired, so help us make it happen!!
What We Need &

Canada studio time: $1,800
Session musicians: $2,000
Engineers: $1,000
Photographer: $100
Em flight from LA to Ottawa: (Gifted - thanks mumzie!!)
LA studio time: $1,000
Cover art, design and replication: $850
Mechanical license fees: $250
Mastering: $1,000
<div>
PERKS:
$10 - Digital Download of the Album
$25 - The CD (w/ shipping to U.S. or Canada)
$50 - Two copies of the CD, plus the digital download the day it is released (w/ shipping to U.S. or Canada)
$100 - Signed copy of the CD, plus a special thank you on the record (w/ shipping to U.S. or Canada)
$250 - Signed copy of the CD (w/ shipping to U.S. or Canada), a special thank you on the record, and a live Skype sneak peek performance of one of the songs as we record it!
$500 - Signed copy of the CD (w/ shipping to U.S. or Canada), a special thank you on the record, and a live youtube video cover of a song of your request, dedicated to you!
$1,000 - Signed copy of the CD (w/ shipping to U.S. or Canada), an executive producer credit PLUS a special thank you on the record.

$2,500 - Any song of your request recorded and mastered in studio by the group, PLUS an executive producer credit, a signed copy of the CD (w/ shipping to U.S. or Canada) and a special thank you on the record.

$5,000 - We will write and professionally record a song specifically for you or for someone you love, PLUS an executive producer credit, a signed copy of the CD (w/ shipping to U.S. or Canada) and a special thank you on the record.
$10,000 - House Concert with full band anywhere in North America, plus an executive producer credit, a signed copy of the CD (w/ shipping to U.S. or Canada) and a special thank you on the record.

The Impact

To record music that you love with talented and dear friends is a special experience. To record with Jelsa Palao is an honor. For the world to hear her re-envision a tune with some of Canada's finest players is a GIANT once-in-a-lifetime gift—we would love to share that gift with you!
Risks &
column2:
Challenges

Yep, it's wildly ambitious! We are recording across borders and at great distance, across generations, across different backgrounds, and all within a tight timeline. It's a challenge we are all absolutely up for and truly excited to tackle! While the most daunting hurdle in this journey has been to secure the funds we need to turn this exciting prospect into a reality, we have to say, we are thrilled to know some wonderful people who are willing to help us make this happen! Thank you in advance for being one of those special people, for your generosity and support of the arts!

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

We know not all of you can afford to help, but we'd love for you to share our campaign with friends you think might like to hear what we are creating! Thank you in advance!! :)

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div> <h3>
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px

My name is Matt Allen and I front the band Hazmatt. I started the band while living in Lahaina, Maui, Hi and started it again with new members in Encinitas, San Diego when I moved back home. We've been playing for several years all over San Diego, Orange County, and even a little down in Mexico. In 2008 I rushed a quick debut EP just to get something out there to help us book shows. I've never really been stoked on that. I started this campaign because last year Hazmatt got in the studio again with some real material we are proud and passionate about but we were only able to finish one single out of the 6 song EP. The band and I fund the project with the majority being funded by myself. Last year my lady left my daughter and I and I have been a full-time single parent since then with no extra money to spare and this project stuck on indefinite hold. I play music because I love it, it makes me happy, and helps me feed my daughter and I. This new album is very important to us, as we all contributed to writing the songs and we think they are the best we've got to offer. We'd love to get them out there for better or for worse to share or work with our family and friends and hopefully help further our musical endeavor by helping us to book more gigs and tours and help me to possibly give my daughter a better life through the music I love to play.

Our Goal

We aimed for the low end of what we need. We spent several grand just finishing the single so this is a conservative number actually. Here are the costs associated with finishing the EP:

  • Recording at LA Lounge Studios is $50 an hour and that's a bargain considering we get two for one in that our sound engineer also offers great production on the songs. We have drums and bass tracked on all songs. We need to track guitar, percussion, keyboards, some horns, and vocals. As another conservative estimate we're probably looking at: 10 hours to finish guitar on 5 songs, 7.5 hours for percussion on 5 songs, 5 hours to finish keys on 5 songs, maybe 1 hour for horns, and roughly 10 hours for vocals on 5 songs. that adds up to roughly 34 hours of just recording time if we work quickly and at a good pace. Let's say that's $1,675 give or take for recording. 
  • Mixing and mastering each song is generally around $250 per song for the mix and master.
  • It's $35 per song or $89 per album for digital distribution through CD Baby.

• It's $995 for 1,000 packaged CD's in jewel cases with inserts. 

    • The Impact

    We are so proud of this new album and the songs we've written together as a band. Everyone in the band is a family man with children and we love music, but we also depend on the extra income we get for playing gigs. Not only will this album be great for us to be able to release for friends and family in just an artistic sense of completing a project we love, it will also help increase the opportunity of us getting better exposure with a better recording. This new album can potentially help us receive more radio and media exposure as well as open more doors to bigger gigs and festivals and touring. We'd love to be able to travel and spread our music to a larger audience and also help feed our families doing what we love. This is the first time we've attempted a venture like this, as we have always done it on our own and I have personally funded almost all the band's recording and traveling on my own. I'm in a situation where I cannot do it on my own anymore and I don't want to give up. We've been getting great feedback from the only single released off the album so far which has already helped us get one tour and some small local radio play. We're ready to take it to the next level!

    Risks &
column2:
Challenges

The only real risks we face with this project is going over budget and getting stuck again. The good part is with this funding campaign and my other business picking up, I believe we can get it done and if this funding is not enough I will be able to personally make up the difference on my own within the next several months.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know everyone isn't in the position to give money but there are many other ways to lend support:

  • Spread the word and share our campaign with your friends and family that may be able to help.
  • Donate goods that we can add as perks to the campaign funders.

column1: • Book us to play a show and we can put that money towards the project.
• Pass us on to friends that may need a band for an event. We play reggae, rock, hip-hop, dub and much more so we can literally play to almost any crowd.

Hi Everybody. My name is Mike Geraghty and I am a songwriter. I am an independent artist and I've written over 1,000 songs. It is my dream to create a truly world class recording of my songs with live, living, breathing, brilliant musicians. I have had the good fortune of connecting with some great folks via social media over the last couple years and had great feedback for my songs.

"" Mike Geraghty is a strong, inspiring, unique, authentic and smart song writer. His message goes right to the heart.""
 -Alvin Taylor (Drummer, Producer, Musical Director)

""Great! I hope the world hears you!"" -Dave Stewart (The Eurythmics)

""Really great tribute to George Harrison"" - Steve Lukather (Toto)

"" Mike Geraghty delivers strong confident vocal melodies that come right
out and grab you."" - Paul Myers (Author,  musician, songwriter)
column6:
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">

""Still with you (A tribute to George Harrison)""
column11:
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">

And now, the great Alvin Taylor, drumming legend (see video)wants to help me take everything to the next level. He wants to help me produce a world class recording with premiere musicians. Alvin's history in the industry is mind boggling. Have a read of his interview in the April 2014 issue of Modern Drummer.

http://www.moderndrummer.com/site/2014/03/drummer-alvin-taylor-interview/#_

I am humbled and blown away by Alvin's desire to help me bring my music to the world. I am going to put my heart, soul, blood, sweat and tears into making this the most honest and beautiful recording possible.

What I need and what you get.

My friends and fellow artists, I need your help. Please check out the Perks posted and select one that appeals to  you and help me to bring my songs to the world. I know how hard things can get sometimes so if you can't afford to donate please give me the gift of sharing my campaign with your friends and family.

Alvin has generously put forward his Gold Record that he earned for his work on George Harrison's ""Thirty three and a third"" album as a perk. An amazing piece of music history!


Your generous donations will be used as follows:

- $25,000 Studio time, producer, engineer and session musicians, recording, mixing and mastering
-  $5,000 Travel and accommodation for recording and promotional tour
- $5,000 Manufacturing of CD's
- $3,000 Music Video
- $2,000 Publicist and Promoter (Radio, Television and live Tour)

The Impact.

I believe that music lifts the heart and brings happiness to us even when things seem the darkest. Your support of my music and this art will make you a part of a new and wonderful creation with some of the most amazing artists in the history of the modern music industry. Alvin Taylor who has worked with George Harrison, Elton John, Bill Withers, Little Richard and Jimmy Hendrix to name a few.  Paul Warren, session and touring guitarist for Rod Stewart, Tina Turner, Joe Cocker, The Temptations. These are the artists that your donations will enable me to work with to create a stellar recording for the world to hear!
column16:
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">

Paul Warren (session and touring guitarist extraordinaire for Rod Stewart, Joe Cocker.etc.,) said about ""Empty"" (see video above): ""I listened to the first tune. Now I can't stop singing it."" I will write on the wall""."" I was here"". ""And I will walk round in circles"" keeps running through my head.""
http://thepaulwarrenproject.com/

Risks and Challenges.

$40,000 is certainly not an easy number to raise. I know beyond a doubt with your help it will get done.
All of the people and players involved point to great success on this project.
I am dedicated with everything I am to seeing this dream become reality and I know beyond a doubt with your help it will get done. Let's do this!!!

Spread the word.

Please share share share this campaign.

Thank You

Thank you all for participating in this dream and helping me to make it a reality.
This is going to be Beyond Awesome!!!

We cut Stereo Vinyl records with a Vinyl Lathe.
UPDATE: JUNE 18th 2016
WE ARE UP AND RUNNING! We've cut over 800 records since July 2015 and it is going really well.
You can read our five star reviews  at www.superspecificvinyl.com and www.vinylondemand.com and place an order for a one off and short run vinyl records.
---
Making records this way allows us to do extremely short runs of an album or single.
The sound quality and durability of the records is excellent.

At this time we do not do artwork - we just make records - however, every record comes with an unprinted (blank) jacket that you can Screen Print or draw on (or whatever). It will also have unprinted (blank) white labels on it.
We are currently doing all of our cutting on one lathe.
The lathes cost around $8,000 each.
Our aim is to raise enough money in this campaign to buy 2 more lathes.
<h3><span style=""font-size: 16px
<h3><span style=""font-size: 16px
column4: >These things are not made clear in some of the perks!:

column1: <div><span style=""font-size: 16px
column4: >** Mastering the songs for vinyl is included in the price **

column1: <div><span style=""font-size: 16px
column4: >** If you buy 2 or more records with the SAME music on them we will print labels for $1.00 per record - let us know if you want this when you send us your files **

column1: <div>
<span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >When you make a pledge (buy a perk) you have also reserved a place in the 'Production Schedule' (or queue) for that perk -

column1: <div><i style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Later we will send you an email confirmation with directions about sending us the necessary song files.

column1: If you do not have your files ready when your place in the queue comes up, that's no problem. When we receive your files we will put you back in the queue.
We ask only that you get your files to us within 12 months.
<h3><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<div>
<i style=""font-size: 24px
<i><span style=""font-weight: normal

What does this mean?

It means You could have us cut your best mixtape or playlist to vinyl and then you can throw it on your turntable (or give it to a friend) .

It means You could buy a ""greatest hits"" album of your favorite songs from your  favorite band(s)  -  you choose the bands,  you choose the songs and  you choose the order they play in.

It means if You are in a band or own a small record label you could order 10 copies of your album(s) on vinyl and put them up for sale - when you sell those 10 you could order 10 more.

It means if You are a record collector you could have us cut copies of the vinyl that is too precious to play but too good not to play.

It means You could write a song for your girlfriend, boyfriend or crush, record it on your phone, email us the file and we'll put it on a 7"" 45 and send it to him/her directly. 

 

It means, well, we haven't thought of everything it means but you get the idea...
BACK STORY:

This whole thing started because we have a small record label and we wanted to release some of our back catalog on Vinyl. We searched high and low for someone who would do small runs of records for us. . During this search we came across the DIY Lathe community and decided to get involved. We figured if we owned our own Lathe we could cut records as needed or ""on demand"" which is just what we did. 

It took us about a year to get the machine set up properly and learn how to consistently cut a good sounding record. During that time we cut many, many, test records while we experimented with and probed every parameter and variable involved in the process.

Since then we have cut and sold a bunch of our own 12"" records and 7"" 45's.

And then we thought ""we should allow our customers to put together their own  ""Greatest Hits"" album from the music in our catalog""

So we did, and they really loved it!

And Then we thought ""we should offer to cut 12"" records and 7"" 45's of peoples favorite mix tapes and playlists"".

And then  we thought ""we should offer this service to other small record labels and bands""

And then we thought ""we'll need money to buy more Record Lathes"".

And then we thought ""This is a perfect Crowd Funding kind of situation, let's try Crowd Funding this business idea on IndieGoGo""
column4:
>So here we are.

Super Specific Vinyl on Demand

                                                         ************

Concerning COPYRIGHT protected material and our contract with you:

We are not selling music, we are selling a service.

You must own a legal copy or be the legal owner of all copyrighted material you send to SSVOD. 

""The purpose of The Audio Home Recording Act of 1992 (AHRA) is to ensure the right of consumers to make analog or digital audio recordings of copyrighted music for their private, noncommercial use."" S. Rep. 102-294, at *86 (emphasis added). The Act does so through its home taping exemption, see 17 U.S.C. S 1008, which ""protects all noncommercial copying by consumers of digital and analog musical recordings, "" H.R. Rep. 102-873(I), at *59

Two reports by the House of Representatives characterize the provision as legalizing digital home copying to the same degree as analog. One states ""in the case of home taping, the exemption protects all noncommercial copying by consumers of digital and analog recordings,"" and the other states ""In short, the reported legislation [Section 1008] would clearly establish that consumers cannot be sued for making analog or digital audio copies for private noncommercial use.""

 

","We cut Stereo Vinyl records with a Vinyl Lathe.

column1: UPDATE: JUNE 18th 2016
WE ARE UP AND RUNNING! We've cut over 800 records since July 2015 and it is going really well.
You can read our five star reviews  at www.superspecificvinyl.com and www.vinylondemand.com and place an order for a one off and short run vinyl records.
Making records this way allows us to do extremely short runs of an album or single.
The sound quality and durability of the records is excellent.

At this time we do not do artwork - we just make records - however, every record comes with an unprinted (blank) jacket that you can Screen Print or draw on (or whatever). It will also have unprinted (blank) white labels on it.
We are currently doing all of our cutting on one lathe.
The lathes cost around $8,000 each.
Our aim is to raise enough money in this campaign to buy 2 more lathes.
These things are not made clear in some of the perks!:
** Mastering the songs for vinyl is included in the price **
** If you buy 2 or more records with the SAME music on them we will print labels for $1.00 per record - let us know if you want this when you send us your files **
When you make a pledge (buy a perk) you have also reserved a place in the 'Production Schedule' (or queue) for that perk - first come, first served.
Later we will send you an email confirmation with directions about sending us the necessary song files.
If you do not have your files ready when your place in the queue comes up, that's no problem. When we receive your files we will put you back in the queue.
We ask only that you get your files to us within 12 months.

We have had to change our approach regarding securing travel and content capture costs for the project we have been promoting.   If you have already provided your donation no worries and thank you.  You can also donate on this  Indiegogo at the link generally to the SongCatchers Arts Fund and be aware that our priority for this funding is in fact to cover the costs of the trip and content capture we have been promoting.  We must respect the rules the 80th Birthday summit PR people and event organizers have required of us as of today May 28, 2015.  

Thank you for your patience.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div> <h3>The Who &amp
Those of you who know me know that I've been writing and performing music for over 20 years, and that my music is my life. But enough about me.

Thanks to the efforts of crowd funders like you, I was able to finish my 2013 Tennessee album and gain some radio traction in Europe. It made it up to #5 on the Euro Americana radio charts. and finished 2013 at #16. As a result, I am embarking on my first ever European tour this fall, and plan to present this new mini EP to fans and radio programmers as my newest work.
The band and I had a bit of studio time on our hands this past fall and we cut some songs we're really proud of. Sometimes a window just opens up and you're able to get something done.
This $2000 will go to the mixing of the EP by Joe Costa (Ben Folds, Brendan Benson, Ke$ha), the production by Chris Tench, the mastering, as well as a limited run of physical copies.

Your ability to preorder a copy, or multiple copies, means the world to me. Without fan support, attempting to survive in the 2015 musical climate is almost a pointless endeavor. By expanding our audience this fall in Europe, we hope to widen our network and ultimately produce another full length CD in 2016.
We &
column2:
You

We've done most of the heavy lifting thus far - writing, rehearsing, recording... We just need it to sound right, which is where the great mix and mastering engineers come in. This small EP is simply a brief and humble snapshot in time, and all I want is to do it justice, and share it with the world.

column1: For your various levels of investment, we will send you download links as soon as the mastering is done
column3: I will do an acoustic Skype set for you
column4: we will put you in the credits... We improvise as well: you just ask, we'll (try to) do.

column1: Mostly though, if 200 people each preorder 1 copy, our goal will be met. All we are looking to do is sell the art we believe in.

*Last but not least: every $500 in excess will be put towards recording more songs for the EP. In other words, if we were to raise $3000, it just went from being a 4 song EP to a 6 song EP. $5000? Now we're starting to talk about a full record. The songs are sitting here waiting to eventually be cut, and in our perfect world we would go in and cut an album's worth. The power is truly with the people. At the same time, meeting our mini EP goal is absolutely first and foremost.

Not really in a position to buy an EP just yet? Hey, I get it! Sometimes all I can do is bring in yesterday's cup and ask for a refill. If you believe in music and want to help out, however, just post this page on your social media, or tell some friends about it. Visit our BAND PAGE to learn more about David Newbould &
column2: The Stowaways. Check out my Tennessee EPK from my last successful crowd funding project. There are all kinds of ways to share the story and help us reach our goal. Each and every small step counts immeasurably.
>That's all there is to it. We hope to see you up the road.

The Project

A team of talented musicians and I will step into Spyro's Modern Music and Recording Studio in Reading, PA on August 17th, 2015 to record my first EP of original songs. These songs are from my heart and have been in the making for the past 10 years.  This project is hopefully the first of many and your support will make it possible.
Back Story

When I was a little girl, I had a strong sense of being deeply loved.  That knowledge gave me courage and a sense of identity. As I grew older, as many of us do, I lost that truth.  I began to write songs about this season of my life, not realizing their future impact and the potential these songs had to reach people who might misunderstand God as Father. These songs started as questions or conversations but soon I realized that someone was talking back. God was talking back. He wanted me to experience Him as Father, to be restored, and to receive His love and grace. This is the Father EP project. This is my story. My hope is that these songs would draw you closer to the heart of the Father.
The Team

My team consists of: co-producer and pianist Lars Pottieger, Sakae drummer Larry Marshall, trumpet player Bob Meashey, The GrooveYard's bassist Louis Rieger, cellist Colin Hartwick, violinist Stephanie Bonk, guitarist John Anthony Seitz, videographer Andres Torres, and countless friends, family and supporters.
The Cost

Creating beautiful music that is well recorded, mixed and mastered is not easy or inexpensive.  All of the funds that are raised will go directly to the production costs of the album.  These costs include: studio time, mixing, mastering, paying the musicians, charting and producing the songs, videography and photography,  manufacturing and printing the CDs, physical and digital distribution, shipping costs and fulfilling the perks.
<div>
<div>
<span style=""font-size: 30px
<div>

When I survey our culture, I see many who are fatherless.  It is an epidemic and sadly, most people begin to view God the Father in ways that are unhealthy and untrue.  As adults, our views and opinions about God are heavily fortified behind walls that prevent us from experiencing God as a loving Father.   My vision for this project is to present a fresh perspective on God as Father.
How You Can Help

Chose a perk that excites you and help me spread the word about this project by linking this campaign through your blog or social media outlet.   Post this on your Facebook, Twitter and Instagram to let those in your world know about this project! Help me spread the word, raise support and fill the world with this music.

The Team

My team consists of: co-producer and pianist Lars Pottieger, Sakae drummer Larry Marshall, trumpet player Bob Meashey, The GrooveYard's bassist Louis Rieger, cellist Colin Hartwick, violinist Stephanie Bonk, guitarist John Anthony Seitz, videographer Andres Torres, and countless friends, family and supporters.
The Cost

Creating beautiful music that is well recorded, mixed and mastered is not easy or inexpensive.  All of the funds that are raised will go directly to the production costs of the album.  These costs include: studio time, mixing, mastering, paying the musicians, charting and producing the songs, videography and photography,  manufacturing and printing the CDs, physical and digital distribution, shipping costs and fulfilling the perks.
Vision

When I survey our culture, I see many who are fatherless.  It is an epidemic and sadly, most people begin to view God the Father in ways that are unhealthy and untrue.  As adults, our views and opinions about God are heavily fortified behind walls that prevent us from experiencing God as a loving Father.   My vision for this project is to present a fresh perspective on God as Father.
How You Can Help

Chose a perk that excites you and help me spread the word about this project by linking this campaign through your blog or social media outlet.   Post this on your Facebook, Twitter and Instagram to let those in your world know about this project! Help me spread the word, raise support and fill the world with this music.",1.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Reading, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-father-ep-project/pica

column1: My Story
<div>

I started on the Montreal Blues scene in 1997 playing various venues and doing some festivals. In 2001 I put out my first original album titled Ten Dollar Dress. My blend of Blues always had a twist of jazz, folk, funk, and good old rock 'n roll in the pot.  Though eclectic in nature, that record secured me a spot in the Canadian Blues scene and won
me a Maple Blues Award for Female Vocalist of the Year. I did a lot of
road, met a lot of crazy cool people and shared the stage with many great artists.

For the last 13 years I have been working and touring with a wonderful guitarist (Paul Deslauriers) as part of a pretty successful acoustic duo. We played from the North Pole to Mexico, and from Memphis to Moscow together
column2: had two successful albums together, and garnered a number of accolades and awards.

In return, you'll receive my extreme gratitude, along with a brand new copy of the CD when it's finished! I have some other really cool and fun perks listed as well, so please do take advantage of them! 0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""> <h3>
<strong>
Different Drummer
Brandon Vance, violin/fiddle
Anna Doak, double bass  Mark
Mendonca, tap
Brought together by a spontaneous musical encounter in 2013,
the three of us have worked to develop a collection of original arrangements for
our unique instrumentation.  The use of tap
dance as percussive element provides a burst of energy to our repertoire of
classical, modern, fiddle, celtic and jazz works.  The violin and double bass both play roles
of melodic importance in these arrangements while also sharing the job of
rhythm keeper with Mark, whose choreography adds an exciting visual spectacle
to live performances. With
the help of a Jack Straw Artist Residency we are currently in the process of
recording our first full length CD, joined by cellist Gretchen Yanover on
several tracks.    More than half way through the initial recording
process, we expect to finish most of the recording with the generous 40 hours of
studio time we were granted by Jack Straw.  We are
using this campaign to raise funds to cover the additional production costs by
pre-selling cds.  Your contribution will
help pay for mixing, mastering, mechanical licensing &amp
printing and pressing. Any additional
funds raised will help with the production of our first music video which is
planned for release in 2016.
Our goal is to finish recording by September 2015 and have
the CD completed and ready to distribute by November 2015.  Listen to a rough mix of Eavesdropper, recorded June 18 with guest artist Gretchen Yanover, cello.

Summary

What is The Indie Rock Platter, Volume 1?
<ul>
• A compilation of nine kick-ass songs featuring bands from the US, Australia and the UK
What makes the Indie Rock Platter Unique?
<ul>
• There is no music label involved with this compilation
• All the artists featured on this album are completely independent!
• Cary LaCourse is doing all the work that a label would do
• Cary is doing all the label’s work for free!
Is Cary insane?
<ul>
• No, he is not insane.
• Cary’s Subterranean Pink has a song on the Platter
• Cary will get an equal share (10%) of the profits, like everyone else
• Cary believes indies can find success by working together!
<h3>What We Need &amp
What do we need?
<ul>
<li>Funding for CD pressing &amp
• 1000 discs with case and inserts will cost $1,613.20
• We are asking for $2,000 so that we can also ship the CDs
<ul>
• If we do not reach our goal, we will press as many CDs as we can with what we do get
<div>
So what do I get if I help?
<ul>
• A donation of $10 or more earns one CD off from the run of discs being funded by this campaign
<li>A donation of $25 or more earns the above, plus a limited-edition &amp
column3: assembled by Cary, as well as a mystery gift!

column1: <li>A donation of $200 or more earns the above plus a unique song, written &amp
column2: produced just for you, on the subject of your choice.

column1: The Impact
What is the Impact of this project?
<ul>
• We are attempting to lead a revolution in music
• We believe it is possible to be successful in the music industry without selling yourself to a label
• You can be a part of this revolution!
Risks &
What are the risks and challenges?
<ul>
• I will let no obstacle stand between myself and success in this endeavor!
Other Ways You Can Help
What else can I do to be a part of this music revolution?
• You can spread the word about this album
• You can listen to independent music stations such as XRP Radio

Short Summary

Hi everyone! My name is Alfie Turner, I am 25 years old and I am a musician. I have been playing guitar since I was 8 years old and I knew even when I was 3 that it was the only thing I wanted to do with my life! I live for the music. Unfortunately one has to eat, hence I have worked as a barman, waiter, sound technician, model, cook, promoter, designer and various other professions all the time trying to move closer to my goal of music.

I am currently living in Tuscany, Italy. I play concerts 3 times a week and live and eat with any contributions that are made. For the first time in my life I have made the clear choice to survive with only my music. I want to continue to offer my music to the people that travel through and to the people that live here.

All in all I want to continue to expand the community of music in any way I can!

What I Need &

Indiegogo says the minimum I can ask for is €500, but in reality I am only asking for €200 to help towards a recording my EP to sell at my concerts. I am a trained music producer so I am able to mix and master myself. This is why I am not asking for much.
<div><span style=""font-size: 16px
column2: >You may be asking by now why don't I fund it myself? Well to be honest I am spending my money on other pieces of equipment such as a loop station and a vocal harmonizer. I also have legal costs to cover. I right my own songs yet I also do various covers as well. In order to do so legally I have to pay money towards that. I will also be purchasing a video camera, in order to make a small documentary of my journeys and the beautiful people I meet on the way. I have written all the songs on the EP and it will be offered as a Perk (see list)

column1: I am asking for a small helping hand and even if you donate €1 you will be in my heart for ever.
The Impact
<div><span style=""font-size: 16px
column2: >By contributing you will be helping me to achieve a goal I set a long time ago and you will also be contributing to the possibility of helping others.

Hey y’all, Kathryn Legendre here, coming to you from my home in Austin, TX. That’s because, this summer, I’m heading into the studio to record a new EP and put out my very own vinyl 7”. Don’t worry, in addition, I’ll also put out a CD with the same songs, plus bonus material. I know this isn’t your typical sort of release, but I’ve never been that kind of a girl anyway.

Where I've Been

When I'm not recording music, I'm still making music. Below are a few experiences I've had since releasing my debut record. In their own ways, each event has added an ingredient to the new songs I've been cooking up:

  • Press in in Lone Star Music magazine and Texas Music magazine
  • Nominated for Female Vocalist of the Year award at the 12th Annual Texas Music Awards (2014)
  • 2014 Kerrville Folk Festival New Folk Regional Performer at Ballad Tree
• Texas Music Water’s July 2014 “Musician of the Month”
• Top 15 finalist at 2015 Songwriters Serenade competition

Believe me, not a day goes by where I’m not thankful that I get to chase the music that’s in my head. The support I’ve received has already been so overwhelming, so I’m hoping you’ll be just as excited as I am to take the next step in my journey.
Where I'm Going

In July, I’m getting the band back together and recording at the renowned, Cedar Creek Studio in South Austin with John Ross Silva behind the boards. He’s engineered, produced and contributed to records for Randy Rogers, Hays Carll, Hal Ketchum, Wade Bowen, and more, so I’m incredibly honored he’s signed on for my new EP. I’m also excited to show you a new batch of material. I released by debut album, Old Soul in 2013, and then a single, Have You Forgotten Me, last year. In that time, I’ve made a lot of strides. I’ve turned songwriting into more than just a hobby, playing shows, learning to play guitar, and maturing as a songwriter. I’m eager to share a musical slice of life with you, so I hope you’re hungry!

What I Need

Here’s where you come in: I hate asking for help, but the truth is, I need it. Recording is a major undertaking, both in time and finances. I’ll be contributing a large part of own my savings to the project, but any and all generous contributions will help immensely in getting this EP out into the world!

  • I get to live in one of the best cities in the world for music and musicians. I'll be working with some incredible folks, and their talent is worth a lot (not just financially).
  • Studio time is also pretty expensive. We'll be creatively efficient with 3 days at the renowned, Cedar Creek Studio. 
  • CDs have to get mastered, made and duplicated. Album art needs to be printed. Luckily, I know a graphic designer
• In the event that I happen to exceed my goal, I’ll put that money toward publicity costs to help get these songs to their widest audience.
<div>
What You Get
In return, I’ve got some cool  incentives. You can see ALL of them below, but some highlights include...
<ul>
• Pre-orders of the new EP, 7"" and combo package (delivered to you before the release date)
• Private Concert Window (live web stream) show
• Poster designed by yours truly
• Go honky-tonkin' with me
• Private house show
• YES, I will even get a tribute tattoo
Risks &
column2:
Challenges

I once read, the biggest risk, is not taking one at all (which is exactly why I'm in this position to begin with). As with life, little bumps in the road might occur, or things might be delayed in time. However, I promise to fully communicate any obstacles that may arise and work to find a solution that works for all parties.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please feel free to share this page with your friends, family, co-workers, PTA, random stranger, dog, or more! Word of mouth is still a valuable mode of information. I also have merch available to purchase. You can find all of this and more on my website, www.kathrynlegendremusic.com.

Thank you so much for stopping by and checking this out. Cheers, y'all.

Hi
my name is Habs. I am an industry-leading Visual Artist, often referred to as a VJ, I'm responsible for the content you see on the screens
at clubs, gigs and festivals.
have been in the exciting dance music industry for over 18 years and
worked at amazing events such as Glastonbury Festival, Ultra Music
Festival and many club nights, with high profile DJ’s like Carl Cox
at Space Ibiza, Lisa Lashes, Paul Van Dyk, Ferry Corston and bands including Nine
Inch Nails and Pet Shop Boys.
Having
partied all over the world and worked with some of the biggest names
in the dance music industry, I am developing a world-first app designed
to bring visual mixing to the masses and allow everyone with a phone to have a chance to be a VJ.
My
job allows me to offer some unique perks for you dance music lovers:  <span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
How
about some real VIP treatment at a leading dance event or joining me
in the DJ box for the night in Ibiza? Plus we've got cool app related perks and a mega saver app pack for just £10. Then “It's all about the Goodness” T-shirts and

way of life.

Working with Carl Cox at Ultra Music Festival Miami 2014
Why
am I here on Indiegogo?
I've wanted to develop my own visualisation software for quite
some time now and have recently added people to the team to complete
the project. We are nearly there, but we need funding to finish the app. I'm seeking GBP 30,000 to help fund the launch version of DJVJ as soon as possible.
DJVJ
is a one-of-a-kind, a cool little visualisation app currently in beta for
iPhone and iPad with an Android version to follow. For five pounds you can get access to the DJVJ beta within 72 hours of the end of this campaign and help me test the app.
So as I said, I've
wanted to develop my own visualisation software for over a decade,
and over the last seven years mobile device take up has really exploded. And with the improved technology it has allowed my vision for a product to gradually take shape. I now
want to develop something that's simple to use and can reach the
largest amount of people possible. I want to bring visual mixing to
the masses!

DJVJ will be as flexible as possible, currently we have iPhone and iPad versions in development with Android to follow and we'd like to do a PC/Mac version too. 

DJVJ can not only be plugged in to any screen at a small
venue but also at main stage screens, and it has the ability to
output Audio too. This technology makes the DJVJ project truly a one of a
kind!
I have also created a massive library of animations and visuals with 1000's

of images that can be mixed in real time.

With DJVJ I want to give up-and-coming bands and DJ's a very low cost visual solution, while at the same time offering visual artists a platform to sell their work.

You can see an on screen demo of the DJVJ App working below. (Check the navigation buttons on the left and the sliders at the bottom. When a next video, next foreground button is selected you can see the text on the button grey out).
column6:
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">

You can now see just how badly we need an updated user interface for DJVJ!

Tell us more

column1: about the technology behind DJVJ?
DJVJ is using the iOS Audio Unit Framework, this is the lowest
latency method possible of capturing audio samples from the

microphone, line in, or music playing on the device. 

This will
ultimately result in a smoother, more responsive visualisation. This
is broken down in to frequency bands using a Fast Fourier Transform,
different elements of the visualisation could therefore respond only

to lows or highs for example.

I'm really looking forward to getting lots of beta testers involved in shaping the future of DJVJ's development and I can't wait to hear your ideas for features.
why do I need your help?
At
this stage I find myself at the final milestone of development
with the back-end architecture complete and just the front end user
experience left. This is why I'm here on Indiegogo, seeking
support from the community and beyond, and sharing my visionary
project with the world.
BUT, more
importantly, I NEED YOUR FEEDBACK. The app is at a great stage of
development and the product is working well, but it needs refining so

that it is easy to use and pleasing to the eye. 

By supporting my campaign you'll get Beta access to DJVJ, so you can
help with the development of the front end and provide
suggestions for new features. You'll also be able to help to stress
test the app and report back any bugs or issues you come across. I'll be setting up a beta tester forum to help with communications.
The
funds raised will enable me to complete the final stage with a
dynamic front end user experience including social sharing and
location based features. I'm led to believe the devs will need around 8 weeks
after reaching the funding goal to submit the production version of DJVJ to
Apple and later on to Google.
Marketing
is always a key factor to the success of any project and all your

support will allow the app to reach as wide an audience as possible. 

Working with the lovely DJ Lisa Lashes earlier this year.
What
happens if I don't reach the funding goal?
I will just carry on but it's going to take longer than the 8 weeks predicted and may not hit the store until 2016, which would be a shame.
I
have personally been pursuing this dream for over 10 years and this year I will
finally get to release a beta version of DJVJ. There is no way I'm
stopping now! DJVJ will hit the App Store no matter what
happens. No matter how small your contribution, it all helps. At the

end of the day it's all about the goodness.

Catching up with dance music legend Norman Jay OBE, Wales 2015
What
do I have to offer you for your support?
I have created a really cool range of perks for you and I know you are
going to love them.
For just £3 you get the DJVJ App when it launches and your name in the credits, or get beta access to the DJVJ App within 72 hours of the end of this campaign for

just a fiver £5! For a tenner £10 and a serious saving get the DJVJ Mega Launch Pack and your name in the special thanks section. Just £40 for a piece of lanyard history and £50 to say you've got the goodness in T-shirt form.

You can get the T-shirt (mens and womens) and the goodness too...
Get one of our best selling mens crew neck t-shirts or ladies tanks in black.

column2: >Grab a piece of dance music history with a random selection of one of my lanyards!

column1: Now
the “It’s All About The Goodness” merchandise, what's that all
about?
I'll
tell you. When I first hit the dance floor in the UK in the late 1980's
I didn't quite realize just how big and how global dance music would
go. Back then, I didn't know I'd be working in the industry
myself. But everywhere I have gone in the world to dance and party,
in every corner of the globe there's been love and people being good
to each other. From the stories I've been told to acts of outstanding
generosity and kindness I have witnessed. We are a global family and
in our house (that Jack built) - It's All About The Goodness! We've selected the mens and womens best selling branded t-shirt and tank in black - get the goodness.
Here's a little video a good friend did for me, called The Goodness - enjoy!
Hanging out with Loco Dice and Sven Vath in Ibiza - they have the goodness!
Finally
the BIG STUFF
How
about some real VIP treatment at a leading event in UK or worldwide,
or potentially being my right hand person for the night and coming to
a world renowned dance event to live video mix and smash it with me?
You'll
get a lesson in live video mixing and actually mix with me (live!) at
the event!
Or perhaps you want to really party like a rockstar? There are Ibiza &
column2: Global versions, it's two nights out on the town with me going to the best clubs, backstage and much shenanigans - includes airport transfers and good hotels. I will look after you and introduce you to the family, you never know who might be around....

column1: At the after party with Carl Cox at Bestival, Isle of Wight 2013
<i>My BBQ's are World Famous, get the VIP + BBQ package &amp
What
about stretch goals?

Well I think the first stretch goal has be an Android version of the app which I think would be around a further 10,000 GBP. Ideally I'd love to release Apple and Android versions together at launch. Then perhaps a PC/Mac desktop version or new or improved features. I'm not sure, what do you think? I'd really love to hear your ideas about where development of DJVJ should go - let me know your thoughts people?
I
leave you here with a BIG thank you in advance for any contribution
or social share you can make towards DJVJ and much love from an original raver to all of you in our great big global dance music family – Lets have it!
I'm the VJ at the Carl Cox Arena Ultra Music Festival Miami 2014
<div>
The end of a long gig, we work hard for long hours to make sure you party hard!
<div>
And sometimes we have fun too...
<div>
And other nights you really can't get no sleep - Maxi Jazz, Faithless

column7: >Hi, I'm Nick.  Vocalist, songwriter and instrumentalist for the band Hateful Decay.  I am a solo performer from Roseville, Minnesota.  I've been performing and working on music for almost a year and a half.  Music has always been a part of my life and I'm heavily influenced by bands like Nine Inch Nails, The Doors, Faith No More, Tool and Modest Mouse.  I decided to start this campaign to help advance myself musically and turn what seems to be a casual hobby into a musical career.  I'm looking to take the next big step and advance myself from at home studio to live and venue gigs.  Your donations will help me achieve my lifelong dream and musical aspirations. I'll be able to turn my passion into a long term lifestyle.

column2: >My funding goal is $6,000. The funds will be going to new equipment, promotional services, t-shirts, hard copies of CD's and new instruments. My main goal is playing live, the equipment I need is a laptop to work as the center of my stage performance, amps for my keyboard and microphone, drum pad for drums and percussion instruments and a keytar for back up synths.

column6: >I understand as a new musician, getting myself out there can be difficult and I have faced my fair share of obstacles along the way. Getting people to give my music a chance is not easy, and I hope by being able to play live, people will hear what I have to offer. If I don't meet my goal, I will continue to try. I'll work around not being able to play live and will promote and continue to produce music.

column7: >The best way to help me is to share my campaign with your friends and family. Even if you can't support financially, just sharing this and supporting me other ways, through Facebook or SoundCloud is greatly appreciated. If you would like to financially support but are unable to, feel free to share my story with others.

column1: My biggest goal with this campaign is being able to share my love for music with a wider variety of people. Having money as a major setback is nothing new to anyone familiar with the music industry, and every artist has to start somewhere. As an amateur musician, I pride myself on my unique styles and creative lyrics. By funding Hateful Decay, you're helping me better myself as a musician so I'm able to produce more music to share with all of you. All I can say is thank you for your continued support and I look forward to sharing future projects with you.

","Hi, I'm Nick.  Vocalist, songwriter and instrumentalist for the band Hateful Decay.  I am a solo performer from Roseville, Minnesota.  I've been performing and working on music for almost a year and a half.  Music has always been a part of my life and I'm heavily influenced by bands like Nine Inch Nails, The Doors, Faith No More, Tool and Modest Mouse.  I decided to start this campaign to help advance myself musically and turn what seems to be a casual hobby into a musical career.  I'm looking to take the next big step and advance myself from at home studio to live and venue gigs.  Your donations will help me achieve my lifelong dream and musical aspirations. I'll be able to turn my passion into a long term lifestyle.

My funding goal is $6,000. The funds will be going to new equipment, promotional services, t-shirts, hard copies of CD's and new instruments. My main goal is playing live, the equipment I need is a laptop to work as the center of my stage performance, amps for my keyboard and microphone, drum pad for drums and percussion instruments and a keytar for back up synths.

I understand as a new musician, getting myself out there can be difficult and I have faced my fair share of obstacles along the way. Getting people to give my music a chance is not easy, and I hope by being able to play live, people will hear what I have to offer. If I don't meet my goal, I will continue to try. I'll work around not being able to play live and will promote and continue to produce music.

The best way to help me is to share my campaign with your friends and family. Even if you can't support financially, just sharing this and supporting me other ways, through Facebook or SoundCloud is greatly appreciated. If you would like to financially support but are unable to, feel free to share my story with others.

My biggest goal with this campaign is being able to share my love for music with a wider variety of people. Having money as a major setback is nothing new to anyone familiar with the music industry, and every artist has to start somewhere. As an amateur musician, I pride myself on my unique styles and creative lyrics. By funding Hateful Decay, you're helping me better myself as a musician so I'm able to produce more music to share with all of you. All I can say is thank you for your continued support and I look forward to sharing future projects with you.",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns

Ariana would like to open a record store that caters to families and houses a school for DJ's, both young and old alike. The money will be used for location, products, and advertising of  the first new record store catering towards dance music (and others) and teaching children about vinyl and music, spinning, and beats. Arianna's parents own businesses and will be actively assisting her. The business will be open evenings and weekends, around her school schedule and will even host birthday parties.  Her parents told her that if she can dream it, she can do it. Let's show her it's possible! If you are a doubter on sustainability, NPR states continued and rapid growth in vinyl sales and thinks its a great time to open stores. There is a shortage of stores in the US.

Short Summary

My name is Vasiliy Komendant, I was born in Russia, live in the US, but an Argentine at heart. My Argentinean friends call me Ruso. I am a musician (singer and songwriter) and a filmmaker (writer - director), and I am as passionate about music as I am passionate about Argentina, especially its arts and culture, and above all its magical MUSIC! After a break from recording and performing, this year I am making a comeback with the songs that I MUST sing, these are the stories that I must tell! In spring of 2015 I started the project by recording two songs from the great Argentine Songbook - Milonga Triste (a tango) and Memorias de uno Vieja Canción, my homage to the great musician from that country - Horacio Guarany. The latter has the total of 2300 plays (and growing) being streamed on SoundCloud and YouTube. In October 2015 I had the honor of performing those songs LIVE at an event in Philadelphia City Hall, as part of the Argentine Week in Philadelphia. The reception was overwhelming, and convinced me in something I KNEW I desired from the very start - a complete ALBUM of the greatest songs of my beautiful Argentina, titled the way my maxi single was named - ""Argentino de Alma"" should be recorded in its entirety.

It will include 7 cover versions of the masterpieces of Argentine songwriting through the various eras, freshly arranged, as well as 3 of my original songs in Spanish. To me singing in Argentinean Spanish is more than pleasure, it is part of my mission to promote the culture of Argentina worldwide - through performing, through sharing the music. Living in a small Pennsylvania town, close to Philadelphia and working hard in something a bit left of artsy, I have been saving every penny to make the first 2 recordings happen by capturing my vocals in my home studio, and then sending them to Russia, to my friend - producer and collaborator Victor Romanov, who engaged wonderful live musicians, arranged and recorded, mixed and mastered the final polished versions. This proved an economical and artistically fulfilling collaboration, and we have discussed in detail the rest of the future album.

However, I am not able to fully finance such an undertaking, and I must get it all RIGHT - with live instruments, in a professional studio. I am a perfectionist when it comes to music making. I simply do not have the financial resource to get this done - to do justice to the songs, which are all gems of Latin music. This is why I absolutely need you all on board! I invite you to be part of an exciting process of music-making!
In the meantime - check out the first 2 songs on SounCloud:

Argentino de Alma maxi single

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

I set the TOTAL budget at $5,000, and this is how it breaks down:

column1: 1. $3700 is the actual budget of the recording (considering I record the vocals in my home studio in Trevose) - the money goes to the session musicians, studio sessions (they are much cheaper in Perm, Russia, where the things will be happening) and all that jazz necessary to arrange, record, mix and master 8 full songs.
2. The perks I will provide you with, the fees (Indiegogo, Bank) and the taxes (as stipulated by US law) will ""eat up"" a chunk of the budget and are estimated at $800.
3. The rest of the sum - $500 - is the copyright cost, to get the rights to the remaining 5 covers, so that their authors get honored and paid - they deserve it!

I promise updates, unique content (including alternative takes, pictures from the studio etc.), and the cool perks, such as: postcards, T-shirts, special autographed edition of the CD itself, posters and even an all-private performance - that is if someone is crazy generous.

The Impact

I know we are all overfed and skeptical, ""oh, well, another indie musician""... but I believe that the songs that I want to revive are WORTH the public's attention and the public's LOVE. I want to promote a beautiful, diverse culture and bring a gorgeous South American country close to the rest of the world. I am a devoted artist, and I will give my all to this mission of mine - bringing Argentina through music to the people who know it and love it, to those who remember it and miss it, and to those who will be thrilled to discover it.
In case the project is not fully financed, depending on the funds raised, I have 2 options:
a. Record however many songs I have the funds for. This will bring my closer to my goal anyways.
b. Self-finance the gap, and finish the project anyway!
Risks &
column2:
Challenges

There is one challenge at this point - the budget (or lack thereof) - the creative and logistical ones have all been resolved. The musicians have already been contacted, the studio pre-booked. I am ready, and so is my sound producer Victor Romanov (known as iCENTURY) - who has a track record of successful electronic, folk and acoustic projects in Russia.

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Spread the word! Tell about this album, tell about me, tell about this campaign. I do not endorse crazy ""all over the place"" sharing that drives people insane and makes them unfriend one, but I believe that when shared in the right place (a music lover's wall or a Latin or Latin music or Argentine community) it is fruitful! If you do love what you've heard, if you do believe in music - be part of ""Argentino de Alma LP""!

It will include 7 cover versions of the masterpieces of Argentine songwriting through the various eras, freshly arranged, as well as 3 of my original songs in Spanish. To me singing in Argentinean Spanish is more than pleasure, it is part of my mission to promote the culture of Argentina worldwide - through performing, through sharing the music. Living in a small Pennsylvania town, close to Philadelphia and working hard in something a bit left of artsy, I have been saving every penny to make the first 2 recordings happen by capturing my vocals in my home studio, and then sending them to Russia, to my friend - producer and collaborator Victor Romanov, who engaged wonderful live musicians, arranged and recorded, mixed and mastered the final polished versions. This proved an economical and artistically fulfilling collaboration, and we have discussed in detail the rest of the future album.

However, I am not able to fully finance such an undertaking, and I must get it all RIGHT - with live instruments, in a professional studio. I am a perfectionist when it comes to music making. I simply do not have the financial resource to get this done - to do justice to the songs, which are all gems of Latin music. This is why I absolutely need you all on board! I invite you to be part of an exciting process of music-making!
In the meantime - check out the first 2 songs on SounCloud:
Argentino de Alma maxi single   What We Need & What You Get I set the TOTAL budget at $5,000, and this is how it breaks down:

1. $3700 is the actual budget of the recording (considering I record the vocals in my home studio in Trevose) - the money goes to the session musicians, studio sessions (they are much cheaper in Perm, Russia, where the things will be happening) and all that jazz necessary to arrange, record, mix and master 8 full songs.
2. The perks I will provide you with, the fees (Indiegogo, Bank) and the taxes (as stipulated by US law) will ""eat up"" a chunk of the budget and are estimated at $800.
3. The rest of the sum - $500 - is the copyright cost, to get the rights to the remaining 5 covers, so that their authors get honored and paid - they deserve it!

I promise updates, unique content (including alternative takes, pictures from the studio etc.), and the cool perks, such as: postcards, T-shirts, special autographed edition of the CD itself, posters and even an all-private performance - that is if someone is crazy generous.

The Impact I know we are all overfed and skeptical, ""oh, well, another indie musician""... but I believe that the songs that I want to revive are WORTH the public's attention and the public's LOVE. I want to promote a beautiful, diverse culture and bring a gorgeous South American country close to the rest of the world. I am a devoted artist, and I will give my all to this mission of mine - bringing Argentina through music to the people who know it and love it, to those who remember it and miss it, and to those who will be thrilled to discover it.
In case the project is not fully financed, depending on the funds raised, I have 2 options:
a. Record however many songs I have the funds for. This will bring my closer to my goal anyways.
b. Self-finance the gap, and finish the project anyway!

Risks & Challenges There is one challenge at this point - the budget (or lack thereof) - the creative and logistical ones have all been resolved. The musicians have already been contacted, the studio pre-booked. I am ready, and so is my sound producer Victor Romanov (known as iCENTURY) - who has a track record of successful electronic, folk and acoustic projects in Russia.

Other Ways You Can Help Spread the word! Spread the word! Tell about this album, tell about me, tell about this campaign. I do not endorse crazy ""all over the place"" sharing that drives people insane and makes them unfriend one, but I believe that when shared in the right place (a music lover's wall or a Latin or Latin music or Argentine community) it is fruitful! If you do love what you've heard, if you do believe in music - be part of ""Argentino de Alma LP""!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
