12/26 - THANK YOU ALL!!  We made 85% of the goal, which is enough to get moving on the album.  Continuing contributions will be accepted through email - travknapper3@gmail.com (paypal, etc), with all the same perks available!

Check out all the tshirts:

This winter I am recording my third full-length album, I Believe We Are Safe - an exciting collection of brand new original songs played on the banjo, kalimba, and piano - with lots of other musicians joining on string bass, fiddle, guitar, hand percussion, harmonica, and harmony vocals!

Like my last album, For Everything That's Good [2014], this one will be full of the relentlessly positive acoustic folk-soul that people from all around have been growing to love.  I would be honored to have your support in making these new songs into timeless recordings.

The response to my music over the last year has been extremely encouraging: people of all ages - babies, children, teenagers, adults, and elders - seem to find something nourishing in these notes and words.  It's something that gets them dancing when they haven't felt like moving, singing along when they haven't shared their voice in years, and smiling with hope in the midst of challenges.

""When I'm gone, May they say I was too joyful

May they say I understood the pain

Of everyone who struggles on this journey

And we lifted up our spirits all the same"" 

                                                      - from the new song ""Humble""
What People are Saying
""Travis Knapp is a brilliant musician with a resonant voice.  His songs are uplifting and strong, kindling a sense of hope and optimism.  He is very impressive.""
- Starhawk (Activist and author of ""The Fifth Sacred Thing"")

""Phrases were going through my head, like, ""The voice of a generation,"" and ""The new Pete Seeger."" I imagine you've heard these compliments before, so I add my voice to them.  Also, I feel that people especially like music like yours when they can admire and respect the person behind the music. Your values, your honesty, and your love of life, the earth, and people, shine through.""
- Judith Hendin (www.consciousbody.com)

""We met you at LEAF and you gave us your album as a trade for juice from our stand. We played the album on the ride back to town and were amazed at the quality and sound. Travis Knapp is an amazingly talented musician and an underrated gem that will surely be making big waves very soon! Sooo good!""
- Zack and Jenni (Roaming in the Raw)
Perks

Check out the perks for supporting, which are over on the right-hand side of this page.  There are various levels at which to give, to get this CD in your hands and in your ears - plus banjo t-shirts (""for everything that's good, become a defender""), posters, stickers, house concerts (solo and band), an original song for you, a wild foods and medicines care package, and a package of music and artwork that can arrive in time for holiday season gift-giving (w/o the new CD, of course, which won't be ready until Spring!).
The Songs
Here are most of the songs planned for the album (there will be at least 10):
""Mama"" - a new favorite singalong, 30-year retrospective, and intention-setting
""Humble"" - a prayerful song written on kalimba in the mountains near Asheville, NC
""Safe"" - a powerful declaration of our inherent goodness and power to create
""Lila"" - a song for my niece (a result of the last Indiegogo campaign's ""A Song for You"" perk)
""If You Want to Call Me Darlin'"" - a light-hearted invitation
""The Grasshoppers and The Ants"" - a pro-music and arts interpretation of the famous fable
""Toward the One"" - a unifying chant
""Dancer"" - heart-opening story of a woman who follows her passion beyond her physical limits
""Spring"" - a song of hope from the early spring thaw
Sharing the Music
Having taken the year off from growing food, I have been able to devote much more time to performing around the community and around the country, and writing new songs.

Besides the joy of knowing my voice is serenading folks in cars and kitchens all over the world, I feel extremely lucky to get to add music to celebrations that are truly in line with my personal vision for an awesome world that we share - celebrations such as Floyd Yoga Jam, Ithaca's Herbal Hoedown, The Good Life Farm's Asparagus Festival, Twisted Tree's Nut Bonanza, Farmers Markets, Plant Sales, Fundraisers, Earth Days, Churches, Funerals, Weddings, Baby Showers, Circuses, The Kava Lounge, Community Radio, Book Talks, Porchfest, Bound for Glory, House Concerts, and my ""Lean-to Tour"" of the Finger Lakes Trail.

I intend to keep adding my songs to local celebrations and ceremonies, while also traveling to similar gatherings around the US and abroad, to be a ""pollinator"" of positive ideas and optimistic music!  Your contribution to this album directly supports this empowering pollination!
Here's the breakdown of the budget:
Studio time [recording, mixing, and mastering] = $2,300
Musicians = $1,500
CD Printing + Graphic Design = $1,700
Artwork [artist and printing] = $1,000

For the last two albums, I recorded mostly with my own equipment, and did most of the performing on them.  I Believe We Are Safe will be recorded at REP Studio in Ithaca (www.repstudio.com), and it will feature many talented local musicians to bring the songs to life.  Nate Silas Richardson (Samite, John Brown's Body, Sim Redmond Band, Black Castle) will again be lending the magic of his ears at REP, as well as adding some of his musical stylings.  Other musicians will include Desmond Bratton (string bass), Elisa Sciscioli (vocals), Nate Marshall (guitar), Tenzin Chopak (guitar and vocals), Angie Beeler (vocals), Chris Gerard (percussion and vocals), Jon Crawford (harmonica), and Steve Selin (fiddle) - plus several more special guests!

Artwork will again be provided by the extremely talented Linda Wingerter (aka Polly Sonic).  Whenever I hand someone Bright New Way or For Everything That's Good, the first thing they say is ""Wow, it's beautiful!"" - and they're of course referring to Linda's extraordinary paintings and drawings.  She has really shaped the visual aesthetic of Travis Knapp music, and it's quite exciting to think of what artwork is yet up her sleeve!!
Past Work
Check out the full puppet music video for ""None of Us is Alone,"" from the album, For Everything That's Good.
Risks and Challenges

This is a fairly low-risk endeavor.  Having gone through the full process of album-making a couple times now, I'm confident that all the steps - from the music creation and recording, to putting the physical CD together - will go rather smoothly.  The time frame is achievable, and twice as long as the last two productions were.

The biggest challenge will be getting the album into the ears of people beyond our immediate community of fans, friends, and family - to folks who will be glad to listen and feel supported in their hopeful view of the world!  We're planning to send this to folk radio shows and transformational festivals around the country, to spread the music and set the stage for future live performances.

If we raise less than $4,500, this album simply cannot happen - I am committed to making a great-sounding album.  For Everything That's Good took $3,500 [with minimal in-studio recording and very few other musicians], and I would additionally need to get a new well-functioning computer to be able to record everything at home again.  If we raise between $4,500 and $6,500, it will mean fewer guest musicians and more recording outside of the studio.  If we surpass the goal of $6,500, it will mean more (properly-paid) guest musicians, and more studio time to refine the songs.  If we surpass the goal by at least $2,000, there will be a record pressing of For Everything That's Good or I Believe We Are Safe on vinyl!
Other Ways to Help

Even if you aren't able to contribute financially right now (and also if you are), you can be extremely helpful to this campaign by telling someone you love about this upcoming album!  Get the word out on social media - facebook, twitter, instagram, etc.  A simple ""share"" can go a long way.  A note or conversation with a friend in person can go even farther!  If you're local to Ithaca, NY, come out to hear some performances - including an album fundraiser party at Sacred Root Kava Lounge &
column2: Tea Bar on December 5th.  There will be a CD release concert in the spring, also in Ithaca!

column1: Let's grow old together ...

I Believe We Are Safe will be an honest and soul-stirring album of catchy and energizing songs that you can sing and dance to anywhere.   I hope you find it inspiring and nourishing.  These lyrics are full of reminders to myself of what I want to help create in this world, and how beautiful life can be.

Thank you for your continual support, encouragement, feedback, and connection to these songs, to bring them to life as a conversation and shared experience.  Time and time again we find that we have the power to lift each other up.
Many Blessings,
Travis
""Well, I'm grown up, Mama, doing right by you
Living hard like you taught me to do
I've got no regrets, only unpaid debts
For all the kindness from people like you""
-from the new song ""Mama""

I've been getting some feedback from people that the title ""I Believe We Are Safe"" seems out of touch and insensitive - at least when it's taken out of the context of the song lyrics from which it came.  People have suggested that I remove the word ""Safe"" from the title, in light of world affairs.  So I'll articulate this a little more:
When I say ""Safe,""
I'm talking about a place
column5: >that's higher than, or deeper than, or

column1: Beyond physical and emotional safety.
Now, I don't have my head in the sand, here -

column5: >I understand what horrible things are going on.

column1: In spite of what's happening
There's a part of our existence,
That is eternally in a place of safety and peace.
… This is what I believe.
It's a provocative phrase for just this reason -
""Look, this group of people is definitely not safe,"" and
""My experience has not been one of safety in these situations ...
""How can you say that?!  How can you say we are safe??
""You sit in such a place of privilege
column5: >as a young educated straight white male
>        in the United States of America.""

column1: But this isn't about me,
As an individual,
It's the Watcher, it's the Soul,
It's the Universe, it's the Creator,
It's the tiniest tiniest part,
Whatever you call it,
That is where I believe we are safe.

UPDATE, 12/6: After much deliberation and introspection, and a whole lot of great conversation with great people, I've decided to reopen the door on what to call the album.  Although I still feel strongly that ""We Are Safe"" on a spiritual level, there are more important reasons for making and sharing this music than my own need to make a strong statement.

The truth is that lots of folks hear the words ""I believe we are safe"" and assume I am delusional or in denial or out of touch with the world, or at least very privileged.  This could very well lead to someone turning away and ignoring all the music behind the title, thus missing any medicine it may have contained for them within.  Above all else, I want for this album to be unifying and empowering for as many people as possible.

So thank you for coming along for the journey, as the crafting of this album becomes more of a community process - which is awesome, because ultimately, it's this community that will be giving life to the music by listening to it for years to come!  Please be in touch if you have any thoughts, ideas, or feelings on the album title, (or anything else about it for that matter), and thank you to everyone who already has entered into this heartfelt discussion.

Here are some title possibilities, mostly taken from the song lyrics: ""Come Home,"" ""All the Stars You Hold,"" ""Gather,"" ""And We Lifted Up Our Spirits All The Same,"" ""Thank You For Your Song,"" ""Closer to the Truth,"" ""As Family Gathers,"" ""I Believe We Are Safe,"" ""Safe,"" ""We Got This Far""

www.travisknapp.com

I've been getting some feedback from people that the title ""I Believe We Are Safe"" seems out of touch and insensitive - at least when it's taken out of the context of the song lyrics from which it came.  People have suggested that I remove the word ""Safe"" from the title, in light of world affairs.  So I'll articulate this a little more:
When I say ""Safe,"" as in, ""I believe we are safe,""
I'm talking about a place that's higher than, or deeper than, or
Beyond physical and emotional safety.
Now, I don't have my head in the sand, here -
I understand what horrible things are going on.
In spite of what's happening all around us in this world,
There's a part of our existence, of our consciousness,
That is eternally in a place of safety and peace.
… This is what I believe.
It's a provocative phrase for just this reason - that folks are gonna say:
""Look, this group of people is definitely not safe,"" and
""My experience has not been one of safety in these situations ...
""How can you say that?!  How can you say we are safe??
""You sit in such a place of privilege as a young educated straight white male
in the United States of America.""
But this isn't about me, it's not about you, it's not about anyone
As an individual, or as a human being.
It's the Watcher, it's the Soul, it's God, it's Love,
It's the Universe, it's the Creator, it's that which knows,
It's the tiniest tiniest part,  and the most vast, all-encompassing entirety -
Whatever you call it,
That is where I believe we are safe.

UPDATE, 12/6: After much deliberation and introspection, and a whole lot of great conversation with great people, I've decided to reopen the door on what to call the album.  Although I still feel strongly that ""We Are Safe"" on a spiritual level, there are more important reasons for making and sharing this music than my own need to make a strong statement.

The truth is that lots of folks hear the words ""I believe we are safe"" and assume I am delusional or in denial or out of touch with the world, or at least very privileged.  This could very well lead to someone turning away and ignoring all the music behind the title, thus missing any medicine it may have contained for them within.  Above all else, I want for this album to be unifying and empowering for as many people as possible.

So thank you for coming along for the journey, as the crafting of this album becomes more of a community process - which is awesome, because ultimately, it's this community that will be giving life to the music by listening to it for years to come!  Please be in touch if you have any thoughts, ideas, or feelings on the album title, (or anything else about it for that matter), and thank you to everyone who already has entered into this heartfelt discussion.

Here are some title possibilities, mostly taken from the song lyrics: ""Come Home,"" ""All the Stars You Hold,"" ""Gather,"" ""And We Lifted Up Our Spirits All The Same,"" ""Thank You For Your Song,"" ""Closer to the Truth,"" ""As Family Gathers,"" ""I Believe We Are Safe,"" ""Safe,"" ""We Got This Far""",3.0,7,"3 Campaigns

ANNE OF THE WOLVES

(Have a listen to ""Blue and Black"" or other songs from my debut EP, ""Rainmaker."" ) 
   
Anne of the Wolves - Blue &
Hello! Do you have a minute?
Hello, thank you for visiting!  I'm Anne of the Wolves.  I'm a singer and songwriter from Melbourne, Australia and I'm hoping to get my album produced with a little help from my friends.
As you can hear, I'm pretty lucky to already have an absolutely
cracking band of musicians behind me and together we have created what we are calling <b>melodramatic gypsy-folk
jazz-noir, a sound that we adore playing together.  You can probably hear the fun we're having at the end of Blue &
I am so proud of my band and I couldn't be happier or more eager to share our creation with you!
In
order to do that, though, I do need some help to fund the recording and production of
our debut album and single - ""Triffids And Trees.""
If you have a few minutes, I'll explain a little bit more...
The Crazy Truth Behind The Music

Those of you who've already seen or heard an Anne of the Wolves performance know that the songs are pretty dark.  Even the happy or fun, loud stomping songs can have a real melancholy in the lyrics.

This is because all my music comes from one big influence in my life:

I have suffered anxiety and depression since I was 14 years old.

For a long, LONG time, I had no idea why I felt the way I did.  I have been bullied a lot as a result and the piano has been my friend when I've felt I've had no one else.
The song, ""Triffids &
column2: Trees"" has lyrics which embody exactly how I feel when the darkness takes me

column1:
""I'm running to the wind, pushing me back.
I'm running to the wind, coloured in black.
Listen....the fog.""

Writing songs has always been my way of expressing the overwhelming sadness, livid black anger or intense illogical fear that can come without warning to anyone struggling with anxiety or living with depression.   And it seems I'm not alone!  Since coming out about my own troubles, it's become apparent that many of us are suffering from a mental
health issue these days.  Perhaps this is why people seem to be

connecting with Anne of the Wolves' music? 

It's hard admitting there's something wrong, but thanks to my wonderful band, I do feel I've been able to finally bring myself out from among the triffids and into the trees, as it were, and this is what the album is all about.
The Album To Be!

""Triffids And Trees"", the album, is one big musical story of the many emotional paths traveled through these last few years of my struggle - a particularly rough time when a nearly decade long relationship was failing.
The hopeful highs and absolute crushing lows, the trauma that I'm still battling to this day from being bullied and excluded by close 'friends'.  It's all there in this album.  I am very proud of it.

And funnily enough, it's not all dark and depressing, given the subject matter!  Some of the songs are quite uplifting and downright fun!  The gypsy-honky-tonk number, ""Louisiana Swamp Stomp"" says to get moving and just be yourself and to hell with those who want to quash your spirit!
""Dance like you're going to die. We're all going to die!
NO! You know you ain't going to die, doing the Louisiana Swamp Stomp!""
Or as my Gran would say, ""Buck up and don't let the bastards get you down!""
I'm so excited about this album, I cannot wait for you to hear it!

You'll hear the full scale talent of my band as well, as it's their musicianship that adds that snarling, full-bodied, hot-blooded, wonderfully epic dynamic to Anne of the Wolves. 

And as Anne of the Wolves keeps performing and the music keeps connecting with people, I am starting to realize that if something so beautiful can come out of something so dark like depression - then I can and WILL keep living with it!
And gladly!
THE FUNDS

Of course, to help make this project a reality - I do need some help. 
I self-funded the first EP, ""Rainmaker"" which was a rewarding experience of course but an album, single and video is a WAY bigger project and I simply can't do it alone!

I would be so grateful if you could pledge even just a little to help me on my way. 

There are so many perks you can get! You get something even if you pledge as little as $5!  And everything you donate will go towards the following:  

Recording - with Tomas Strode (from PBS Live!) - This is complete! We had a dynamite weekend with Tom and recorded 9 songs over about one and a half days! Thank you, Tom!

Mixing/ Production - with Myles Mumford (aka Mr Excellent).

Mastering, printing and pressing of 1000 CD's for the album and 500 for the single (with possibly some vinyl if we go over our goal!)

Artwork for the cover - designed by Adam J. Shires of redhorsedesign. The single cover ""Triffids and Trees"" is complete and looks incredible. I simply cannot wait to show you all and see what Adam will do next for the album!

Filming the first ever Anne of the Wolves video of our single ""Triffids and Trees.""
BUT ABOVE EVERYTHING ELSE - PLEASE HELP ME PAY MY BAND!
With your help, I'd like to actually pay the people who have helped bring my songs to life.  My wonderful band, THE WOLVES.  Without them, NONE of this would have been possible.
Please allow me to proudly introduce them to you.
THE WOLVES:

NATHANIEL POYNTER - who plays clarinet like a god damn boss, tells a tall tale, and arranges an epic finale.  That's when he's not working overtime teaching the next generation to appreciate Miles Davis or playing an Irish ditty whilst insisting he's Italian.

HAYLEY JONES-BUCKLEY - who rocks the double-bass, writes all the charts, runs the treasury and organizes festivals. When she's not teaching refugees English or planning her upcoming wedding...or basically being the coolest chick on the planet.

MATT GIBSON - who thunders on percussion, runs technical support, records and edits rehearsals every week and also does our graphic design.  When he's not being a full time graphic designer or proposing to Hayley on top of a mountain. A MOUNTAIN.

STIRLING GILL-CHAMBERS - who sweeps us away on violin, dresses incredibly dapper he puts us all to shame and wears his moustache so bloody well, he makes even women consider growing one. When he's not serving coffee, shaking his head at silly orders for coffee or reprimanding us on our choice of coffee.

These precious people give me their time and musical collaboration FOR FREE whilst also utilizing their other skills FOR FREE.  They have given so much of their energy and support to this project, writing their own parts to the songs I compose and then helping me arrange the overall product.  And they are all professional musicians.  (Can you imagine doing what you do everyday and not getting paid?!)

So, I would dearly love to reward them.
APPROXIMATE COSTS

Below is what I'd expect to pay for everything:

Reward costs
$250 - frames x 10
$250 - paper and post, printing, etc.

Printing and Pressing
$1200 - single - only 500 being made!
$1500 - album - 1000 being made.

Recording
$800 - Completed
Artwork for Single
$550 - Completed
Artwork for Album

$550

Mixing 

$1500

Mastering
$1100
Video Shooting and Editing
$1000
The Wolves - $500 ea = 

$2000
If We Don't Make Our Goal

Luckily we still get what's been donated, so rest assured that your funds will still be used to go toward the album, it may just take a little bit longer to get to you... I'd just probably need to figure out how I could fake my own death and use the insurance money?  I'll be sure to keep you all updated!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please don't be worried if you can't contribute financially!  I would love it if you could even share the link to this campaign on your own social network or to whoever you think may be interested.

If you have a skill you wish to donate to any aspects of the project so that the funds raised can be used elsewhere, that would be great! Are you a photographer, film-maker, framer, baker, candlestick-maker?

With your help, I would love to make this all come about!

Thanks for all your support, I truly appreciate it!
Love
Anne of the Wolves
","ANNE OF THE WOLVES
(Have a listen to ""Blue and Black"" or other songs from my debut EP, ""Rainmaker."" )      Anne of the Wolves - Blue & Black
Hello! Do you have a minute?
Hello, thank you for visiting!  I'm Anne of the Wolves.  I'm a singer and songwriter from Melbourne, Australia and I'm hoping to get my album produced with a little help from my friends.
As you can hear, I'm pretty lucky to already have an absolutely
cracking band of musicians behind me and together we have created what we are calling melodramatic gypsy-folk
jazz-noir, a sound that we adore playing together.  You can probably hear the fun we're having at the end of Blue & Black!
I am so proud of my band and I couldn't be happier or more eager to share our creation with you!
In
order to do that, though, I do need some help to fund the recording and production of
our debut album and single - ""Triffids And Trees.""
If you have a few minutes, I'll explain a little bit more...
The Crazy Truth Behind The Music

Those of you who've already seen or heard an Anne of the Wolves performance know that the songs are pretty dark.  Even the happy or fun, loud stomping songs can have a real melancholy in the lyrics.This is because all my music comes from one big influence in my life:I have suffered anxiety and depression since I was 14 years old. For a long, LONG time, I had no idea why I felt the way I did.  I have been bullied a lot as a result and the piano has been my friend when I've felt I've had no one else.
The song, ""Triffids & Trees"" has lyrics which embody exactly how I feel when the darkness takes me

I'm running to the wind, pushing me back. I'm running to the wind, coloured in black. Become a Remarkable Inspiration for the World. Join a Mission: The Goddess!
Let’s change our world together!
Can ART change the world? Is there a music, the sound of which can give you
a desire to change your life and fill it with even more happiness and
positivity? Is it possible to discover your true talents and acquire creative
power to realize them in your life? Is there a mission waiting for you, which

will change the world?

YES,
join it, for it is Mission “The Goddess”, dedicated to you as a woman, or to
you as a man, who believes that the world is in need of more harmony, beauty
and light, which would be home to you and your family and children! It is
everybody’s active participation that changes the world: yours, mine, ours.
Join the mission You too!
for the world: magical experiential show “The Goddess”
Amiya Inspiration is a phenomenon, which creates
a positive world, revealing the genius of women and men. We uncover<span> the essential parts of human life: harmonious
relationships, personal growth, sacred feminine, blissful sexuality, successful
and creative life by:
Music &amp
Visual Arts
Web &amp
Social Actions &amp
Books &amp
This magic story is happening now. Amiya Inspiration team is creating experiential epic live show “The
Goddess” and intends to present it to as many people as possible around the
globe! “The Goddess” is a firework of unique knowledge, inspiration, and
positive energy, where every woman will hear her soul’s vocation, experience
the therapeutic inspirational effect of music and her own authentic story of
revelation, she will receive a personal message and a huge inspiration about
herself. This show provides an opportunity for every human to meet their divine
nature and to discover the power of femininity in a new spiritual way.
The story of awakening a Woman
– Goddess will be told in the form of <b>magical sounds of music, exotic
instruments, archaic virtuoso voice, lights, therapeutic visual art, sensuous
dance, aromatherapy, and poetry. It is a multidimensional experiential
journey together with gifted artists, creators who create exclusively
positive art that serves for the awakening of human potential rather than

consumeristic or destructive trends.                     

                          Let’s
awaken the genius within every Woman!
Due to
prevailing rational mind, emotional exclusion experienced by every modern human
being, mass egoism and endless consumerism, we are faced with painful
consequences that remain to be solved: wars, fights over territories and
resources, excessive negative and manipulative information, the pathology of
daily family life.
Our response to the destruction, wars, and egoism of our times is the Amiya
Inspiration project mission: the harmonious art, knowledge and practices of
unique wisdom, awakening the highest human potential.
Women
change the world
We believe that global changes begin with awakening the feminine nature
that is responsible for the vitality, beauty, cooperation, love and intuition.
We claim that Every Woman has unique natural female spiritual talents, the
unveiling and realization of which do not only bring the feeling of happiness
into her life but also peace, success, health and wisdom to her family and
people around her. The women who will awaken the genius, the quality of a Goddess, within themselves will
peacefully induce change in modern society in a light and promising, more
harmonious and wiser direction.
To show
this, we have created a song and video clip “The Goddess” where over 50 women
have starred – sisters, mothers, daughters, careerists, housewives, lovers,
businesswomen, muses, teachers, actresses, and many more... These women have
overcome their fears, a variety of challenges of life, and have turned towards belief
in themselves as women saying: every woman is a Goddess. I am the Goddess.
You are the Goddess! Watch it:
team of artists and producers bands together for this                                                       Mission  ""The
Goddess""!
We are a team of dedicated professionals: producers, designers, organizers,
programmers, and communication specialists: fully devoted volunteers committed
to the idea. We have been working on the realization of this mission for more
than a year and believe the project is what the people truly need here and now.
If you dream of a better world, join our idea too. Your participation is
crucial!

column3:
/>

                                       Our vision of the world is also Your future!

column1: Experiential live show “The Goddess” is created by an international team of gifted artists, producers and
self-development professionals:
AMIYA Andre Pabarciute (LT)- visionary, musician, producer. Amiya is a
vocalist, composer, pianist &amp
column2: art producer. Also author of bestseller book

column1: “Moters magijos mokykla” (“The Genius of a Woman”, publication of the English
version in 2016), founder of self-development center for women, men &amp
couples.
JENS GAD (USA) - songwriter / producer /
multi-instrumentalist with about 27 million cd's sold. He has coproduced /
co-written many Enigma Songs and is involved in numerous international projects
with X-Factor, Beyonce, Nikki Williams, Miley Cyrus, Andru Donalds and many
more.
EVALDAS ARLAUSKAS (LT)-
videography. “Over 7 years of experience in audio-visual field has led me to
the constant pursuit of visual syntax, beauty and perfection in films and
videos I make.”
<b>SEQUOIA EMMANUELLE &amp
column2: HER TEAM OF STYLISTS (USA) - visual art. Los

column1: Angeles based artist Sequoia Emmanuelle has a unique voice as a photographer
utilizing her many creative talents together- including fashion design, set
design, painting, wardrobe styling, film and graphic design. She creates
magical wonderlands from which to transport and capture her subjects in their
full archetypical glory.
Publications: Italian Vogue, Zink Magazine, Vibe Magazine, Fault Magazine,
Papercut Magazine, Kismet UK, Glassbook Magazine &amp
column2: more.

column1: MAHASATVAA MA ANANDA SARITA (UK) - lyrics. Sarita is a talented lyricist, a world renowned enlightened
Tantra master and mystic offering courses, retreats and training throughout the
world. She is the author of two books on Tantra and also publishes a monthly
newsletter and numerous articles in a wide range of magazines.
ANHIDEMA Michael
Vermey (ARM) - composer, pianist, music alchemist.
YVES GOVAERTS (BE) -
aromatherapist, global warming scientist.
ZANICCA YUAN (SG) - dancer, choreographer,
muse, poet.
MICHAEL DEMSKI (CA) -
dancer, actor, model, martial artist.
And even more artists &amp
column2: musicians: Kotryna Daujotaite - costumes, Alicija Eiliakas - gongs, exotic instruments, percussion, Saulius Petreikis - blow sound instruments, Jonas Lengvinas - drums, percussion, Laimonas Jancas - guitar, bass, Darius Malinauskas - lighting designer.

column1: make inspiring changes together!
Financial support is very important to finalize the
project and make it reach the people of the world sooner. We are not
profit-oriented. Our project is more of a social action, it's a
beautiful message about the divine human potential that we want to share
with everyone!
As it is not possible to create the show for free, our
concerts will be priced
column2: however, we make ticket prices as low as

column1: possible so that our events could be attended by thousands of people
regardless of their income. To each concert we will be inviting many
disadvantaged people, people with disabilities, and women suffering from
cancer FOR FREE. With each live show, 2-5% of revenues will be
forwarded to funds to support women.
Your financial help will be used to acquire video
projections, art images, sound and lighting solutions, to build stage
construction for the show, to remunerate hired producers, musicians and
dancers, to create natural scents &amp
column2: impression gifts for the audience, costumes and accessories, promotion of the live-shows and mission ""The Goddess"" itself, as the revenues received from ticket sales cannot cover all our

column1: costs and travel expenses. Our team of volunteers is ready to further
provide their limitless investment of time and energy but we must buy a
lot of advertising and social media services to make our message reach
YOU and other people. That is why we have created the Indiegogo project
on crowd funding basis. It is a great joy to have you read this message!
It means you already know about our mission. Please join it. You are
needed!

We are asking for 102.000 USD to create the live show ""The Goddess"" and to support the first 7 live shows.  The more amount is exceeded,  the more people will sooner see our live show in their towns around the World!!!            

                 


*Travel expenses, venue rents, filming, and the remaining part of

artists  remunerations will be covered from ticket sales income.

              Any contribution of yours is a great help and
inspiration for us!
To THANK YOU for your contribution we have created inspirational perks with beautiful intentions and care - we designed all
the offered gifts of gratitude with great love and personal touch just
for you, and your loved ones. These gifts are not simply objects. Choose a gift and it will become a source for your positive change and joy.
Even in case the full amount is not raised, the Amiya
Inspiration team will continue its mission! The best gift is knowing
that you are involved in reading this text, which means the project is

sure to happen! :)


                                          Support and receive a positive present!

                                                              THANK YOU!!!!

videography. “Over 7 years of experience in audio-visual field has led me to
the constant pursuit of visual syntax, beauty and perfection in films and
videos I make.”
SEQUOIA EMMANUELLE & HER TEAM OF STYLISTS (USA) - visual art. Los
Angeles based artist Sequoia Emmanuelle has a unique voice as a photographer
utilizing her many creative talents together- including fashion design, set
design, painting, wardrobe styling, film and graphic design. She creates
magical wonderlands from which to transport and capture her subjects in their
full archetypical glory.
Publications: Italian Vogue, Zink Magazine, Vibe Magazine, Fault Magazine,
Papercut Magazine, Kismet UK, Glassbook Magazine & more.
MAHASATVAA MA ANANDA SARITA (UK) - lyrics. Sarita is a talented lyricist, a world renowned enlightened
Tantra master and mystic offering courses, retreats and training throughout the
world. She is the author of two books on Tantra and also publishes a monthly
newsletter and numerous articles in a wide range of magazines.
ANHIDEMA Michael
Vermey (ARM) - composer, pianist, music alchemist.
YVES GOVAERTS (BE) -
aromatherapist, global warming scientist.
ZANICCA YUAN (SG) - dancer, choreographer,
muse, poet.
MICHAEL DEMSKI (CA) -
dancer, actor, model, martial artist.

And even more artists & musicians: Kotryna Daujotaite - costumes, Alicija Eiliakas - gongs, exotic instruments, percussion, Saulius Petreikis - blow sound instruments, Jonas Lengvinas - drums, percussion, Laimonas Jancas - guitar, bass, Darius Malinauskas - lighting designer.                                                                 Lets
make inspiring changes together!
Financial support is very important to finalize the
project and make it reach the people of the world sooner. We are not
profit-oriented. Our project is more of a social action, it's a
beautiful message about the divine human potential that we want to share
with everyone!
As it is not possible to create the show for free, our
concerts will be priced
column2: however, we make ticket prices as low as

column1: possible so that our events could be attended by thousands of people
regardless of their income. To each concert we will be inviting many
disadvantaged people, people with disabilities, and women suffering from
cancer FOR FREE. With each live show, 2-5% of revenues will be
forwarded to funds to support women.
Your financial help will be used to acquire video
projections, art images, sound and lighting solutions, to build stage
construction for the show, to remunerate hired producers, musicians and

dancers, to create natural scents & impression gifts for the audience, costumes and accessories, promotion of the live-shows and mission ""The Goddess"" itself, as the revenues received from ticket sales cannot cover all our
costs and travel expenses. Our team of volunteers is ready to further
provide their limitless investment of time and energy but we must buy a
lot of advertising and social media services to make our message reach
YOU and other people. That is why we have created the Indiegogo project
on crowd funding basis. It is a great joy to have you read this message!
It means you already know about our mission. Please join it. You are
needed!

We are asking for 102.000 USD to create the live show ""The Goddess"" and to support the first 7 live shows.  The more amount is exceeded,  the more people will sooner see our live show in their towns around the World!!!                                *Travel expenses, venue rents, filming, and the remaining part of
artists  remunerations will be covered from ticket sales income.              Any contribution of yours is a great help and
inspiration for us!
To THANK YOU for your contribution we have created inspirational perks with beautiful intentions and care - we designed all
the offered gifts of gratitude with great love and personal touch just
for you, and your loved ones. These gifts are not simply objects. Choose a gift and it will become a source for your positive change and joy.
Even in case the full amount is not raised, the Amiya

that you are involved in reading this text, which means the project is
sure to happen! :)                                          Support and receive a positive present!                                                              THANK YOU!!!!",12.0,1,"1 Campaign

Why do we need the
Women in Jazz Jam Festival?

Even groundhogs have a day!

I knew I had to do something to uplift the stories of women like me who live as musicians in the jazz community, women like me who work hard to be recognized in a male-dominated industry, women like me who are looking to honor the past while inspiring the future. My name is Kelle Jolly and I am a ukulele-playing jazz singer &

I started planning the first WOMEN IN JAZZ JAM FESTIVAL to shine a light so brightly on the stories of women, that no one could deny their contributions of creativity, strength and wisdom.

When and where will the festival be held?

The Women in Jazz Jam Festival will be held in Knoxville, TN, March 18th-20th, 2016. March is Women’s History Month and Music in Our Schools Month. The purpose of the festival is to uncover the stories of women in all aspects of the jazz genre, throughout the jazz community. Knox County students will be on spring break and are encouraged to attend workshops and performances.
What will I see at the Women in Jazz Jam Festival?

The Women in Jazz Jam Festival will consist of performances by women jazz musicians from Knoxville community, East Tennessee region and the country. Concerts and workshops will take place in downtown Knoxville.
What do you need?

To be successful, partners who share the goals of the festival are needed. I hope the
Women in Jazz Jam Festival will build new audiences for women in jazz and make people aware that Knoxville is a travel destination for jazz concerts.
I will need the support of others who share my passion for jazz to help pay artist fees, travel and lodging, as well as marketing and publicity costs.
I have received donations to cover the cost of the venue rentals. But this festival is all about the artists.
How can I help?
Donate today!
Don't leave the women behind! #WJJF
Please LIKE &
Email Kelle Jolly at womeninjazzjamfestival@gmail.com to volunteer.
Women in Jazz Jam Festival Facebook page
Women in Jazz Jam Festival blog

Show the performers and facilitators that we value their time and gifts. And when you give, we give back to you by recognizing your contribution with sneak-peak online performances, social media shout-outs, t-shirts and more.

The
<i>2015 AAF Vayots Dzor Festival &amp
Competition  helped us discover a great teacher, flutist Heghnar Harutunyan. Her students at the Yegheknadzor Music School, including talents such as Jemma Khalatyan and
Garabed Baghdassaryan, badly need instruments to match their talent and
devotion to music. Montreal music store, <i>Twiggs
Music, has offered us flutes at greatly reduced prices, and members of the
Montreal Symphony Orchestra are ready to accompany us to choose the best
flutes. A quality student flute that would last a good ten years costs around 500 USD.

If you have flutes at home that are in working condition, the AAF will take it to Armenia, have it reconditioned for use by a talented young flutist in Armenia. Just send it to our mailing address in Canada.

well-established concert artists such as soprano Aline Kutan, violinist Levon
Chilingirian and conductors Agnes Grossmann and Raffi Armenian the AAF seeks out,
nurtures and encourages young musical talent in the regions of Armenia.  The pedagogues we support are hand-picked for their
high level of professionalism and commitment.
Our choir programs change communities and give hope to all.

The Project

I have been singing since I could talk and writing songs and poetry for the past 20 years. Until recently, I have kept my music to myself and it is now time for me to begin to share my music with the world. It's taken me longer than I thought to get to where I am, but the
experiences I've been through have truly shaped who I have become. Every
song is a piece of my life. Writing from a place of honesty is difficult but
that's what makes it exciting and interesting. The songs on this album are
the best songs I've written (so far) and I want them to be heard by old and new
fans alike.
What You're Supporting

This campaign is raising funds for my first professionally recorded album with Billy Gewin, an Atlanta-based producer and engineer. Together, Billy and I are digging into my original material, writing arrangements, and reaching out to local musicians to bring the songs to life.

I have been able to cover the costs of recording and producing almost half of the songs we plan to have on the album. The costs included in making a record can be daunting - from studio rental,
mixing, mastering, printing, and of course paying the wonderful
musicians.  I am trying to reach a goal of $5,000 on Indiegogo to help
with the all of the costs.  If the
universe allows and we raise over $5,000, I will be able to send out my album
to independent labels and managers, publishing companies, as well as radio
stations across the nation. This is only the beginning for me and if we raise
over the marked amount it could mean that my dreams are finally
becoming my reality and you believe in me.

How You Can Help

If you are ready to make a contribution, you can just click the big pink ""Contribute Now"" button on the top right of this page! Every little bit counts and I am incredibly grateful for the support.

If you have friends in your network that would be interested in supporting local art and music here in Atlanta, then let's get the work out and make some noise! There are social media buttons on this page--and please tell your friends how grateful I am for your support!

Thank you, thank you, thank you for checking out my project. I really can't wait to share my music with you!

Dearest fans, friends and family,

We are VESPERIA! We are an epic death/ black metal band from Toronto, Canada and we have recently returned home from Wacken Open Air - where we were awarded the title of International Wacken Metal Battle World Champions! Our music weaves a tale of bygone heroism, the majestic beauty of our native Canada and of the great cold embrace. We will continue this narrative as we enter the studio this Spring to record our forthcoming album - and followup to last year's The Iron Tempests EP!

To hear our previous works, including The Iron Tempests EP - click HERE!

OUR CAMPAIGN: In March, we will be entering the prestigious Blue Sound &
column2: Music Studios to work with engineer Russ Mackay (whose previous clients include Iron Maiden, Mastodon, Styx &
column3:
more) to record our next full-length album! Afterward, we will be embarking on the biggest tour the band has ever taken part of as direct support across Canada for Finland's KALMAH! In order to raise the money needed for these adventures, we booked a 3 and a half week tour across the North American Eastern Seaboard, as well as the US Midwest . Unfortunately, we never received our work permits from US immigration and were forced to cancel the bulk of our tour. We went on to tour JUST eastern Canada as a result, returning home with more debt than when we left. However, we won't let this stop us from realizing our dreams and taking the next biggest step of our careers!

If our Indiegogo campaign is successful, made possible by the people we love and revere the most - YOU -  we will be able to successfully fund the recording process of our next album, get back on the road and continue our quest of spreading our brand of epic metal! By contributing to this campaign, you will support us 100% without any help from any label and allow us to play for newer, larger audiences across the continent and the rest of the Earth!

By purchasing a digital or physical copy of our new album in advance, you will be the direct reason we will be able to chart in Canada and other countries around the world!

column1: WHY VESPERIA NEEDS YOUR HELP: Recording and touring is VERY expensive - and we are constantly under threat of losing money
column2:
whether it be from cancelled tours, or costly van repairs. The only way a modern metal band can get by these days is by proving their talents and ambitions to the world and build a larger fanbase through touring and releasing new material. Last year we were extremely fortunate to compete in the international Wacken Battle at Wacken Open Air in Germany, where to our surprise - we won! We came home with a lot of prizes and a nice chunk of prize money - which went directly into settling a huge merch invoice and our US work permit applications. 

When we had to cancel our US tour in November, we lost A LOT of money. You can read about that HERE. Additionally,  we are still paying for the costly repairs on our van that we had before our last tour of Canada. Sure, we could absolutely record this album ourselves, but we really want to give you all the best product we can possibly create, and that only means working with the best at one of the nicest studios in our area.


To get ourselves back on track and to afford recording our new album, we have created some of - what we believe to be - the most unique and special perks and experiences that will ONLY be available through this crowdfunding campaign.

WHERE YOUR CONTRIBUTION GOES: 100% of the funds raised from this campaign will be used to record our next full-length album. If we reach 100% of our goal, it will cover all of the the tracking, mixing and mastering costs associated with the creation of this beast-of-an-album-to-be. No matter what percentage of our goal we eventually achieve, we will accept each contribution with equal appreciation and gratitude. When we were putting the perks together for this campaign, we realized we really needed to make it special for all of you - because you have all been so incredibly supportive. We needed to create perks that were exciting for you existing fans and for our fans-to-be! 

RISKS &
column3:
CHALLENGES: We understand the risks and hardships that await us in the future. This career path of ours is fraught with trials that are only too well known to both like-minded musicians and music fans. To say we haven't had our share of tough times on this path would be a lie. There are always difficult hurdles to overcome popping up on an almost-daily basis. BUT, we have also enjoyed a large amount of success as a result of taking on these risks. Risk is the key to success, as they say.

We feel like we have made massive leaps in the last year of our careers, having toured from coast to coast numerous times, travelling and playing at prestigious gatherings like Wacken Open Air, having airplay and reviews coming in from around the world and having opportunities arise in our future only strengthen and establish our hunger to create, to tour and to play music. We are all in our mid-twenties, so we have so many years ahead of us as we foster Vesperia into blooming even further. To date we have endured the joys and hardships of being lost, looted, stranded, ripped off, praised,  rejected, supported all while imagining the tens of thousands of hours, dollars, kilometers we have clocked being a touring and recording band. We understand that we may not reach our goal set - as that is a massive amount of money to raise - but that will only be another challenge that we look forward to facing with fervour. 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP: We understand that not all of your will have the means to contribute to our campaign, but would like to help us on this new adventure. We hugely encourage everyone to share this campaign to your friends and family or to someone you know who you think would be interested in what we do! There are some fancy share tools available on this page to help spread the word about us and make some noise about this campaign
column4:
we would be duly grateful if you used them to help us on this long, dark and labourous road!

Thank you so much for your love and support, everyone!
-VESPERIA

From My World I Bring You Greetings
(Пожалуйста, листайте ниже для описания на Русском языке)
Greetings! My name's Daniel and I'm a leader of the Gravity Rain project.
I've been writing music for a long time, and people who know me close enough can tell you for sure that
column5: >music was, is and will be everything for me
column9: >. All my life I've been playing music for the pure love of it, not trying to achieve any special goal in the industry like making an established record, shooting a video or signing to a major label.

column1: But then Gravity Rain emerged which I designed to be some sort of modern melodic /prog/atmospheric metal with clean vocals. I'm really proud of the EP I managed to release a year ago, it is called ""The Shining Silence"", which, fortunately for me, was well received by the audience and got some nice press response, for instance http://www.soundscapemagazine.com/gravityraintheshiningsilence/
You can stream and download the EP here for free - http://gravityrain.bandcamp.com/releases

But this time I really want to make something serious - a big, shiny album that will define and complete my 12-year writing span, and, possibly, a European tour to make this record heard.

""Artifacts of Balance""

This is how my new album is titled. I guess it means that the music on this record is balancing between my old musical concept and a new one. I think it's important to get this music heard because you can't even call it ""metal"", as I try to offer the world something new, something fresh-sounding and mainly differently feeling. But like Guthrie Govan says: ""Talking about music is like dancing about architecture"", so you need to hear it yourself.
Album cover art
I have a complete track list of the album, all ten songs are completely new:

1) Temple of Haste
2) Dive
3) Gist
4) Join
5) Ikameshii (Jotun's Rage)
6) Closer
7) Let It Hurt
8) M.A.D.
9) Chaeon
10) Sunfire
The recording process is 95% finished but at this point I realized that I lack funds to make it all mixed, mastered, printed and played live. And that's when you step in!

So, mixing and mastering is roughly $3500, CD pressing is $1000. There's also a tour which is another $5000. I decided to make it as an additional goal if the campaign succeeds.

The Tour

This tour in support of the new album is really very important for Gravity Rain, if not crucial, because without sufficient funds it's almost impossible to book a tour, especially European one, for an indie Russian band.

A tour is a serious thing, and besides the upsetting fact that it's really hard to make a contact with a booking agency, a tour includes: logistics expenses, accommodation, food, paying venues that we're planning to play in and also the musicians that I'm playing with - they need to be decently paid. But a tour is an opportunity for you to watch us live!
<div>

<div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe class=""embedly-embed"" height=""326"" src=""https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fembed%2FtGBR1BCz3es%3Ffeature%3Doembed&amp
So, if we reach the initial goal it's important not to stop at this point! Let's make a tour possible!
What Do You Get From It?

I think you won't be disappointed with the pre-order packages I prepared for you. Digital downloads, signed CD's, bonus tracks, unreleased tracks, etc. Doesn't a completely guitars-drums-amps-mics plugged online concert specially for you sound fun?
I hate to think that this campaign can fail, but if it will, you have my word on this - I'll find a way to finish this album.
column2: >And as the title of our campaign says - this is not a plea for help, so if the campaign fails the release of the record will just take some more time.

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

If, for some reason, you can't contribute funds to my campaign, you can always share the info about it with your friends and on your networks. This kind of help is hard to underestimate
column2: I sincerely thank you for that!

column1: Final Words
I promise to give you constant updates on the campaign.

Привет! Меня зовут Данил, и Gravity Rain - это мой музыкальный проект.
<div>
Я занимаюсь музыкой вот уже довольно долгое время, и близкие мне люди могут Вам сказать с определённостью и точностью, что
column5: >музыка была, есть и будет для меня всем
column9: >. Всю свою жизнь я занимался музыкой исключительно из-за любви к ней, не пытаясь добиться ничего серьёзного с позиции музыкальной индустрии, вроде записи полноценного альбома, съёмки клипа или подписи контракта с крупным лейблом.

column1: Однако после создания мной проекта Gravity Rain в мае 2014 года ситуация немного изменилась. Gravity Rain создавался мной как melodic/prog/atmospheric metal проект с чистым вокалом и некоторым скандинавским привкусом. За это время я выпустил EP под названием ""The Shining Silence"", которым горжусь, и который, к счастью для меня, был тепло принят публикой и прессой, к примеру ревью - http://www.soundscapemagazine.com/gravityraintheshiningsilence/
Вы можете бесплатно послушать и скачать EP здесь

Но сейчас я очень хочу сделать нечто по-настоящему серьёзное - большой и красивый полноформатник, который смог бы подытожить 12 лет моей музыкальной деятельности, а также, европейское турне в поддержку этой пластинки.
<div>

""Artifacts of Balance""

Так называется мой новый альбом. Я думаю, что он так называется, потому что музыка на нём балансирует между моей старой музыкальной концепцией и новой. Я считаю важным сделать так, чтобы люди услышали эту музыку. Её даже сложно назвать металом, поскольку я стараюсь предложить миру нечто новое, нечто свежо звучащее, а главное - нечто, что прочувствуется иначе, чем просто метал. Однако как сказал Guthrie Govan: ""Разговаривать о музыке - это как танцевать об архитектуре"". Поэтому, лучше Вам послушать это самим.
<div>
Дизайн обложки нового альбома
У меня даже подготовлен полноценный трек-лист с нового альбома (все песни будут новые):

1) Temple of Haste
2) Dive
3) Gist
4) Join
5) Ikameshii (Jotun's Rage)
6) Closer
7) Let It Hurt
8) M.A.D.
9) Chaeon
10) Sunfire
<div>
Запись завершена на 95%, однако моих средств оказалось недостаточно для сведения, мастеринга, печати дисков и турне. Вот на этом этапе я и хотел бы попросить Вашей помощи, друзья.

Итак, сведение и мастеринг в совокупе стоят $3500, печать дисков - ещё $1000. Остаётся европейское турне, которое стоит в среднем $5000. Сбор средств на турне начнётся автоматически здесь же в случае успеха сбора средств на альбом.
Турне

Этот тур в поддержку нового альбома - реально критически важная вещь для Gravity Rain, поскольку без достаточного финансирования практически нереально устроить турне, особенно европейское, для неизвестной инди команды из России.

Турне - очень серьёзная штука, и помимо очень грустного факта о том, что выйти на контакт с букинговым агентством оказалось дико сложной задачей, тур включает в себя следующие расходы: логистика, проживание, питание, оплата аренды площадок, на которых мы будем играть, а также оплата труда музыкантов, играющих со мной. Однако, не смотря на всё это, турне - это всё-таки реальная возможность для Вас увидеть и услышать нас живьём!
<div>

<div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe class=""embedly-embed"" height=""326"" src=""https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fembed%2FtGBR1BCz3es%3Ffeature%3Doembed&amp
Поэтому очень важно не останавливаться если мы достигнем цели финансирования альбома! Давайте добьём до тура!
Чем мы порадуем Вас?

Я думаю, Вы останетесь довольны перками и плюшками, которые я для Вас приготовил! Альбом в цифре, диски с автографом, бонус треки и прочий эксклюзив. Ну неужели не прелесть - персональный концерт или, например, мы играем концерт в реальном времени, а Вы у компьютера кофеёк попиваете?
Мне очень не хотелось бы допускать мысль о том, что эта кампания может провалиться, однако если это случится, я Вам гарантирую - я найду способ завершить альбом, даю Вам слово.
Иные способы

Если по какой-либо причине Вы не можете поддержать мою кампанию деньгами, никаких проблем! Рассказывайте о ней друзьям, репостите и так далее. Такого рода помощь очень сложно переоценить, спасибо Вам за это огромное!
Итоги
Обещаю держать Вас в курсе событий по альбому!
Искренне благодарен за время и за любую поддержку!
Следуй за мной:
<div>
- Official Facebook Page
- Twitter
- Soundcloud
БОЛЬШОЕ СПАСИБО!
","From My World I Bring You Greetings
(Пожалуйста, листайте ниже для описания на Русском языке)
Greetings! My name's Daniel and I'm a leader of the Gravity Rain project.

I've been writing music for a long time, and people who know me close enough can tell you for sure that music was, is and will be everything for me. All my life I've been playing music for the pure love of it, not trying to achieve any special goal in the industry like making an established record, shooting a video or signing to a major label.

But then Gravity Rain emerged which I designed to be some sort of modern melodic /prog/atmospheric metal with clean vocals. I'm really proud of the EP I managed to release a year ago, it is called ""The Shining Silence"", which, fortunately for me, was well received by the audience and got some nice press response, for instance http://www.soundscapemagazine.com/gravityraintheshiningsilence/
You can stream and download the EP here for free - http://gravityrain.bandcamp.com/releases

But this time I really want to make something serious - a big, shiny album that will define and complete my 12-year writing span, and, possibly, a European tour to make this record heard.   ""Artifacts of Balance"" This is how my new album is titled. I guess it means that the music on this record is balancing between my old musical concept and a new one. I think it's important to get this music heard because you can't even call it ""metal"", as I try to offer the world something new, something fresh-sounding and mainly differently feeling. But like Guthrie Govan says: ""Talking about music is like dancing about architecture"", so you need to hear it yourself.
Album cover art
I have a complete track list of the album, all ten songs are completely new:
1) Temple of Haste2) Dive3) Gist4) Join5) Ikameshii (Jotun's Rage)6) Closer7) Let It Hurt8) M.A.D.9) Chaeon10) Sunfire
The recording process is 95% finished but at this point I realized that I lack funds to make it all mixed, mastered, printed and played live. And that's when you step in!
So, mixing and mastering is roughly $3500, CD pressing is $1000. There's also a tour which is another $5000. I decided to make it as an additional goal if the campaign succeeds.   The Tour

This tour in support of the new album is really very important for Gravity Rain, if not crucial, because without sufficient funds it's almost impossible to book a tour, especially European one, for an indie Russian band.

A tour is a serious thing, and besides the upsetting fact that it's really hard to make a contact with a booking agency, a tour includes: logistics expenses, accommodation, food, paying venues that we're planning to play in and also the musicians that I'm playing with - they need to be decently paid. But a tour is an opportunity for you to watch us live!
So, if we reach the initial goal it's important not to stop at this point! Let's make a tour possible!
What Do You Get From It?

I think you won't be disappointed with the pre-order packages I prepared for you. Digital downloads, signed CD's, bonus tracks, unreleased tracks, etc. Doesn't a completely guitars-drums-amps-mics plugged online concert specially for you sound fun?

I hate to think that this campaign can fail, but if it will, you have my word on this - I'll find a way to finish this album. And as the title of our campaign says - this is not a plea for help, so if the campaign fails the release of the record will just take some more time.

Other Ways You Can Help If, for some reason, you can't contribute funds to my campaign, you can always share the info about it with your friends and on your networks. This kind of help is hard to underestimate
column2: I sincerely thank you for that!

Привет! Меня зовут Данил, и Gravity Rain - это мой музыкальный проект.

Я занимаюсь музыкой вот уже довольно долгое время, и близкие мне люди могут Вам сказать с определённостью и точностью, что музыка была, есть и будет для меня всем. Всю свою жизнь я занимался музыкой исключительно из-за любви к ней, не пытаясь добиться ничего серьёзного с позиции музыкальной индустрии, вроде записи полноценного альбома, съёмки клипа или подписи контракта с крупным лейблом.

Mission

For the first time in my life, I finally feel like I am exactly where I am supposed to be. I moved to Nashville one year ago, and  have worked extremely hard this past year, soul searching, writing and finding my voice as an artist. I have wanted to pursue music for as long as I can remember, so after graduating from the University of Wyoming, I moved to Los Angeles to follow my dreams. I recorded a few EP's in Los Angeles, but had no idea what I was doing, who I was as an artist, or how to get the music to the public in an effective way. I was pursing country music  because that is what I thought I should do, and what others thought I should do, etc..After being in Nashville this past year, and leaving the comforts of my friends and family, I had no choice but to get to know myself on a deeper level. This year has been tough, with many up and downs, but I am so excited to have finally found my voice, and to have written songs that actually mean something to me, not just songs I think could make it big on the radio or that others want to hear..It feels great!!! This new album ""HOME"" is my story and I am so excited to share it with you.
How you can help:

Creating music doesn't come cheap, and as much as I hate asking for help, I am at the point in my life where I can no longer do it alone. I have put everything I have into this project, but could really use your help to finish it!!
Here is a breakdown of where the donations will be going:
1. In order to compensate my amazing producer Dewey Boyd for his dedication to my vision and his time away from his family: Production/Mixing/Editing/ Studio Time: $5000
2.The super talented hand picked musicians we hired to bring these songs to life: $2,250

3.Mastering (an vital part of the process: Taylor Bray: $375
4. Gabe Ford at Ford Photographs for capturing the moments through pictures and videos so we can remember them forever and use them for marketing and promotions. $1600
Music Video: $3000
Whats Next:

After several failed attempts at making an album, I am finally going to go all in and do it the right way. Previously I would record an EP and release it and wonder why nothing happened. I was missing a very key ingredient...MARKETING!!!!! So, I am working with a few very talented individuals to get the EP heard by as many people as possible. We are undergoing a two month marketing campaign starting today.
5. Deshawn Oravetz at Sky Creative Entertainment Group for marketing, website design, logo design and album artwork: $2500
6. Publicist: $2000
7. Project manager: Erin at Olivia Management $1000

The Impact

I have put my heart and soul into this project, and it would mean the world to me if this album brought a smile to someones face, made their day, picked them up when they are going through a hard time, or inspired them to follow their dreams.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you can't contribute, but I would still greatly appreciate your help

  • I would be forever grateful if you could just simply share this campaign with your friends and family.

At age 65, after having lived a life of mostly non-musical stuff (although always keen to listen), I am about to realize my dream of releasing a debut CD.   Come join with me on this journey, and especially if you are one of those baby boomers about to become a senior, take inspiration to follow your unfulfilled dreams.  This album is going to be somewhat unique in that I am synthesizing the talents of visual artists, poets, songwriters and accompanying musicians to produce a rather personal album permeated with some unifying themes that send out a message essential to be heard in the dilemmas of our current age.  Accompanying me in the studio will be Raphael Keelan, Frances Locs (flute), Sarah Beatty, Laura Bates (violin), Tom Juhas (electric slide guitar) and Kelsey McNulty (keyboards).  The artwork on the inside cover, being done by Beverly Pearl, will be worth the price of the CD itself.   Have a look at the many updates here to get a sense of the flavour of this project.

DDD1 cover art by Chris Monroe
DULUTH DOES DYLAN: An Overview

Every five years since 2001, musicians in and around the burgeoning cultural scene of Duluth, Minnesota, have released a compilation album of cover songs by their city's most famous son: Bob Dylan, who was born Robert Zimmerman in Duluth's St. Luke's Hospital in 1941, and lived in the town for his first six years before moving an hour north to Hibbing, Minnesota.   www.duluthdoesdylan.com
The Project

We've enrolled the musicians ~ over 15 bands and over 50+ talented combined artists from around Duluth, Minnesota and have begun recording what will become the 4th CD in the series.  Recording is happening now at Sacred Heart Recording Studio and will be released in May of 2016 to commemorate the 75th birthday of Bob Dylan ~ including plans for a special CD release show in Duluth &
<figure style=""margin: 0px
The Influence

Like F. Scott Fitzgerald's fictional Jay Gatsby, Dylan has a famously conflicted relationship with ""the north country"" - changing his name and creating alternate biographies to mask his origins, and rarely discussing his personal history. Yet Dylan has referenced the area - often elliptically, of course, and subject to interpretation - in songs including Highway 61 Revisited (which abuts Duluth), Desolation Row, Walls of Red Wing, Girl from the North Country, North Country Blues, and most directly Something There Is About You, among other songs. Residents of the area also enjoy recognizing features of his famously unique accent as characteristically Minnesotan.

This fractured relationship, however, only creates a more interesting dynamic between Duluth musicians and Dylan. Like previous ""Duluth Does Dylan"" albums, this album is not offered as a simple homage or touristy trinket. Instead, One More Cup of Duluth Does Dylan presents a complex response by musicians who cannot help but have something to say about the work of their city's most famous son, and occasionally to rework one of his songs.
The Impact

Like the first 3 successful compilation CD's, it's a special relationship that exists in the old port town of Duluth in the core of it's music and the hearts of it's musicians.  Bob Dylan's music and his stories through the voices, eyes and their interpretations.
The Weary Tunesmiths

""Tucked into a hillside on the tip of Lake Superior, this rugged and industrial port city harbors a restless, eclectic and creative music scene.""  ""It's a vibe that's as palpable as it is difficult to define.""
~ Brad Nelson, Ripsaw News

Since the release of the initial compilation project, Duluth Does Dylan, released in 2001, the city of Duluth has further embraced Bob Dylan.  The city has installed named a downtown street after him ""Bob Dylan Way"" and installed comemorative manhole covers and a group of area business owners and Dylan advocates formed a nonprofit organization and produces a Duluth Dylan Days week long festival including film, music and a unique ""Blood On The Tracks Express"" ~ a musical train ride up the scenic North  Shore of Minnesota to Hibbing, MN and back featuring local music throughout the ride.

","DDD1 cover art by Chris Monroe
DULUTH DOES DYLAN: An Overview

Every five years since 2001, musicians in and around the burgeoning cultural scene of Duluth, Minnesota, have released a compilation album of cover songs by their city's most famous son: Bob Dylan, who was born Robert Zimmerman in Duluth's St. Luke's Hospital in 1941, and lived in the town for his first six years before moving an hour north to Hibbing, Minnesota.   www.duluthdoesdylan.com
The Project

We've enrolled the musicians ~ over 15 bands and over 50+ talented combined artists from around Duluth, Minnesota and have begun recording what will become the 4th CD in the series.  Recording is happening now at Sacred Heart Recording Studio and will be released in May of 2016 to commemorate the 75th birthday of Bob Dylan ~ including plans for a special CD release show in Duluth & Minneapolis.
Bob Dylan
The Influence

Like F. Scott Fitzgerald's fictional Jay Gatsby, Dylan has a famously conflicted relationship with ""the north country"" - changing his name and creating alternate biographies to mask his origins, and rarely discussing his personal history. Yet Dylan has referenced the area - often elliptically, of course, and subject to interpretation - in songs including Highway 61 Revisited (which abuts Duluth), Desolation Row, Walls of Red Wing, Girl from the North Country, North Country Blues, and most directly Something There Is About You, among other songs. Residents of the area also enjoy recognizing features of his famously unique accent as characteristically Minnesotan.

This fractured relationship, however, only creates a more interesting dynamic between Duluth musicians and Dylan. Like previous ""Duluth Does Dylan"" albums, this album is not offered as a simple homage or touristy trinket. Instead, One More Cup of Duluth Does Dylan presents a complex response by musicians who cannot help but have something to say about the work of their city's most famous son, and occasionally to rework one of his songs.
The Impact

Like the first 3 successful compilation CD's, it's a special relationship that exists in the old port town of Duluth in the core of it's music and the hearts of it's musicians.  Bob Dylan's music and his stories through the voices, eyes and their interpretations.
The Weary Tunesmiths

Tucked into a hillside on the tip of Lake Superior, this rugged and industrial port city harbors a restless, eclectic and creative music scene.""  ""It's a vibe that's as palpable as it is difficult to define.""
~ Brad Nelson, Ripsaw News

Cathedral

Sacred Heart towers over Duluth's Central Hillside neighborhood and overlooks  Lake Superior.  Sacred Heart, built in 1894 and listed on the National Register of Historic Places, complete with arched plaster ceilings, wood floors, stained glass windows and unmatched acoustics is an outstanding setting to capture the energy of Twin Ports music.
Sacred Heart Recording Studio
Making It All Happen

The group of Duluth music enthusiasts consists of Tom Fabjance, Tim and Brad Nelson.  Tom and Tim produced the first Duluth Does Dylan compilation in 2001, producing a new compilation DDD cd every five years.
cover art by Lydia Daum

cover art by Jessica Liszewski

Tim, Brad and Tom have all been involved with the music scene in Duluth for 20+ years!  Both Tim & Brad are Duluth area musicians and have been involved in many events, festivals, music-zines, nightclubs and recording projects.  Tom Fabjance, a Chicago transplant, is a music producer and engineer that has also been involved in the Duluth music scene for many years.
Black-eyed Snakes feat. Charlie Parr

Other folks helping us make this all possible are Dan Dresser & William Hurst.  Dan is our videographer on the project with plans of releasing a 20-minute short film documenting the project and it's artists.  William Hurst has been brought on board as our official project photographer!

This will be the fourth compilation CD in the series which was initially released in 2001.  The first three projects were all self funded and involved only Tim & Tom.  We've decided we need help on this one as we plan for this to be the most successful of the four and are very pleased to have Brad, Dan & William on board.

My card catalog is pristine. My words, my production are all filed under M for Me, because I know what my fans want and I'm a servant to my fans. Peruse the aisles of my mind and understand that I am a lyricist with a sound. Music. Boom. Bap. Snare. ...bars. The only thing that kills darkness is light and the only thing that kills silence is NOISE. Who am I? I'm Mel Wellman and I make noise in the library. I don't have followers, I have leaders who like me. Join me in funding my campaign to tour the east coast. 

Here's the breakdown:
It is expensive to tour/travel. Renting a van, gas, merchandise,food, lodge etc. These are all expenses that will be coming directly from my pocket! I have always believed, ""If you don't believe and invest in yourself then no one will.""

So, your funds will help me purchase a college radio marketing campaign, which is roughly  $2,000 or more. Any additional funds raised will go to travel, lodge and high quality merchandise for FANS! 

Lastly, I am aware that not everyone will be able to support financially, and that is perfectly fine. I just ask that you repost the link to the campaign across your social media networks!
