KlezFactor: Europa
Welcome to our IndieGoGo campaign! KlezFactor is getting ready to produce its third CD, Europa.

KlezFactor was founded by Mike Anklewicz in Toronto, Ontario, Canada in 2004 and recorded The Golem of Bathurst Manor in 2005 and Klezmachine in 2008. While we've been fairly quiet on the recording front since then, we've definitely played all over the place!

In 2009, we did a three-city tour in the US, hitting Boston, New York City, and Philadelphia and we played the Montreal International Jazz Festival in 2010, followed by the Junction Arts Festival (Toronto) that fall.

In late-2011, Mike went to Germany and founded a German version of KlezFactor, playing in several gigs in Berlin and Bayreuth. This version of the band spurred Mike to some more creativity and he's been working on composing new music for the KlezFactor project all while finishing his PhD in Ethnomusicology at York University in Toronto. With the degree finished, Dr. Mike is ready to usher in a new era of KlezFactor with a European tour and the recording of a new album.
The Band
Mike Anklewicz is the bandleader, composer, saxophonist and clarinetist. He is joined by Alex Bayer (bass), Florian von Frieling (guitar), Finlay Panter (drums) and Daniel Weltlinger (violin).

Mike hails from Toronto, Canada and has performed and studied klezmer since 1998. He's studying with some of the best in the world at this Eastern-European genre and has taught, performed and recorded all over Canada, the US and Europe.
Alex is from Germany and is the founder of Pentelho, a world music fusion band in Berlin with Balkan and Latin influences.
Florian also comes from Germany (after studying in the Netherlands) and is a fantastic guitarist who has his own trio and plays in a huge variety of bands ranging from pop to swing.
Fin, from Liverpool, England, is a progressive drummer with one foot in traditional music and one foot in the experimental/improvisational realm.
Daniel has recently made Berlin his home, coming from Sydney, Australia and plays gypsy swing with Lulo Reinhardt and Daniel recently released his CD ""Koblenz.""
What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

We already have time booked as a band in Berlin this summer. What we need is the money to rehearse, record, mix, master and produce the new album!

column1: We're looking for $7100 Canadian to fund all this! You might ask ""why so little?"" Well, things are a little cheaper over in Berlin and we're planning on letting our musicianship do the talking, getting as much as we can for the recording in our live concerts rather than spending days upon days in a recording studio.
We are NOT looking for funding for our tour! Those expenses are already taken care of.

All of the funds raised in this campaign will go directly to the recording. If we don't reach our entire goal, we'll still make the recording! While we're expecting to be able to pay our musicians at least something for their hard work, this fee is probably the first to go since all of our other expenses for the recording are pretty fixed.
We need:

$1550 CDN - Recording Costs (1100 Euros)
$1000 CDN - Mixing
$500-1000 CDN- Mastering
$1000 CDN - Duplication
$700 CDN - Art/Design
$1700 CDN - Musician Fees
Total: $7100 CDN
Perks
All perks include the entire package of the previous perk list (i.e., $50 package contains new items plus all of the items in the $35 package).
<ul>
• $10 - Digital Download of KlezFactor: Europa
• $25 - CD Copy of KlezFactor: Europa
• $35 - KlezFactor Digital Library ($25 package PLUS digital copies of The Golem of Bathurst Manor, the unreleased Ashkenaz Concert (2006) and Klezmachine)
• $50 - Your Name in the liner notes of KlezFactor: Europa and a CD Library of KlezFactor's recordings
• $75 - a signed copy of a book of sheet music with all of KlezFactor's original compositions
• $100 - a limited edition KlezFactor: Europa T-Shirt
• $150 - a signed, limited edition photo book of photos from KlezFactor's recording and tour as well as Mike Anklewicz's 2015 travels in Europe, Turkey and Kazakhstan
• $300 - a private lesson in Toronto with Mike Anklewicz on your instrument of choice in klezmer, jazz or classical styles

The Impact

KlezFactor has been making their own brand of klezmer-fusion for the last 10 years. Bandleader Mike Anklewicz completed a PhD in ethnomusicology studying how klezmer music has always been blending its own sounds with those of other cultures. While it's important to keep ""traditional"" klezmer alive, KlezFactor is part of a long tradition that saw klezmer as one part of a cosmopolitan musical landscape.

The unique sounds of KlezFactor have been heard far beyond the places the band has performed. Through radio, internet and even TV, KlezFactor's music has been heard around the world.

We're proud to have had our music used to underscore the bio video of Montreal-born author Mordecai Richler, with narration by Christopher Plummer, for his induction into Canada's Walk of Fame in 2011. By helping us produce more original klezmer-fusion, we feel that we can continue to bring relevant music that reflects the Canadian Jewish experience to the wider world.

Other Ways You Can Help

While a financial contribution is one way that you can help us reach our goal, there are other ways that you can do your bit to make KlezFactor: Europa come to life.

  • Spread the word to people in your social networks who are interested in klezmer, in jazz, and in new, independent music!

• Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Hello Tech Support Professionals!

We have been touring in our beloved ""Bonerstorm"" for the past 5 years, a 1993 GMC rally STX to which we owe, (at the time of this writing,) 4 full cross-Canadian trips, several trips down the west coast/middle of the U.S., and countless mini tours around our beautiful province of British Columbia and our neighbors in Alberta. This van has been used a lot, to say the least. Which is why you are reading this right now.

We are in need of something more reliable. If you take a few minutes to watch Oli tour you through ""Bonerstorm,"" we believe you'll be able to sympathize with our situation. This is where you come in.

We have put together a pretty cool list of perks, everything from $1 for people who can't spare much, to $200 for people who feel truly generous, and everything in between. We even feel grateful you're even still reading this, and if nothing else, coming to a show and giving us a ""stay tech!"" means the world to us. However, if you are able, we encourage you to take a look at the perks and do what you can, it will help us purchase a more reliable vehicle in which we can travel around and keep bringing you the best live show we are capable of. Also the old van smells brutally musty and is full of mold, so we might die if we don't get something new, and I don't mean die in the distant future, I mean soon. Very soon.

Also, just by sharing this campaign you'll be putting your name into a random draw to win a very killer Seymour Duncan Pickups Shirt! There are a couple available, so to be eligible, please share this campaign on facebook, and tag the band @archspire. That's it!

Thanks for you time!

Stay Tech

Archspire

Dean, Tobi, Spencer, and Oli.

","Hello Tech Support Professionals!We have been touring in our beloved ""Bonerstorm"" for the past 5 years, a 1993 GMC rally STX to which we owe, (at the time of this writing,) 4 full cross-Canadian trips, several trips down the west coast/middle of the U.S., and countless mini tours around our beautiful province of British Columbia and our neighbors in Alberta. This van has been used a lot, to say the least. Which is why you are reading this right now.We are in need of something more reliable. If you take a few minutes to watch Oli tour you through ""Bonerstorm,"" we believe you'll be able to sympathize with our situation. This is where you come in.We have put together a pretty cool list of perks, everything from $1 for people who can't spare much, to $200 for people who feel truly generous, and everything in between. We even feel grateful you're even still reading this, and if nothing else, coming to a show and giving us a ""stay tech!"" means the world to us. However, if you are able, we encourage you to take a look at the perks and do what you can, it will help us purchase a more reliable vehicle in which we can travel around and keep bringing you the best live show we are capable of. Also the old van smells brutally musty and is full of mold, so we might die if we don't get something new, and I don't mean die in the distant future, I mean soon. There are a couple available, so to be eligible, please share this campaign on facebook, and tag the band @archspire. Hello, 

      My name is Jacob Paul Allen, and I'm a professional musician. This means playing music is my full-time job. However, before we dive further into that, let’s travel back to five year old me. I would have told you I wanted to be a movie star (maybe I still do), the 12 year old me would have told you I wanted to be a fighter pilot, the 17 year old me didn't have a clue and the 21 year old me was thinking seriously of a career in Forensic Science. Now, here's where the curve ball comes. I end up with a guitar in my hands at 22, I played my first open mic at 26, got paid my first $50 for a gig at 28, started my first band (HOBOJAC) shortly after that and then became a full-time musician around the age of 30!

      Now, here I am, 34 years old, a full-time musician, and loving it. It is incredibly rewarding and I am so thankful that I am able to do what I love and extremely grateful for everything that I have been able to accomplish so far. However,  as rewarding as the job is, the challenges of the profession are great as well. One of those challenges, when you are an “independent” musician, is coming up with the financial means necessary to record an album ""the right way."" This is precisely where you folks come in. The purpose of this campaign is to help me raise the funds that are needed to record my debut album, which will take my music career to the next level. Like any other business, when it comes to music, you have to work your way up through the ranks. I can stay down in the lobby going around in circles in the revolving door, but I’d rather get a professional album together, step out of the door and onto the elevator heading on up to the next level to see what I can accomplish there.

       With your help in the form of a contribution to my “Southern Love” campaign, I will be able to get out of that “revolving door” and head towards the elevator. I’ll be able to buy studio time, hire sound engineers and producers,  pay musicians, get album artwork/stickers/T-Shirts designed and have the CD's duplicated, packaged and ready to spread to the masses. All of this will cost me an estimated $7,500. I have some awesome perks lined up for different levels of contributions to the campaign, so please check those out, contribute if you can, share with friends and help me spread some ""Southern Love!"" 

Cheers

For as long as I can remember I have wanted to sing. My passion is music. I want to make it as an artist.

For my video I took on a challenging song to take me out my comfort zone. It is a live unmanipulated single take with my band.

""Jeez girl, you can sing!"" Lucie Silvas

""I can honestly say her voice is even more amazing live"" Tom, DJ at Croydon Radio.

""The world needs a little more Chess. She's beautiful,  she has a beautiful spirit and her voice is beautiful"" Zalon

""You never cease to amaze me. You are growing from strength to strength. You are living proof that hard work, does really work! Joshua Alamu

Number 1 in the Maltese radio charts, with debut single 'Stilettos'.

Nominated for Best Solo Artist in Malta at the Malta Music awards (2014).

I want to use this campaign to get me to the next stage of my career. A successful campaign will do this for two reasons:

1) It is essential for me to have a collection of well produced covers in my portfolio that people can listen and relate to. I want to be able to show versatility and creativity whilst paying respect to some timeless songs that people can enjoy. I have covered many songs trying to find my vocal style, such as 'Say You Love Me' - Jessie Ware.

2) Once I gain a bigger following and some new fans, my original songs can take more of a priority and I can invest the amount of professionalism that the songs need in order to get them up to, or surpass, standard. Although, I will always re-create existing songs into covers throughout my career.

For this project I will produce a cover album named CHESS: THE GREAT GIG and videos of each of the following amazing songs:

1. Oh, had I a golden thread, Eva Cassidy

2. You make me feel like natural woman, Aretha Franklin

3. I've got to see you again, Norah Jones

4. Somebody to love, Queen

5. At last, Etta James

6. Cry me a river, Julie London

7. Kissing You, Des'ree

8. Will you be there, Michael Jackson

9. All that Jazz, Chicago

10. The Great Gig in the Sky, Pink Floyd

If I am lucky enough to raise any additional funds, the money will go towards the release of my first album.

The biggest current challenge I face is supporting myself financially while I try and break into a music industry that has changed beyond recognition. Working low paid jobs takes so much of my time and energy away from music. It also limits the amount of money I can put towards my own music production that will help me break into the industry.

The chances of being signed by a major record label are far smaller than ever before with the internet giving everybody access to free or cheap music. Especially, as there are so many really really talented artists online. My challenge is to break through this and produce music that people want to hear. One thing that will never change is that people will always listen to good music.


A specific challenge for this project is while working a day job, finishing the recording, mixing, filming, editing and mastering could take longer than planned, which would mean that you might have to wait a little longer than you expect for your rewards. If that were to happen, I would keep you updated throughout the process.

I don't think there is a significant risk that I will not be able to finish the cover recordings and videos. Firstly, because they are very well planned out. Secondly, I have a great team already lined up to work on them with me. Finally, music is my life. It means everything to me and not producing this music is unfathomable to me.

If I am lucky enough to receive more money than I have aimed for (please note the amount above is the bare minimum and I will still have to pay for things myself too)

If I reach:

£5,500 - I will also record a new original song.

£6,500 - I will record a new original song and make a professional looking video for it.

£7,500 - The above plus make a better webiste and new commercial logo which will be up to industry standard!

Anything more goes towards my next record!

USC Men's Chorus, a short history....long tradition

Two years ago Apollo hit an all time low of 16 singers. My fellow conductors and I saw this as an opportunity to refine the mission and vision of Apollo as a brotherhood of trust and respect, vulnerability to express, and share with others the joy of our music making. We did not realize at the time that we were a part of a century old USC Men's Glee Club tradition. According to the 1912 student handbook the men's glee club was well-known on the concert circuit, with an annual tour that included a stop in Chicago.
USC Men's Glee Club, 1920
Men's and Women's Glee Club from the 1920's
Now, the brotherhood of Apollo has grown from 16 to nearly 60 men strong. This does not take into account the countless number of alumni.
Apollo Men's Chorus Now

The past two years have been filled with inspiring performances (please check out our video gallery and Youtube channel.) In order to celebrate and establish the return of the historic USC Men's Chorus tradition, we have already begun creating an album of the best music from the last two years. Apollo's album production team consists of passionate professionals who have either conducted or sung in Apollo and who are donating a generous portion of their time to record, design, master, and lead this project. Your contributions will help us finish recording this year's group and produce the compilation CD. Because the amount we need to complete our project far exceeds our annual budget, I knew we could take our request for help to our friends, the Trojan family, and beyond. Help us create our first album in over 15 years and put USC Apollo Men's Chorus back in the spotlight! 

What We Need &

LONG STORY SHORT

My name's Alex Johnson and I'm a singer/songwriter. 5 Months ago I packed up my clothes and any music equipment that could fit in my car and moved to ""Music City"". Not knowing a soul and leaving my friends and family behind. You may ask why someone would do something so crazy...Here's my story


WHO AM I?

As a young boy, I didn't have much. But what I did have was music. My dad would play Queen and Led Zeppelin records while I pretended to be Freddie Mercury and danced around our little apartment. It wasn't until my dad got me my first cheap acoustic guitar that I fell in love with songwriting. 

After my parents divorce, I moved across the country to North Carolina with my mom. She encouraged me to take piano lessons but my acoustic guitar was the one thing that kept me close to my Father. From that point on, I would lock myself in my room and play guitar for hours. At age 15, I was already playing locally and opening for National Touring acts. I knew that this is what I wanted to do for the rest of my life. 


WHAT AM I DOING?

///This project is so that I can record a 5 song EP with Andy Sheridan and Anthony Raglin, who are great producers in Nashville, TN. With your support I can make this dream happen.///

I want to work with Andy and Anthony because they're amazing producers with great connections and wants to help me get my music to the right people. Andy Sheridan is the creative director for Hunter Hayes and his band will be doing all of the session work for me. I believe he's going to be able to take my songs to the next level and keep my authenticity and sound.

WHY THE %$#* DOES IT COST SO MUCH?

I recorded my last two songs in a basement. They sound great for a local artist. But, In order to get my songs heard by labels, publishers and radio stations, I need to record with someone that knows the business and can get me radio worthy recordings.
column6:
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">

I've already put forth all the money I can give for this without living in a VAN DOWN BY THE RIVER. I need your help to cover the rest.
column13:
s=abf2ac85453e60ad5dc267c0348fbdfb"" src="""" style=""""/> 

The $11,000 will be going straight to recording, mixing, mastering and then a music video.

With your help I can follow my dreams and work with an amazing producer and tell my story the way it was meant to be told.

column1: -Studio Time
-Mixing
-Mastering
-Music Video
WHY SHOULD I HELP THIS GUY?
Some kids wanted to be firefighters and professional athletes growing up.
I knew I wanted to play music. Ever since I held my first guitar, I knew that was my future.
Help me to record this album and I promise you that I won't stop until i've reached my dreams.
<div>
This album will be dedicated to YOU! My friends and family are my backbone and i'd be nowhere without their support and love.

SHORT STORY (voor Nederlands: zie onder)

>
column2: New York based top producer Bryce Goggin (Antony &
column3:
the Johnsons, Pavement, Joan As Police Woman) invited us to record our first EP.
>
column4:
We are C. Love Detectives, a popduo from Europe, writing catchy electro-popsongs (The Ting Tings enjoying Lana Del Rey French kissing Lily Allen).
>
column5:
Now we need your help to make this happen!

>
column7:
WARNING IN ADVANCE: don't panic if you don't have a creditcard, you can also contribute by sending your funds to IBAN BE340631 8269 5390, name: D. Van den Hende, BIC: GKCCBEBB. Mention ""crowdfunding"" + ""name perk"" + ""your emailadres!!""

HOW THE STORY STARTED

column1: We teamed
up as songwriters/musicians in 2014, aiming to write a bunch of <b>killer pop
songs, so we could sell those songs to Rihanna and spend the royalties  by drinking cocktails on a sunny island forever
lasting. No kidding, that was the plan…
Unfortunately
we kinda liked our babies too much,  especially
“If Courtney Love (Has Found The Plane)”, inspired by how Courtney Love claimed
to have found the missing Malaysian plane. The song is also the reason for our band name C. Love Detectives.
By
accident, this song was also broadcasted on our favorite Belgian radio station
Studio Brussels. No way back. Exit Rihanna dreams. Enter world domination, our
own private jets and you flying co-pilote to the Grammy’s with us. We can
dream, right?
HOW THE STORY FLIPPED
After one
of our exhausting writing sessions we laid down on the carpet, listening to our
favourite music. When “The Deep Field” by Joan As Policewoman came along, we
agreed that the sound of that album was so damn good. Tired, slightly drunk and
for that reason also extremely fearless, we emailed the producer of that album,
saying ""we wanted him"" and ""we wanted him to want us too"" (those words exactly…).
One hour
later he got back to us, saying he liked what he heard, asking us if we would
be interested to come to New York to record in his studio.
Enter Bryce
Goggin (Antony &
column2: the Johnsons, Pavement, Joan As Policewoman) in the <b>C.

column1: Love Detectives story.
WHERE STORY IS GOING TO
We wrote
the songs. We got the producer. So here’s the plan…
We’re
heading to NYC in June, recording our first EP with Bryce Goggin.
Release
planned in September, followed by some showcases and club concerts.
Big goal is
playing the festivals of summer 2016. It’s a long shot, but we’re confident this
is the right order of steps.
WHY WE NEED YOU
We live in
Belgium (Divan) and The Netherlands (M.), so New York is quite a journey for
us.
If you can
help us collecting the funds for travel, residency and studio time, we promise
you some great music by September and tons of fun perks in return for your

support. 

***

(Nederlands) IN HET KORT

Top producer uit New York, Bryce Goggin, nodigt ons uit om onze eerste cd op te nemen in New York. Bryce Goggin is o.a. producer van Antony &
column2:
The Johnsons, Joan As Police Woman.

Wij zijn C. Love Detectives. Divan uit Vlaanderen, M. uit Nederland. Een catchy electro-popduo. Klinkt als: The Ting Tings + Lana Del Rey + Lilly Allen in 1 blender. 

We hebben jouw hulp nodig om dit te realiseren!!

Je kunt ons sponsoren door rechts op de roze knop ""contribute now"" te klikken, maar ook door iets over te maken naar:
column8: Vermeld in de omschrijving ""NEW YORK"" + "" je naam en adresgegevens""

After one
of our exhausting writing sessions we laid down on the carpet, listening to our
favourite music. When “The Deep Field” by Joan As Policewoman came along, we
agreed that the sound of that album was so damn good. Tired, slightly drunk and
for that reason also extremely fearless, we emailed the producer of that album,
saying ""we wanted him"" and ""we wanted him to want us too"" (those words exactly…).
One hour
later he got back to us, saying he liked what he heard, asking us if we would
be interested to come to New York to record in his studio.
Enter Bryce
Goggin (Antony & the Johnsons, Pavement, Joan As Policewoman) in the C.
Love Detectives story.
WHERE STORY IS GOING TO
We wrote
the songs. We got the producer. So here’s the plan…
We’re
heading to NYC in June, recording our first EP with Bryce Goggin.
Release
planned in September, followed by some showcases and club concerts.
Big goal is
playing the festivals of summer 2016. It’s a long shot, but we’re confident this
is the right order of steps.
WHY WE NEED YOU
We live in
Belgium (Divan) and The Netherlands (M.), so New York is quite a journey for
us.
If you can
help us collecting the funds for travel, residency and studio time, we promise
you some great music by September and tons of fun perks in return for your

support. ***(Nederlands) IN HET KORTTop producer uit New York, Bryce Goggin, nodigt ons uit om onze eerste cd op te nemen in New York. Bryce Goggin is o.a. producer van Antony & The Johnsons, Joan As Police Woman.Wij zijn C. Love Detectives. Divan uit Vlaanderen, M. uit Nederland. Een catchy electro-popduo. Klinkt als: The Ting Tings + Lana Del Rey + Lilly Allen in 1 blender. We hebben jouw hulp nodig om dit te realiseren!!Je kunt ons sponsoren door rechts op de roze knop ""contribute now"" te klikken, maar ook door iets over te maken naar:D. Van den Hende, IBAN BE34 0631 8269 5390  M. Peters, NL13 SNSB 0908 2374 05 >>>Vermeld in de omschrijving ""NEW YORK"" + "" je naam en adresgegevens""",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Brussels, Belgium",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/c-love-detectives-recording-in-nyc/pica

column11: >Hi, my name is Tom Tracy and I am producing the music for Allie's EP.
column12: >When Allie came into my recording studio with her mom in November of 2014, I was extremely impressed with her abilities as a writer, singer and guitarist and I knew at that moment that I wanted to work with her. Her skills and comfort level in all three areas far exceeded my expectations for someone who is 20 years old. Her songs are thoughtful and challenging, melodic in structure, and often connect on a deep personal level. I  sincerely hope that you will help us make her vision a reality and thanks in advance for any contribution you can make.

column1: ","Hi , I'm Allie and I'm recording my first CD and video and I need your help to make it happen!
With
the help of crowd funding, people such as yourself now have the
opportunity to share in my creative vision, and to help me to achieve my dreams and goals that without your help, might not be

possible. I started writing my own songs when I was eleven and have found it to be the best way for me to express the things I'm going through in a positive way. I  hope my songs will touch those who listen in the same way, so they know that they are not alone in these challenging times we live in. Spreading my music to many people and being a positive influence on those who hear my songs would be the greatest gift I could hope to experience.
My goal is to raise $7500.00, which will go toward the costs of the production of my EP and video. These costs include studio time, the musicians’ fees for rehearsals
and their contribution to the recording, the producers’ fee, the costs of
artwork and duplication costs for the  CD, a website, and the costs of
a professionally produced music video.

Hi, my name is Tom Tracy and I am producing the music for Allie's EP.  When Allie came into my recording studio with her mom in November of 2014, I was extremely impressed with her abilities as a writer, singer and guitarist and I knew at that moment that I wanted to work with her. Her skills and comfort level in all three areas far exceeded my expectations for someone who is 20 years old. Her songs are thoughtful and challenging, melodic in structure, and often connect on a deep personal level. I  sincerely hope that you will help us make her vision a reality and thanks in advance for any contribution you can make.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

Breve reseña

Mi nombre es Mike Aguilar y soy un cautautor costarricense que busca dar a conocer su musica, la cual es sencilla sincera y hecha con todo el corazon.
Lo que busco es lograr grabar un EP de 8 canciones y para lo cual necesito la colaboracion de toda la gente que crea en mi musica y en el arte en general.
Espero que una vez terminado este disco y escuchen el material se den cuenta que su gran aporte sea el que sea logro plasmarse en un trabajo del cual ustedes son parte.

column3: >El costo de una produccion de alta calidad ronda aproximadamente en $300 por cancion por esa razon necesito para lograr el disco un aproximado de $2500.
>Esto incluye el estudio de grabacion, transporte y mezcla del mismo.

column1:
El impacto

La gente que me conoce sabe que mi musica fomenta los buenos mensajes y da a conocer sentimientos que algunos quieren expresar pero a veces cuesta.
Todas y cada una de las personas que me acompanen en este viaje seran parte organica de este material, y estaran conmigo desde el inicio hasta el final.
Este disco seremos todos y para todos y cada uno sera.

Riesgos y desafíos

En caso de no lograr el objetivo grabare los temas que pueda y seguire tocando otras puertas hasta lograrlo.
En caso de no lograr grabar los 8 temas con esta campana al menos se podra iniciar y con algun material en mano podre tocar puertas de patrocinios y ayuda a gente que crea en el arte.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Compartiendo la campana, gente que sepa de ayuda en medios, de diseno, de fotografia, de creacion, cantantes TODA ayuda de cualquier forma es valida y super valiosa.

Finally, one of storytelling's best loved humorists creates a recording for kids that the grown-ups can bear to listen to over and over again (without being tempted to hang it from the car mirror as a pretty reflect-o rainbow decoration).
column2: >*Master Storyteller, humorist and professional whistler (honest-to-goodness) Andy Offutt Irwin tells the truth and makes you laugh at it. His
column4:
> ages approach is perfect family fare on this recording, his first kid-centric album. Don't worry grown-ups, you too will be laughing.  A lot. 

(* We get to put the asterisk because Andy is bonafide with awards and stuff.)

ANDY SAYS...
column5: >The idea all started at a gig one day, when two-time Grammy® Award winner, Cathy Fink was looking at my merch.  She asked, “So which of these albums is the kids’ CD?”

column1: I said, “Um… I don’t really have a kids’ CD.”
Indeed, Cathy was shocked
column2: she peddled back in bewilderement. The back of her hand met her forehead and she cried, “WHAT?!!!…” (Okay, I may be over-dramatic-izing.  But still...)

column1: As silly as it seems, I have never done a kid-specific album. Oh, sure, kids listen to my music and stories all the time, and I perform at schools and libraries with most of the audience sitting on the floor, and forced to watch me. And I have been the big ol’ keynote performer for the Library of Congress, Virburnum Foundation/Center of the Book thingy.  BUT… this is the first time I have been conscious about doing a kids’ album. The tenth anniversary of my first performance at the National Storytelling Festival seems like a good time.
TAKE A LOOK AT THE NEAT-O PERKS!   ––––––>

Andy's Wild Amphibian Show! – the title story for this CD comes from a program I developed for Young Audiences, Woodruff Arts Center in Atlanta called, “Offutt’s Environmental Epic Show.” It speaks of the interconnectedness of all of us.
Within the story, a subtext emerges – the environmental truth that we are all downstream from somebody, and somebody is downstream from us. (I do mean that figuratively and literarily, by the way.)
The Woodruff Arts Center says…

“Saving the environment is serious global business, but Andy manages to bring the issue closer to home with his usual comic flair. With his friend Johnny, he wades down the local creek all the way to the Atlantic Ocean, learning important lessons along the way about pollution, recycling, the food chain, and the interdependence of all living things.""
column5:
/>  


HOW KIDS MIGHT LOOK AT IT

With the title story, think Sea World, only with free range amphibians. This album is funny.  Um… I’ll dare say, really funny. It’s practical-joke-make-people-think-they-are-being-haunted-by-dead-frogs funny.  It’s grape-jelly-apple-jelly-petroleum-jelly funny. It is scatological-mouth-noises funny. I know this stuff is funny because I have performed in hundreds of schools and festival kid shows over the last ten years, and kids tell me I am funny (and, trust me, kids will tell you if you aren’t funny).

column1: I am big on funniness (the root word being, ""fun""). The way I perform and move through life can be wrapped up like this:
Treat children with the respect you give adults, and treat grownups with the exuberance children crave.
I am in the joy business. And, people, joy and learning should go hand-in-hand.  Kids will learn a few things from this CD.

The Jelly Song:  silly, loud, obnoxious with no redeeming or educational  value whatsoever.

Loose Tooth: a story/song about the first thing most kids sell – their tooth! It's the bargain they make with that other-worldly entity who sneaks into their room.
The Light Went Away:  a lullaby for all ages – about how we all share this sphere we call, Earth.
•  •  •  •  •
SO, WHY A FUNDING CAMPAIGN?
column9: >Congressional Special Recognitions from John Lewis
column10: >, it is time to up my game with a real, live publicist who will tell the world what I am doing, and will help me do it more! Funding will also pay for…

column1: <b style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column3: >: Live portions of the album will be recorded at the International Storytelling Center in Jonesborough, Tennessee in front of real human beings! The engineer with be Keith Smith, a man who has recorded a handful of Grammy® nominated records.

column1: You may join the audience in Jonesborough if you’d like – bring a kid on Saturday, May 30th! For information go to:                                                              http://www.storytellingcenter.net/events/storytelling-live/childrens-performances/childrens-concert-with-andy-offutt-irwin/
Studio sessions will be recorded at Community Music, Inc, somewhere in suburban Washington – engineered and produced by those benevolent two-time Grammy® Award Winners, Cathy Fink and Marcy Marxer.
Funding will also pay for…
<li>
<b style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column3: > rendered by the great Laura Dowling.

column1: <li>
EDITING AND MASTERING by Chris Rosser at Hollow Reed Arts in Asheville.
<li>
REPLICATION (making the CDs)  This will be done by Oasis CD.
<li>
DISTRIBUTION. This will get the album beyond my website and the trunk of my car. Again, this will be my first time doing this.
•  •  •  •  •
THIS IS SCARY
I have never done anything like crowd funding before, but – trust me – this is how the business model of recording has changed.

Every album brings it’s own challenges. Recording live is tricky and it takes smart professionals to help me do it.  But, for the way I perform, I want that live “vibe” so the listeners (you and your kids) will feel as if they are in the room.
WHAT IF THERE IS FUNDING LEFT OVER?

Any leftover funds will go into the other album I will be releasing in October – A  grownup project called, Love at 85. This record will feature the beloved character, Marguerite Van Camp, MD, and will also be recorded at the International Storytelling Center later that same afternoon on May 30th.
TRULY, IT’S OKAY IF YOU CAN’T CONTRIBUTE…
… BUT if you could get the word out through social media and whatnot, I would be most grateful.

No kidding, I am grateful all the time. 

Thank you! – Andy

Funding will also pay for…

You may join the audience in Jonesborough if you’d like – bring a kid on Saturday, May 30th! For information go to:                                                              http://www.storytellingcenter.net/events/storytelling-live/childrens-performances/childrens-concert-with-andy-offutt-irwin/

The Brooklyn Gypsies are a group of NYC based musicians/ producers whose creative influences draw from the constant shifting of an ever changing urban sociopolitical landscape while retaining their unique cultural backgrounds. The use of the term ""gypsies"" acknowledges the diverse international origins among the members &
column2: an urban nomadic nature of survival and expression within a city such as New York. Originating from Spain, Japan, Russia, Italy &amp
column3: U.S.A. BK Gypsies truly represent Brooklyn’s diverse ethnic heritage and style. The gypsies came to be in 2012 within Brooklyn's Studio BPM music scene. Members include: Carmen Estevez, Takuya Nakamura, Tina Kristina, Brandon Lewis, Troy ""Mobius"" Simms &amp
column4: Zeb ""The Spy From Cairo"". After a number of collaborative projects between the artist were explored the opportunity to form a band that incorporated elements from each project arose.
column9:
schema=soundcloud"" width=""580"">

Campaign Summary

We have recently released our debut album ""Sin Fronteras"" and premiered our music video both of which were self funded.  With the success of these releases we have been given the opportunity to participate in two festivals abroad this summer: Landjuweel Ruigoord Fest in Amsterdam and Ozora Fest in Dádpuszta Hungary.  This is an opportunity for us to spread our music to an international audience as well as document the journey that will ultimately be the basis for our next video.

Your donation will help support:

Translation Spanish
Historia:
Brooklyn Gypsies son un grupo de la ciudad de Nueva York
column2: músicos/productores cuyas influencias se dibujan a través del constante cambio de un siempre cambiante paisaje urbano y sociopolítico, manteniendo al mismo tiempo sus orígenes culturales. El uso de la expresión ""los gitanos"" reconoce los orígenes internacionales entre los miembros y un carácter nómada urbano de supervivencia y de expresión dentro de una ciudad como Nueva York.

column1: Procedentes de España, Japón, Rusia, Italia y EE.UU, los ""gypsies"" representan realmente la diversidad étnica de patrimonio y estilo de Brooklyn. Los gitanos comenzaron en 2012 en Brooklyn, bajo la escena musical de BPM. Los miembros son: Carmen Estevez Calero, Takuya Nakamura, Tina Kristina, Brandon Lewis "" B Riddimz"", Troy ""Mobius"" Simms y Zeb ""The Spy from Cairo"".
Resumen de la campaña:

Acabamos de lanzar recientemente nuestro álbum debut ""Sin Fronteras"" y también el vídeo musical, ambos autofinanciados. Con el éxito de estos lanzamientos, vamos a tener la oportunidad de participar en dos festivales en el extranjero este verano: Landjuweel Ruigoord Fest en Amsterdam y Ozora Dádpuszta Fest en Hungría. Esta es una oportunidad para difundir nuestra música a un público internacional,  y también podremos documentar ese  recorrido que será, en última instancia, la base de nuestro siguiente vídeo.
Su donación ayudará a:
- Gastos de viajes: avión, transporte y gastos de alojamiento.
- Video musical/documental - El viaje será filmado, Conciertos, Entrevistas
Lo que necesitamos y lo que tu consigues:
Te necesitamos para recaudar $5000 para la Gira. Este dinero se destinará a los gastos de viaje, vuelos, alojamiento durante el viaje y video musical.
Lo que se obtiene en función de la cantidad de su donación es de:

column1: Si no alcanzamos el objetivo, el total de fondos se destinará a ayudarnos a  acercarnos más a nuestro objetivo y aún así obtendrás el premio de tu donación.
El impacto

""Sin Fronteras"" es la Gira y la Producción del Video musical/documental, que con sus donaciones nos ayudará a realizar. Facilitar un intercambio cultural a través de la música y la colaboración, así como representantes que somos del microcosmos que existe en Brooklyn NUEVA YORK. El video musical/documental será el producto final, y todos los que apoyen, recibirán una copia, así como invitaciones y actualizaciones a través de los medios sociales para los próximos eventos y lanzamientos.
Riesgos y desafíos

Debido a que esta campaña se ha hecho en el último momento, somos conscientes de que llegar a nuestra meta deseada es realmente un reto, pero estamos convencidos de que podemos lograrlo a través de nuestra increíble red de seguidores que nos han inspirado y animado a continuar hasta aquí.
Otras formas en las que usted puede ayudar

Si no puedes donar pero, aun así, te gustaría colaborar a lograr nuestro objetivo, puedes ayudarnos publicando esta campaña, nuestra música, vídeos y enlaces, en tus respectivas plataformas online. A cuanta más gente podamos llegar con nuestra música y mensaje mejor! Sin Fronteras!

","The Brooklyn Gypsies are a group of NYC based musicians/ producers whose creative influences draw from the constant shifting of an ever changing urban sociopolitical landscape while retaining their unique cultural backgrounds. The use of the term ""gypsies"" acknowledges the diverse international origins among the members & an urban nomadic nature of survival and expression within a city such as New York. Originating from Spain, Japan, Russia, Italy & U.S.A. BK Gypsies truly represent Brooklyn’s diverse ethnic heritage and style. The gypsies came to be in 2012 within Brooklyn's Studio BPM music scene. Members include: Carmen Estevez, Takuya Nakamura, Tina Kristina, Brandon Lewis, Troy ""Mobius"" Simms & Zeb ""The Spy From Cairo"". After a number of collaborative projects between the artist were explored the opportunity to form a band that incorporated elements from each project arose.Campaign SummaryWe have recently released our debut album ""Sin Fronteras"" and premiered our music video both of which were self funded.  With the success of these releases we have been given the opportunity to participate in two festivals abroad this summer: Landjuweel Ruigoord Fest in Amsterdam and Ozora Fest in Dádpuszta Hungary.  This is an opportunity for us to spread our music to an international audience as well as document the journey that will ultimately be the basis for our next video.Your donation will help support:
Travel Expense - Plane Tix, Transportation & Accommodation Costs
Music Video and Documentary Film - Trip will be filmed
What We Need & What You Get
We are looking to raise $5000 in Tour Support.  This money will go towards our travel expense ie
column2: Flight tix, Accommodations while traveling, Music Video support.What you get depending on the amount of your donation will range from:

column1: $10 Download of our debut album ""Sin Fronteras""
$40 Download, CD & Brooklyn Gypsies T-Shirt
$60 Download, CD, T-Shirt & Ticket to a Private Show in NYC
$150 Producers Special - Get one of the BK Gypsies to play on your track
$250 Music Lessons - Take Music Lessons from your BK Gypsy of choice
$500 Music Video Special - Receive your name included within credits of next BK Gypsies Music Video and special guest access to Screening Party.

$1500 Brooklyn Gypsies will play at your private event e.g. Wedding, Quiceañera, Burning Man Fest Party, Etc...  Note: For events outside the NYC area Travel Expense would have to be paid in addition to the Perk Donation.
***If the desired goal is not met the total funds will still go towards helping us realize our goal and you will still get the gift based on your donation amount.
BKG T-Shirts designed by Brooklyn Artist EPIC UNO - Tank Tops and Standard Male & Female Sizes available exclusively to Campaign Contributors!
The Impact

Sin Fronteras"" Without Borders is the Tour and Music Documentary Video Production you would be assisting us in realizing with your donations.  Facilitating a cultural exchange through Music and Collaboration as we represent the microcosm that exist in Brooklyn NYC.  The Documentary Music Video will be the end product in which all who support will receive a digital copy as well as invites & updates via social media to all upcoming events & releases.
Risks And Challenges

Due to the last minute nature of this campaign we realize that reaching our desired goal is truly a challenge but we believe we can achieve it through our amazing network of supporters who have inspired and encouraged us to this point and continue to give love.
Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to donate but would still like to assist us in achieving our goal you can help by posting this campaign and any of our music, video & social media links to your respective online platforms.  The more people we can reach with our music and message the better!  Without Borders.. Sin Fronteras!!
Translation Spanish
Historia:
Brooklyn Gypsies son un grupo de la ciudad de Nueva York
column2: músicos/productores cuyas influencias se dibujan a través del constante cambio de un siempre cambiante paisaje urbano y sociopolítico, manteniendo al mismo tiempo sus orígenes culturales. El uso de la expresión ""los gitanos"" reconoce los orígenes internacionales entre los miembros y un carácter nómada urbano de supervivencia y de expresión dentro de una ciudad como Nueva York.

column1: Procedentes de España, Japón, Rusia, Italia y EE.UU, los ""gypsies"" representan realmente la diversidad étnica de patrimonio y estilo de Brooklyn. Los gitanos comenzaron en 2012 en Brooklyn, bajo la escena musical de BPM. Los miembros son: Carmen Estevez Calero, Takuya Nakamura, Tina Kristina, Brandon Lewis "" B Riddimz"", Troy ""Mobius"" Simms y Zeb ""The Spy from Cairo"".
Resumen de la campaña:

Acabamos de lanzar recientemente nuestro álbum debut ""Sin Fronteras"" y también el vídeo musical, ambos autofinanciados. Con el éxito de estos lanzamientos, vamos a tener la oportunidad de participar en dos festivales en el extranjero este verano: Landjuweel Ruigoord Fest en Amsterdam y Ozora Dádpuszta Fest en Hungría. Esta es una oportunidad para difundir nuestra música a un público internacional,  y también podremos documentar ese  recorrido que será, en última instancia, la base de nuestro siguiente vídeo.
Su donación ayudará a:
- Gastos de viajes: avión, transporte y gastos de alojamiento.
- Video musical/documental - El viaje será filmado, Conciertos, Entrevistas
Lo que necesitamos y lo que tu consigues:
Te necesitamos para recaudar $5000 para la Gira. Este dinero se destinará a los gastos de viaje, vuelos, alojamiento durante el viaje y video musical.
Lo que se obtiene en función de la cantidad de su donación es de:
$10 Descarga de nuestro álbum debut ""Sin Fronteras""
$40 Descarga CD y camiseta de los Brooklyn Gypsies.
$60 Descarga CD, camiseta y entrada para un concierto privado en New York.
$150 especial para productores - Consigue que uno de los miembros de la banda toque en uno de tus temas.
$ 250 clases de música - Clases de música impartidas por un miembro de la banda a tu elección.
$500 Especial Video Musical - Recibe tu nombre en los créditos del próximo Video Musical de BKG y acceso como invitado especial para el estreno.
$1500 Los Brooklyn Gypsies tocarán en tu evento privado (bodas, cumpleaños, Bat Mitzvah, Quiceañera, Burning Man Festival…etc)
Si no alcanzamos el objetivo, el total de fondos se destinará a ayudarnos a  acercarnos más a nuestro objetivo y aún así obtendrás el premio de tu donación.
El impacto

Sin Fronteras"" es la Gira y la Producción del Video musical/documental, que con sus donaciones nos ayudará a realizar. Facilitar un intercambio cultural a través de la música y la colaboración, así como representantes que somos del microcosmos que existe en Brooklyn NUEVA YORK. El video musical/documental será el producto final, y todos los que apoyen, recibirán una copia, así como invitaciones y actualizaciones a través de los medios sociales para los próximos eventos y lanzamientos.
Riesgos y desafíos

Debido a que esta campaña se ha hecho en el último momento, somos conscientes de que llegar a nuestra meta deseada es realmente un reto, pero estamos convencidos de que podemos lograrlo a través de nuestra increíble red de seguidores que nos han inspirado y animado a continuar hasta aquí.

column1: ","The Wormhole is an institution in the music venue and bar scene in Savannah, GA. For months, the Wormhole has been threatened by relentless noise complaints and court appearances. We need your help!
Without funds for renovations, we will be forced to stop offering Live Music at The Wormhole.

We have already been issued a Cease and Desist that is awaiting an appeals process. To settle the issue, we need a major overhaul including a double entrance-way to trap sound from escaping when the door is opened.

It is imperative that we make significant improvements to the soundproofing of the building so that we can continue to protect the flourishing culture of the Starland District, and bring excellent musical acts, comedians, and events to the heart and soul of Savannah.

The money you help us raise will go directly into soundproofing and other integral renovations to keep The Wormhole supporting the Savannah scene. It will also go to attorney fees regarding MPC and zoning, architectural drawings and permits required by the city to undergo construction, and other costs.

In return, you get great rewards like bar tabs worth double what you put in, a special party just for individuals who donate, free tickets, putting your face or logo on the bar, VIP status, and for businesses-- special advertising deals!
Without your contribution, the Wormhole will be unable to bring excellent acts and events to the community due to noise restrictions and mounting court costs.
If you can't donate today, spread the word by telling your friends or sharing on your social network. You can also stop by The Wormhole and get stickers to pass out or stick on your bike!
For more information on terms of perks see http://www.wormholebar.com/terms",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

Polski (English translation below)
Match&
column2: Fuse tworzy pełna pasji grupa producentów. Od czterech lat promujemy bardzo orygnialną i innowacyjną muzykę organizując trasy obiecujących artystów i coroczne festiwale w europejskich stolicach. Jako grupa producentów z 6 krajów zrobiliśmy już trzy duże festiwale: w Londynie, Oslo, Rzymie, teraz czas na Warszawę!

column1: Zdobyliśmy już część funduszy, ale potrzebujemy jeszcze trochę, żeby pozwolić festiwalowi “rozwinąć skrzydła”, uzyskać najlepszy możliwy sprzęt techniczny i przede wszystkim umieścić publiczność - czyli Was - w samym centrum naszych działań.

To publiczność tworzy festiwale. Zapytaj jakiegokolwiek muzyka czy jest coś lepszego niż gra dla buzującego energią tłumu. Nasz festiwal jest adresowany zarówno dla młodych i starszych poszukujących łatwopalnego jazz-punkowego brzmienia. Pomóż nam to zrealizować a z naszymi prezentami znajdziesz się w samym środku festiwalu!
Czego potrzebujemy i co Ty możesz otrzymać

Potrzebujemy jeszcze 1200 euro (4800 złotych) żeby dofinansować wszystkie obszary festiwalu: dźwięk, technicznych, gaże artystów, transport, hotele i materiały promocyjne. Mimo że zdobyliśmy już część pieniędzy bez tych dodatkowych środków nie damy rady!

Odwdzięczymy się ekscytującymi i spersonalizowanymi prezentami - dostaniesz od nas specjalny streaming z piosenką, połączymy się z Tobą przez Skype z backstage’u, a jeśli będziesz w Polsce - oprowadzimy Cię po festiwalu, poznamy z naszą ekipą, z zespołami, nakarmimy Cię, a nawet damy lekcję muzyki i produkcji takiego wydarzenia, jakim jest festiwal! A do tego tyle muzyki, ile zmieści się na Twojej skrzynce, prezenty w postaci płyt CD i inne smakowite dobra muzyczne.
To Ty stworzysz ten Festiwal!
Dlaczego warto nas wspierać?
M&
column2:
F produkuje tournee i festiwale w całej Europie.  Naszym celem to, by publiczność była umieszczona w centrum tych działań. Wspieramy nowych, ekscytujących artystów, pomagamy im osiągnąć kolejny szczebel kariery,  rozwijając również ich poziom muzyczny, brzmienie na żywo i maestrię wykonania.
Każde wydarzenie sygnowane nazwą Match&
column3: Fuse kipi energią i prowokuje doborem stylistyk, czasami przedstawiając awangradowe brzmienia, innym razem mocne groovy, ale zawsze tworząc niezapomniane przeżycie dla słuchaczy i muzyków. To muzyka napędza ten świat, tworzy relacje, napędza nas na co dzień, często daje powód do życia. Chcemy, żebyście tego doświadczyli!

column1: Jak jeszcze możecie pomóc?
Nawet jeśli nie możecie dorzucić się do zbiórki, możecie nas wesprzeć! Jak? Wrzućcie linka do tej kampanii na swojego facebooka czy twittera, wyślijcie mejlem do znajomych.
English
<h3>Match&amp
Match&
column2: Fuse is run by a team of passionate music lovers. For four

column1: years, M&amp
column2: F has promoted highly original and creative music through

column1: touring emerging artists and running community based festivals.
With strong links to education and championing diverse artistry, M&amp
believes in taking the underground to a higher level.
Based in 6 countries around Europe, we ran our festivals last
year in London, Oslo, Rome and want to repeat the good times this
year in Warszawa!
With funding secured for some parts of the festival, we're running
this campaign in order to secure the greatest coverage possible for the
festival, getting the most exciting acts to play, but most importantly,
to place audiences, like you, right at the centre of what we're doing.
Audiences make festivals. Ask any musician if there is anything
better than a great, buzzing crowd. Our festival is for younger and older people with eclectic musical tastes to
be brought together in the very centre of Warsaw. Help us realise this, and
with some of our perks, you can be at the centre of the festival too!
<h3>What We Need &amp
We're looking for 1200 Euros to supplement all areas of
the festival
accommodation, press coverage and physical promotional materials.
Whilst we have some funding in place, we simply cannot make the
festival function without contributions from elsewhere.
Our perks are extremely exciting and personalised - we'll stream song dedications to
you directly, Skype you from backstage, and if you're in Poland or
attending the festival, we'll show you round personally, introduce you
to our team, to fantastic bands, and even give you a music lesson or the
experience of running a festival team! All of this plus as many
download codes as can fit in your inbox, free merchandise and the usual
array of treats and goodies!
You make the festival.
The Impact
M&
column2: F have run tours and festivals across Europe, and consistently

column1: think about keeping our audiences at the centre of what we're doing. We
always champion emerging artists, help them reach the next level of
their careers, thereby enhancing their stage craft, live sound and
artistry.
Any M&
column2: F live show will give you an explosive and engaging mix of

column1: musical styles, sometimes dipping into the theatrical, progressive
sounds, deep, heavy grooves that make it impossible not to move your
body, and above all, a never-to-be-forgotton live experience. Music
makes the world
column2: forms relationships, keeps us going, gives life

column1: purpose. We want you to experience this.
Other Ways You Can Help
Of course, even if you can't contribute, you can help! Please take a
moment to share this campaign on social media, or via your mailing
list/contacts. Use the Indiegogo tools to make it easier!
Lets make this festival one to remember together!

Match&Fuse Festival 2015
Match&Fuse is run by a team of passionate music lovers. For four
years, M&F has promoted highly original and creative music through
touring emerging artists and running community based festivals.
With strong links to education and championing diverse artistry, M&F
believes in taking the underground to a higher level.
Based in 6 countries around Europe, we ran our festivals last
year in London, Oslo, Rome and want to repeat the good times this
year in Warszawa!
With funding secured for some parts of the festival, we're running
this campaign in order to secure the greatest coverage possible for the
festival, getting the most exciting acts to play, but most importantly,
to place audiences, like you, right at the centre of what we're doing.
Audiences make festivals. Ask any musician if there is anything
better than a great, buzzing crowd. Our festival is for younger and older people with eclectic musical tastes to
be brought together in the very centre of Warsaw. Help us realise this, and
with some of our perks, you can be at the centre of the festival too!
What We Need & What You Get
We're looking for 1200 Euros to supplement all areas of
the festival
accommodation, press coverage and physical promotional materials.
Whilst we have some funding in place, we simply cannot make the
festival function without contributions from elsewhere.
Our perks are extremely exciting and personalised - we'll stream song dedications to
you directly, Skype you from backstage, and if you're in Poland or
attending the festival, we'll show you round personally, introduce you
to our team, to fantastic bands, and even give you a music lesson or the
experience of running a festival team! All of this plus as many
download codes as can fit in your inbox, free merchandise and the usual
array of treats and goodies!
You make the festival.
The Impact
M&F have run tours and festivals across Europe, and consistently
think about keeping our audiences at the centre of what we're doing. We
always champion emerging artists, help them reach the next level of
their careers, thereby enhancing their stage craft, live sound and
artistry.
Any M&F live show will give you an explosive and engaging mix of
musical styles, sometimes dipping into the theatrical, progressive
sounds, deep, heavy grooves that make it impossible not to move your
body, and above all, a never-to-be-forgotton live experience. Music
makes the world
column2: forms relationships, keeps us going, gives life

column1: purpose. We want you to experience this.
Other Ways You Can Help
Of course, even if you can't contribute, you can help! Please take a
moment to share this campaign on social media, or via your mailing
list/contacts. Use the Indiegogo tools to make it easier!
Lets make this festival one to remember together!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

Welcome to my campaign to complete the Mobile Music Box:  A bicycle &

column1: instrument-making workshop, and street studio!
The funds raised here will be used to build a bike with a
trailer for the cabinet, speaker system, and install an eco-friendly generator with a solar
panel into the Mobile Music Box.
column3: />

column1: am Aquil ‘AQ’ Charlton, a musician and teaching artist from the Southside of
Chicago, Illinois. I am building the Mobile Music Box to provide innovative and intuitive
music education in communities where there is limited access to such programs.<span style=""font-family: 'Benton Sans', Helvetica, sans-serif
Intuitive, culturally-relevant music activities
(call &amp
“Street studio” public music production
activities
Instrument-making activities using recycled
materials
The Mobile Music
Box’s body and logo were designed by fellow Southside artists Nick Glazebrook
and Caesar “Czr Prz” Perez, known together as Ava Grey. The metal body has a re-purposed wood top designed and built by Washington Park-area high school students in the
Design Apprenticeship Program at the Arts Incubator, where I am currently an

artist-in-residence.  

Besides recycling materials for art activities the Mobile
Music Box will demonstrate the value of caring for the environment by having a
custom-built bike and trailer. Also, the electronic production equipment on
board will be powered by a rechargeable eco-friendly generator with an attached
solar panel.
Your contributions will provide:

trailer, along with a speaker system, will be built for the Mobile Music Box by

Wilson. Nick has also recruited the help of his brother, Alex Wilson, founder
of West Town Bikes, to install the speakers.
Your donations will supply parts for the bike, trailer, and
speakers.
The Mobile Music Box will be outfitted with a rechargeable
electric generator and solar panel to power my ""street studio"" audio
recording and production equipment. Besides the value of access to the arts,
the Mobile Music Box teaches the value of sustainability though the use of
recycled materials and renewable energy.
Why a $6,000 goal? The body of the cart has
been built, but it still needs wheels, sound, and power!
Your donations will
also supply art and craft supplies for instrument-making workshops and
production equipment for street studio appearances. Additional donations will
be invested into marketing the Mobile Music Box through a
professionally-designed website, stickers, and buttons.

Stretch goal: If I surpass my goal and reach $7,000, I will use the additional funds to replace the laptop that was stolen from my studio earlier this year. Any donations above that will be used to replenish art supplies as they are used for activities, and otherwise fund future programming ideas.

","Welcome to my campaign to complete the Mobile Music Box:  A bicycle & solar-powered music class,
instrument-making workshop, and street studio!
The funds raised here will be used to build a bike with a
trailer for the cabinet, speaker system, and install an eco-friendly generator with a solar
panel into the Mobile Music Box.              I
am Aquil ‘AQ’ Charlton, a musician and teaching artist from the Southside of
Chicago, Illinois. I am building the Mobile Music Box to provide innovative and intuitive
music education in communities where there is limited access to such programs.The Mobile Music Box provides:
Intuitive, culturally-relevant music activities
(call & response songs, rhythm games, beat-boxing)
“Street studio” public music production
activities
Instrument-making activities using recycled
materials
Custom-designed and community-built!
The Mobile Music
Box’s body and logo were designed by fellow Southside artists Nick Glazebrook
and Caesar “Czr Prz” Perez, known together as Ava Grey. The metal body has a re-purposed wood top designed and built by Washington Park-area high school students in the
Design Apprenticeship Program at the Arts Incubator, where I am currently an
artist-in-residence.  Besides recycling materials for art activities the Mobile
Music Box will demonstrate the value of caring for the environment by having a
custom-built bike and trailer. Also, the electronic production equipment on
board will be powered by a rechargeable eco-friendly generator with an attached
solar panel.
Your contributions will provide:
Bike and trailer parts
Speakers, amplifier, and system parts
Eco-friendly rechargeable electric generator
Solar panel attachment for generator
Music production equipment
Classroom music instruments
Art supplies for making musical instruments of
recycled materials
Put the Mobile Music Box on the streets!
A bicycle and
trailer, along with a speaker system, will be built for the Mobile Music Box by
fellow teaching artist and electronic musician, Nick 'spacemod'
Wilson. Nick has also recruited the help of his brother, Alex Wilson, founder
of West Town Bikes, to install the speakers.
Your donations will supply parts for the bike, trailer, and
speakers.
Make the Mobile Music Box Eco-Friendly!
The Mobile Music Box will be outfitted with a rechargeable
electric generator and solar panel to power my ""street studio"" audio
recording and production equipment. Besides the value of access to the arts,
the Mobile Music Box teaches the value of sustainability though the use of
recycled materials and renewable energy.
Why a $6,000 goal? The body of the cart has
been built, but it still needs wheels, sound, and power!
Your donations will
also supply art and craft supplies for instrument-making workshops and
production equipment for street studio appearances. Additional donations will
be invested into marketing the Mobile Music Box through a
professionally-designed website, stickers, and buttons.

Stretch goal: If I surpass my goal and reach $7,000, I will use the additional funds to replace the laptop that was stolen from my studio earlier this year. Any donations above that will be used to replenish art supplies as they are used for activities, and otherwise fund future programming ideas.

We have started our journey in Sweden, but we are constantly seeing exchanges between different countries. // Sofie Ward
Project Manager, Folk You sessions","The New Wave of Swedish Folkmusic.

column1: We asume that you've already heard the number one hit songs written by swedish producers and songwriters, but what do you really know about our music?

When we say our music, we really mean the old school kind, the foundation to our culture and our way of living. And as you read this the new wave of swedish folk music is growing even stronger.  But this wave is not hitting the big shores yet, it's hard to find, even for us, and we live here!
Let's change this!

We want to make folk & world music accessible so that more people can discover it. For the music and musicianship to evolve  the presence of strong role models is needed, which is something that may appear to be difficult in our genre. Through our Youtube channel ""Folk You Sessions"" we'll make folk music more present and accessible than ever.
Folk You Sessions on Youtube
What We Need & What You Get
We've calculated that this is what we need to keep the channel running for the next year and to make it even better.
Sweden is bigger than you think, and bands are spread in an area 173,745 sq mi in size. To keep it short: We need money to travel to all the bands and artist so that we can record them. 500 EUR
Upkeep costs for sound and filmgear. 250 EUR
Better sound and camera gear. 750 EUR
The Impact The community of folkmusic will grow as people feel that its easy to connect to it and it's performers.    Risks & Challenges Q:What if people don't like and subscribe to the channel?

A: We know that this genre isn't as big as others. We don't expect to ha a million followers tomorrow. But we think it will grow, in time. As we deliver good quality music, sound and video. People will always be intressted.
The Future och Folk You Sessions

We have started our journey in Sweden, but we are constantly seeing exchanges between different countries. Musicians from India, Norway, Senegal, Pakistan, Scottland and France has already been visible on the channel. We want to develop into an even more diverse channel, we want to travel, document and disseminate folk and world music from all over the world.

The Swedish wave of new folk music is just the beginning, we see the same thing happening in the other Nordic countries. We do not promise anything, but the dream of gathering the Nordic countries on the same channel lives on.
Spread the word
If you like the music and want to hear more, subscribe and share! With love from Sweden <3// Sofie WardProject Manager, Folk You sessions",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column15: >A part of the change needed in Jamaica is a change in the way political campaigns are funded. It costs over $20 million to run an effective political campaign. This goes to:

column1: <ol>
• Marketing, media and materials for messaging. Candidates need to get their faces and ideas out there for people to vote effectively.
• Running a campaign office - rent, utilities, human resources.
• Supporting a large network of volunteers with lunch, training , transportation - we have over 500 volunteers who do canvassing and outreach in the community.
• Transportation to the polls on election day. Many voters are rurally situated and even some in urban areas we do not have adequate public transportation.
Traditionally our political campaigns are generally supported by small network of people who implicitly expect something for their contribution...
<ul>
• The Don man who often is willing to donate thousands, or
• A large private business person, etc.

As a result many policies/projects are often skewed towards the interests of this small group. In order shift the power dynamics in Jamaica  we need a broader base of financial support and financial participation in the process. This also ensures that weak candidates do not emerge victorious simply because they can outspend strong candidates.

Patricia for Parliament 2.0 is our second Political crowdfunding campaign in Jamaica.  We see this as a first step in broadening the base of financial support and leveling the playing field. Whether you can give $5  or $5,000 please give your support. Please donate and share this campaign with your networks. Exercise your power and help elect the kinds of candidates you wish to see for a better Jamaica.

column11: >The cornerstone of the new politics we seek:

column1: <li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >A mindset change where rather than waiting for others to do for us, we are proactive in building the Jamaica we wish to see

column1: <li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Members of Parliament working in Partnership and Love with fully participating constituents, facilitating efforts to bring about the desired change vs. promising to bring about said change

column1: <li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Compassion and Respect where we carefully listen to each other’s views and honor each other’s ideas, talents and willingness to participate in nation building

column1: <li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Transparency and Accountability where we ask each other to stand on principle and with integrity.

column1:
We need your help to move Jamaica from Dependence to Independence! Donate and Share!
","Vote Patricia for Parliament! Donate & share! A part of the change needed in Jamaica is a change in the way political campaigns are funded. It costs over $20 million to run an effective political campaign. This goes to:
Marketing, media and materials for messaging. Candidates need to get their faces and ideas out there for people to vote effectively.
Running a campaign office - rent, utilities, human resources.
Supporting a large network of volunteers with lunch, training , transportation - we have over 500 volunteers who do canvassing and outreach in the community.
Transportation to the polls on election day. Many voters are rurally situated and even some in urban areas we do not have adequate public transportation.
Traditionally our political campaigns are generally supported by small network of people who implicitly expect something for their contribution...
The Don man who often is willing to donate thousands, or
A large private business person, etc.

As a result many policies/projects are often skewed towards the interests of this small group. In order shift the power dynamics in Jamaica  we need a broader base of financial support and financial participation in the process. This also ensures that weak candidates do not emerge victorious simply because they can outspend strong candidates.

Patricia for Parliament 2.0 is our second Political crowdfunding campaign in Jamaica.  We see this as a first step in broadening the base of financial support and leveling the playing field. Whether you can give $5  or $5,000 please give your support. Please donate and share this campaign with your networks. Exercise your power and help elect the kinds of candidates you wish to see for a better Jamaica.
The cornerstone of the new politics we seek:
A mindset change where rather than waiting for others to do for us, we are proactive in building the Jamaica we wish to see
Members of Parliament working in Partnership and Love with fully participating constituents, facilitating efforts to bring about the desired change vs. promising to bring about said change
Compassion and Respect where we carefully listen to each other’s views and honor each other’s ideas, talents and willingness to participate in nation building
Transparency and Accountability where we ask each other to stand on principle and with integrity.
We need your help to move Jamaica from Dependence to Independence! Donate and Share!",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns
