Did you ever have a dream? Of course we all have…

column1: This project is my dream. Ever since I was a kid, I have
wanted to be a DJ. As a kid, my family used always have get togethers and
because my parents had a large music collection, it was usually our
responsibility to bring the music. As I got older, I was the one who organized
and brought the music. It was always the expectation then that I was in charge
of the music for all parties. That’s how my love of music began. I cannot
imagine my life without music. I love playing, organizing, coordinating music
for people. Whether it’s at parties, functions, or even driving friends in my
car, I always enjoy selecting music and playing it for people and watching their
reactions as they enjoy the music that I play for them. Friends have told me
that when I’m DJ’ing, I never look as confident, happy or enthusiastic. I
cannot explain the joy I get when I’m DJ’ing, when I play a song people don’t
expect and go crazy, or if I mix a crazy set and get an amazing reaction.
Overall I have been DJ’ing for more than 20 years and there
is nothing I enjoy doing more. Unfortunately over time, I have encountered many
obstacles which have prevented me from fully achieving my goals and dreams.
This is where I need your help in making my dreams a reality. I am on IndieGoGo
with this project/campaign, not to create something innovative or a new
technological wonder. It is just to make a dream come true, and to share my
love and passion for music.
Nowadays, there are many people out there who want to be or
call themselves DJ’s, only because they have a lap top and a computer program,
or an app which lets them play and mix music. I believe that a DJ needs to DJ
with Vinyl records at some point in their lives to actually be a good or real
DJ. Technology is a great tool, which makes a DJ’s life easier, but shouldn’t
be the road one uses to call themselves a DJ. When I was going full steam
ahead, I had a collection of 1,500 cassettes and cd’s, and 500 vinyl records
along with 1GB of music on my hard drive. I was DJ’ing in bars, pubs and clubs,
on campus radio, live events, private parties and so on and having the time of
my life. That’s when I started to lose it all, literally. Whether through
damage, theft or accident, I ended up losing close $20,000 in music and
equipment. That has been something which has been difficult to come back from
and as such I couldn’t continue doing what I love. I have since been able to
grow my digital music collection, which is something I can thank technology
for, however much more is needed to reclaim the success, passion and love I
once had for this profession.
I have worked many hours in different professions, whether
it be in Operations, Marketing, Digital Marketing, Social Media and so on, but
DJing is the only thing I am actually good at and music is where my passion
lies. I remember going to clubs with my friends and being able to sing along
with songs word for word as other DJ’s played them, or being able to tell my
friends what the next song a DJ was mixing in was before anyone could hear or
tell. I can listen to music and be fascinated by samples being used and
learning about the history of music and how one song can contribute samples to
several other songs. This is the love affair I have with music, and this is
what I want through this campaign.
A couple of years ago, I did have the opportunity to DJ at
local bars here that had little equipment for me to use, but it was something
to get my foot back into the door. Then, right as I was getting back into it, I
had received some bad news with regards to my health. For years, I had been
suffering from type 2 diabetes. As a result, a couple of years ago, my health
had deteriorated quite a bit due to complications from Diabetes, which included
Diabetic Retinopathy (decrease/loss of vision), decline in kidney function and
a massive decrease in hemoglobin levels. With all this, I had to stop working,
and start treatments and medications to get better. I has visited doctor’s,
hospitals, specialists to fix the problems I was having. Because of my vision
problems, I could not properly drive, see a computer screen and at times even
open my eyes because they were too sensitive to light and all I was seeing was
brightness and spots. I have since been going in for laser and injection
treatments for my eyes, which have now gotten better. My kidneys are still an
issue. They will never get back to 100% functionality, but as long as they
stabilize, I will avoid Dialysis and/or a Kidney transplant. That is something
which scares me every day. I am getting better though, but am not out of the
woods. With my low hemoglobin levels, I am constantly tired and sleepy. I can
estimate that I am in bed or asleep for 15 to 18 hours a day. I am not sure
whether it is because of weakness due to the low blood count level, whether it
is depression, or whether it is because I have nothing else to do, nor the
energy to do it.
Motivation is what I am looking for now! I have had a dream
of beating this and fulfilling my dreams of producing and DJ’ing music and now
is when I need to do this more than ever. I am not telling you all this for you
to feel sorry for me, or to get sympathy. I had all this happen, and am now
trying to move on and move forward in life doing something I love to do, have a
passion for, do something I am good at, and something with makes me and other
people happy!
With your contribution, I am looking to purchase DJ’ing and
technical equipment, build my collection, acquire the music licences necessary,
attend industry events, create demos and promotional items, and begin touring
to DJ events in various clubs and events. I am looking to raise $50,000 to be
able to establish my DJ/entertainment brand. With this I will be looking to
create a website and mobile app, establish a presence on various social media
outlets, create a weekly podcast which will feature a 60 minute mix every week,
record and produce several demo mixes for different genres of music and finally
begin and complete work on an album. To give you an idea of the type of music I
will be producing, I can tell you that my musical influences include but are
not limited to producers and DJ’s like DJ Jazzy Jeff, DJ Premier, Dr. Dre,
Timbaland, Kanye West, Armand Van Helden, Mark Ronson and artist like Nas, The
Notorious BIG, Jay Z, Wu Tang Clan, Kendrick Lamar, Duck Sauce, Avicii, David
Guetta and many more. I love all types of music, from Rap/Hip Hop, R &amp
Dance, House, EDM, Reggae, Jazz and much more.

Perks are available and are listed in the campaign, but are available in a limited number. So make sure you donate quickly before they run out. Also, if there is a perk not listed, or something else you have in mind for your contribution, for example me DJ'ing a private party for you and your friends, and event or festival, please let me know and I will be more than happy to discuss any other reasonable options! With the $50,000, I am looking to raise, here is what I hope to do with the funds:
Finally, I would like to mention that 10% of your
donation/contribution will go towards a foundation I am starting call the Sweet
Dreams Foundation (sweet because it is for children suffering from Diabetes and
or Kidney Disease) and will be used to help those who suffer from these
illnesses and making their dreams come true. Whether it is someone like myself
who wants to be a DJ/musician/singer or someone who wants to have a dream
sports weekend, or family getaway, this foundation will be there to assist

those in making their dreams come true.

Again, I am not offering anything of great substance or
technological advancement. I am just someone who wants their dreams to come
true, and would love your help in doing so. If you have any input, comments,
advice, suggestions or special requests, I welcome them. I can be reached via
telephone or text or Whatsapp at +1(647)891-6246 via email at djnmomusic@gmail.com or on Social Media
Outlets such as Facebook, Twitter (@djnmomusic) Instagram (@djnmomusic) and
once I have other outlets available, I will make them available to you as well.
If you have any special requests when it comes to contribution gifts, they can
also be considered if what is listed above is not to your liking. I look
forward to speaking to you all and appreciate your consideration and help in
making my dreams and goals come true.
Sincerely,
Neeraj Mago aka DJ nMo

will be producing, I can tell you that my musical influences include but are
not limited to producers and DJ’s like DJ Jazzy Jeff, DJ Premier, Dr. Dre,
Timbaland, Kanye West, Armand Van Helden, Mark Ronson and artist like Nas, The
Notorious BIG, Jay Z, Wu Tang Clan, Kendrick Lamar, Duck Sauce, Avicii, David
Guetta and many more. I love all types of music, from Rap/Hip Hop, R & B,
Dance, House, EDM, Reggae, Jazz and much more.

Perks are available and are listed in the campaign, but are available in a limited number. So make sure you donate quickly before they run out. Also, if there is a perk not listed, or something else you have in mind for your contribution, for example me DJ'ing a private party for you and your friends, and event or festival, please let me know and I will be more than happy to discuss any other reasonable options! With the $50,000, I am looking to raise, here is what I hope to do with the funds:
Finally, I would like to mention that 10% of your
donation/contribution will go towards a foundation I am starting call the Sweet
Dreams Foundation (sweet because it is for children suffering from Diabetes and
or Kidney Disease) and will be used to help those who suffer from these
illnesses and making their dreams come true. Whether it is someone like myself
who wants to be a DJ/musician/singer or someone who wants to have a dream
sports weekend, or family getaway, this foundation will be there to assist
those in making their dreams come true.Again, I am not offering anything of great substance or
technological advancement. I am just someone who wants their dreams to come
true, and would love your help in doing so. If you have any input, comments,
advice, suggestions or special requests, I welcome them. I can be reached via
telephone or text or Whatsapp at +1(647)891-6246 via email at djnmomusic@gmail.com or on Social Media
Outlets such as Facebook, Twitter (@djnmomusic) Instagram (@djnmomusic) and
once I have other outlets available, I will make them available to you as well.
If you have any special requests when it comes to contribution gifts, they can
also be considered if what is listed above is not to your liking. I look
forward to speaking to you all and appreciate your consideration and help in
making my dreams and goals come true.
Sincerely,
Neeraj Mago aka DJ nMo",11.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Brampton, Canada",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/dj-nmo-album-and-dj-tour/pica

Hi Everyone, 


I’m Ingrid Mapson and I’m a showtune/jazz/pop singer. I am currently recording my debut album with Grammy nominated producer Daryl Bennett. My
album, ‘Rhythms of Your Heart’ will feature 11 cover songs and I can’t wait to
share it with you!
I have an amazing team of people around be supporting my
project, from my producer Daryl Bennett, to my Manager Paul Ouellette,
former Canadian tenor, Roy Tan the arranger and pianist and a bunch of other
amazing professional musicians who are contributing.

What we're doing:

We're pre-selling copies of our debut EP in order to fund the final costs. Producers to re-record and mix the tracks, the best Mastering in Canada and physical EP Duplication - which isn't cheap.

So far we've funded things with blood, sweat, tears and the change we found under the studio couch. Unfortunately those things don't hold legal tender for 

  • Final Recording Costs

• Producer's Fees
  • Mastering
• Duplication Costs
Here's What We're Selling:
The Impact

Hitting our goal means giving you the BEST quality music we're able to. Producers to reign in our wild creative impulses and clean up our messes, a properly mastered CD and high quality CD duplication.

If we're able to raise more than our goal, the additional funds will go to helping promote the EP and cover costs of the CD release party.

Other ways to help

Even if you're unable to pre-purchase the EP, it helps us out HUGE to share the campaign on your social media. Or tell your music fans friends.
Thanks, Much Love!

About me and what I am seeking. 

My name is Rick Gunn and I am a photographer, writer, adventurer and motivational  speaker based in California. In the last two decades I have cycled 40,000 miles through 40 countries, returning to share cycling stories that touch the human spirit. Last week I received a once in a lifetime invitation to speak at the TEDx Kish event in the Islamic Republic of Iran on April 19th. I will be joined onstage by my good friend and Iranian world cyclist Mohammad Tajeran, to speak about our unlikely friendship, and our Wheels of Peace project that promotes peaceful dialogue between the children of America and Iran. 

What I Need &
column2:
What You Get
  • I am seeking to raise $2500.00 to attend this important event .

column1: • Donations go strictly to airfare, accommodation, and travel expenses.

• Contributors will be able to take unique pride while watching theTEDx video knowing that their contributions got me to this event.
  • Contributors may also take great pride in helping to facilitate a peaceful dialogue between the people of America and the people of Iran. 

    • The Impact

    There will be over 700 people attending this event, many of them Iranians who've never heard anything but war-like rhetoric from America. 

    • This talk will allow them to see and hear a positive story of American and Iranian friendship, mutual respect and cooperation.
    • Like many of the talks I have given in the US and abroad, this TEDx talk about American-Iranian friendship and cooperation is hugely symbolic and coming at a time when a fledgling peace deal between the two countries may be on the way. It will be sent out through a variety of media sources including a large dispersion on the internet, and having a lasting effect on people's points of view. 

    Risks &
column2:
Challenges

      Any American who travels to Iran holds the risk of political complications.

  • But I have been invited by the TEDx organization, and they will see to it that I am safe and well cared for. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • You can post this on Facebook, or twitter, or the social media site of your choosing. 
  • Look for the Indiegogo share tools!

Who is Southeast Pit Report?
     Southeast Pit Report is a FREE online music publication, based out of the Upstate of South Carolina. We're a group of photographers and writers with a passion for music and we want to share  that passion with other all over the world. 

Our Story:
       In 2012 our editor and fellow photographer Joshua Lowe was a freelance photographer for his local paper, doing mostly local sports and some entertainment, it was then when the idea of Southeast Pit Report was born. From there, we hit the ground running covering such bands has Skillet, Halestorm, Coheed and Cambria and The Smashing Pumpkins all in the first few months. From there, what started as a simple online music website getting a few hundred hits a month, soon grew into something more. From there we started bringing in other photographers and writers that had the same passion for music and continued to grow our vision. We have now grown to have daily readers all over the world and covering show  from Maryland down to Tampa and everywhere in between. Though we've grown, our goal is still the same, to offer you the reader the BEST music coverage and is be 100% free to the reader, and we want you to be apart of our growth.  Our growth comes from you guys. Without you liking our Facebook, Instagram posts and sharing our articles then we wouldn't be where we are today. So that being said we're looking to buy some new promotional material for the upcoming Summer Concert series. Things we're looking at getting:

* Custom Canopy for the Summer Festivals we're apart of.
column5:
>* Custom Vinyl banner for our tent

* 1,100 SoutheastPitReport.com Stickers

* 1,100 Southeastpitreport.com braclets

* 1,100 Custom Southeast Pit Report Guitar Picks

* 1,100 Promo postcards 

Plus a few other things for promo use this Summer. That being said these things cost money, and remember we're a FREE publication. Yes, we do run ads on our site and on our Youtube Channel, and that helps, however we will need about $1,500 for everything we're looking at getting to further our site and that's where you guys coming in. If you'd like to donate to our cause that would be awesome, you would be a forever friend to our publication and we'd love you. If you can't donate there is still something you can do, just share this page with your friends and help get the word out. That being said thank you for checking our campaign, if you haven't already check out our site www.SoutheastPitreport.com and add us on Facebook at Facebook.com/SoutheastPitReport

‘Portrait of You’

We are a small media team who are dedicated to both music and film. However this particular project is focused on music in the form of an LP/album. The album will be called
column2:
Portrait of You, and will feature many unknown artists from around the UK, who are passionate about neo soul, chill-hop and hip-hop sounds. Not only will all tracks be professionally mixed and mastered their also will be several professional music videos to promote the album.

The Aim

The aim of this project is for unknown artist to get exposure, explore their talents and to expose their vocal and lyrical ability's in a genre, which doesn't really gather enough exposure in the UK. Also it is a chance to promote the musical ability’s of the producer ‘Adim’ to the world, and video graphical ability’s of the director ‘Kash’. This album will be promoted to several radio stations, and will be promoted on several social network platforms. With this project there's more involved than just music and videography. We have spoken words as well as an album cover, which will be illustrated by a Moroccan painter. The project will be finished by the end of this year.

Who are we?

We are an independent movement that promotes independent music and visual art. Our aim is to bring people together world wide and local, and to promote the growth of unknown and aspiring talent.

The music that we make, and pursue to make is not what you would consider commercial as we are purely focused on music not hype. We go down the direction more to do with the soul and rhythm of the beat.

Why support us?

Portrait of You, gives a chance for the artists appearing on the album to each freely tell their own stories and experiences in meaningful way. We feel that this cannot be done through commercial means, so we have taken it up on our self’s to produce an album that allows the artist to freely express their talents in any lyrical form. We can deliver a product, that is fully dedicated to the essence of Neo-Soul and Chill-Hop. If you support this project, you will be contributing to a fresh movement that produces music in its raw and soulful form, where the artist collaborates with the producer in a mutual agreement.

What do we need?

We ask a £1500 be able to complete this project.

A couple things that break that amount down, are named below:

-Sound Engineer

-Promotion

-Travel expenses (for artists)

-CD’s


Thank you very much for supporting this project, and keeping real music alive!


Contact:

Timelineprovisiontp@gmai.com

Phone: 07748115116

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Timeline-Provisi...

@TPofficialTP

TV reporter &
challenge seeker Michael Wigge is well known for facing incredible challenges,
e.g. How to Travel the World for Free &amp
column2: How to Barter for Paradise.  As a part of Wigge's new ‘American Dream’

column1: challenge, we are now trying to raise enough funds to produce a unique DVD, which combines his love for challenges and comedy.
In this DVD - “Wigge’s World
Records’, you will witness Wigge trying to break several Guinness World Records.
But these aren’t just any records, as he will chose, train and attempt to break
some of the most absurd and humorous records out there. Watch Wigge try to
break these three world records.
1.
The fastest
10K run of all time dressed up as an animal!
2.
The fastest
mile ever hopped in a potato sack and
3.
The longest
distance ever traveled on a hopper ball/space hopper/pogo ball.
Believe it or not, these records
actually competitively exist and Wigge is out to break them.
These world records will take
place in spectacular locations within NYC, San Francisco and Los Angeles and
will be closely supervised by Guinness World Record representatives.
This DVD will not just be an
entertaining account of Wigge’s journey overcoming these incredible challenges
but will also teach YOU how to break your own world record and have fun in the
process. He will show you how to select the right record and how to
successfully break it with a maximum training time of 10 weeks. We hope this
DVD will inspire people to challenge themselves and show that nothing is
impossible.
So please help Wigge embark on
this next amazing and thrilling roller coaster ride by donating, sharing and
spreading the word so we can get this DVD made.
Every little helps!
There are some great perks
available too!

be fulfilling all orders in-house using local mail shipping services. As with
all deliveries there is the inevitable lost item here and there. So in the very
rare case your DVD doesn't arrive, please notify us and we will organize a
redelivery straight away.
With regards to the World Record Coaching 1 on 1 Perk.
This training will take place
in Colorado, America and we cannot take responsibility for any visas required
for travel. Also we cannot be held responsible for any cancelation of flights,
or missed flights for personal reasons.

IN GERMAN

Leute, bitte unterstützt die Kampagne auch in Deutschland, die DVD zeigt Euch wie JEDER einen Weltrekord brechen kann. Ich führe es in drei Weltrekordsversuchen vor. Die DVD ist auf Englisch und Deutsch. Danke!
WATCH THE INTRO VIDEO IN GERMAN HERE:
WIGGE'S WORLD RECORDS:
TV reporter &
challenge seeker Michael Wigge is well known for facing incredible challenges,
e.g. How to Travel the World for Free & How to Barter for Paradise.  As a part of Wigge's new ‘American Dream’
challenge, we are now trying to raise enough funds to produce a unique DVD, which combines his love for challenges and comedy.
In this DVD - “Wigge’s World
Records’, you will witness Wigge trying to break several Guinness World Records.
But these aren’t just any records, as he will chose, train and attempt to break
some of the most absurd and humorous records out there. Watch Wigge try to
break these three world records.
The fastest
10K run of all time dressed up as an animal!
The fastest
mile ever hopped in a potato sack and
The longest
distance ever traveled on a hopper ball/space hopper/pogo ball.
Believe it or not, these records
actually competitively exist and Wigge is out to break them.
These world records will take
place in spectacular locations within NYC, San Francisco and Los Angeles and
will be closely supervised by Guinness World Record representatives.
This DVD will not just be an
entertaining account of Wigge’s journey overcoming these incredible challenges
but will also teach YOU how to break your own world record and have fun in the
process. He will show you how to select the right record and how to
successfully break it with a maximum training time of 10 weeks. We hope this
DVD will inspire people to challenge themselves and show that nothing is
impossible.
So please help Wigge embark on
this next amazing and thrilling roller coaster ride by donating, sharing and
spreading the word so we can get this DVD made.
Every little helps!
There are some great perks
available too!
FOR EUROPEAN CONTRIBUTORS:
Your contributions will be converted into Euros when processed.
1 Dollar = 0.9 Euro (approx.)
WHO IS MICHAEL WIGGE:
Michael Wigge is a TV host,
writer & challenge seeker who believes that
anything is possible.
He has successfully completed many incredible challenges such as travelling the world for free and bartering an apple for bigger and better things to reach a dream house in beautiful Hawaii.
Find out more at: www.MichaelWigge.com and
www.my-challenge-coach.com
Or get in touch using the links below.
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/MichaelWigge.Deutsch
Twitter: https://twitter.com/michaelwigge
PRESENT WORLD RECORDS TO BEAT:
Wigge intends to break the
following 3 records:
WR fastest 10 Km ever run in a full animal costume: 43.02 mins (2014 in India)
WR fastest 1 Mile ever hopped in a potato sack:
16 min 41 seconds  (2007)
WR greatest distance ever traveled on a hopper ball/space hopper within 24 hours: 5 miles (2014)
PRODUCT:
We will produce a high-end bilingual DVD
(English and German) of approx. 60 minutes in which Wigge will show the
audience how to choose, train and break a world record within 10 weeks. Wigge
will then himself try and break his own 3 world records.
BUT WHERE WILL MY MONEY GO:
As you can imagine, high-end TV production is not cheap and here is what's needed to make this DVD a truly amazing experience.
Multiple HD camera filming cost
Crew travel and accommodation expenses (three cities)
Filming permits
Wigge's four months preparation period
Props
Scripting
Editing
and post-production.
Graphic design
Manufacturing of the DVDs and international distribution.
Marketing and promotion
Campaign manager
Fulfilling all the perks
WHY SHOULD I DONATE:
To see Wigge push himself to the limit and find out if he'll manage to break these hilarious world records.
To learn how to
break your own world record.
To support Wigge
in his quest to prove that anything is possible in this world if you set your mind
to it.
Or simply to have
a good laugh.
I JUST CAN'T AFFORD ANYTHING:
If you
can't afford to contribute, please tweet, share, email, post and talk about
this fund raiser to everyone you know.
Click on the Indiegogo share links
and help us get the word out!

Friends,
I've written my next album, I'm headed to a rad studio to record it, and I need money to make it happen.

Recording a Studio Album? Really?! Oh yes. 

The writing is finished, the studio space secured, and the instrumentalists in the works, but there is a lack of funds. If you've never heard my music before, I am multi-instrumentalist songwriter now living with my wife in Indianapolis, Indiana. I've been singing my songs in front of other humans and recording since 2009. I've spent years recording by myself, but it's time in my career to collaborate and make something of higher quality than what I can do on my own. I am completely passionate about making good music that speaks truth about important things.

column3: >If you've heard my music before, you know that it's simply my heart out in the open. I aim to contribute beauty to you, my friend, and be much more than just proverbial noise from a radio. I believe I am called to make good music and that involves being vulnerable, honest, and hard working, creating a quality picture of what it means to be human, which functions in all audience's hearts at the most fundamental level.

column1: I look up to artists such as Jon Foreman (Switchfoot), Sufjan Stevens, Bright Eyes, Josh Garrels, Noah Gundersen, Pearl Jam, and Fleet Foxes, so if you are into that kind of thing, you should enjoy my material as well!
<ul>

• Recording is inherently expensive, but not by any means impossible. We can do this. The funds raised will go toward our wonderful engineers, producers, sound techs, and musicians who I believe are in it for the beauty of creating good sounds. Each hour costs in the studio, so every little bit helps. 
  • I've included some rewards to make the donation experience really unique and awesome. There are exclusive offers from the physical CD in your hands when it's released, to hand written lyrics sheets, to a concert in your town, and even dinner at our home!
  • If my goal is reached, recording will commence in November and we will get down to making a killer record! If my goal is not reached, I will be forced to spend more time raising money and be unable to give the material to be recorded the support it deserves, but we can make this happen!
Some More Real Talk:

•  Honestly, creating music in a professional environment as I am working toward with this project can give a new venue for that music to become what it's meant to be. Recording on my own has been successful as I could have hoped and many have been heavily impacted by the music I've created in a bedroom or practice hall, in which I have been tremendously humbled and blessed.
<ul>

• Just to be totally real, there is a lot of mediocre music out there. Along with other artists, I am reaching toward the goal of bringing music back into the realm of beauty and adornment for life. I want to experiment, grow, try new things, fail, and try again. I believe in music and I know it can affect people in a mighty way.
<ul><li>

I wouldn't be asking for help if I didn't believe it to be entirely plausible and have the work ethic to carry it out. My main challenges will be presenting my newest song material in a way that does it justice. Many of my new songs speak about the importance of diversity, resisting comparison, coming to terms with depression, belonging, and facing the pain of life, but still finding joy in the struggle
<ul><li>

I have a beautiful team of individuals helping me shape my goal of recording this album. I know raising money is difficult, but I know I am not alone. My hope is that my friends, family, and friends will be receptive to the importance of this project and if they feel led, will contribute. Ultimately, I am stepping into this with ""a little faith and a lot of heart."" (The Weepies)

Let's make an album together! Please SHARE!

column2: >My father once told me that he thought I was a soul/rock singer - not only a jazz vocalist. I dismissed it and got upset with him. Then, after the release of my first album in 2010, I learned that he was right. Jazz is but one room of a whole house called Kendra, and the songs of my soul have a broader sound and Universe than just one style. He also told me, that he saw me as an optimist, not a pessimist. In handling depression and anxiety - I learned that he was right. He could see me better than I could see myself. Unfortunately I never got to tell him this. He passed away in November 2008.

column1: This album will be released no matter what!

Should I be in a position of getting less than my goal, the funds will be distributed to the manufacturing of CD's, possibly a short span of PR as well to get some reviews. <div>Help me deliver this baby! I will be so proud of seeing &amp
column2: hearing it being played on radio stations, getting reviews and connecting with more people all over the world! And hopefully you will be proud too, knowing you have helped me get there!! :-)

column1: Why support me?

<div>I think the answer to that lies in the music. If you enjoy music that have roots in blues, rock and soul, music that have real drumkits and beautiful guitar solo's and vocals with sincerity and warmth - then I think you are going to love this album. This is a journey through the night with the light shimmering at the end of the tunnel in a medio tempo way. Inspirations are
column2:
Annie Lennox, Feist, Al Green, Nina Simone, The Rolling Stones, Lenny Kravitz, Leonard Cohen... and so many other artists. 

Making an album takes a lot of time and money - This is my 2nd and I hope to be able to record more in the future. First I made my demoes with Al Street (who arranged and produced this album with me) -  In the wee hours of the night, in his bathroom sized rehearsal space in industrial Gowanus (area in Brooklyn), while other bands where practising their heavy metal skills next door. And I loved every minute of it. After recording all the music for the tracks and the lead vocal in different studios in Brooklyn, I set up my own little ""recording"" session for my background vocalists at home. That took place in my bedroom closet since clothes absorb sound so well... Creativity will always find a way! There are so many steps and efforts in making an album and I appreciate every single penny and person who has and will contribute to the process!!

column1: For me, music is about connection. Connection to other people and to the Universe or God or exsistence or what you prefer to call it. I believe that music is a healing force and that it can help open up the doors to emotional chambers that have been sealed off for years or even decades. It can release the grief never processed or the joy we forgot to feel. It can remind us of who we really are.
This album deals with the feelings of despair, anger, longing &
column2: hope. I have written the songs from a personal experience of crash and burn. They have helped me reconnect to and transform some of the hardships of childhood and early adulthood. I hope that these songs can reach the people that need a friend in spirit. Someone who understands. I know, that is what I look for in music. I call it
column4:
Challenges

Nothing is certain. This is my first crowd funding campaign, and who knows what will happen day by day. I assure you that I will do my best to be present on-line during the campaign and physically run around in NYC to promote my campaign. Open mics, talking to people etc.

","A voice of soulful pop & rock tells the tale of human darkness & hope.

column1: My name is Kendra Lou. I'm a Danish singer/songwriter living in NYC. I have performed on TV, played festivals and venues all over Denmark, in London, NYC and I have released music in collaborations with Solar System, The Examples, The Miracles & The Prosoulytes. Listen to one of my collaborations here - Besides that I have been a part of theatre concerts, conceptional art installations and commercial song competitions.My first solo album ""To the end of The World"" was released by the Danish label Calibrated in 2010. This album was a vocal jazz album. Click to watch music video from first album!

In 2011 I moved from Copenhagen, Denmark to NYC, USA. I needed a change of scenery to find new inspiration for life and to change the sound of my music as well. I was missing a bit more sexy guitar and drums...Here in NYC I found such good people as Al Street, Derek Nievergelt, Brian Wolfe and Arne Wendt, who play my songs beautifully. I have spent 3 years recording, mixing and mastering my second album which is called Songs of The Black Moon. It's rooted in dark poetry and soulful melodies and the style is what some may call ""old school"". It's very much a 70/80'ies kind of pop/rock/soul album. It takes it's time and there is no stress in telling the stories.
Listen to bits from the coming album!
Click here for a sample of songs from the new album!

My father once told me that he thought I was a soul/rock singer - not only a jazz vocalist. I dismissed it and got upset with him. Then, after the release of my first album in 2010, I learned that he was right. Jazz is but one room of a whole house called Kendra, and the songs of my soul have a broader sound and Universe than just one style. He also told me, that he saw me as an optimist, not a pessimist. In handling depression and anxiety - I learned that he was right. He could see me better than I could see myself. Unfortunately I never got to tell him this. He passed away in November 2008.
This album is for him, may he live on in the music.
(The answer my friend is blowing in the wind... - Bob Dylan)
SO. I have created this campaign to:   Get funds to manufacture CD's. (Using CDBABY.)  Pay for PR and Radio Promo. (PR Company. TBA.)
5 % of the funds will be donated to savethechildren.org once the goal has been reached.
And if I get more than my original goal - I will use it to pay for more & better PR + get my band to play more shows with me!
Perkylicious.

When you help me, you will obviously get the music... :-) But there will also be unique perks like unreleased songs & lyric sheets with drawings. Plus you will have the opportunity to appear in my next music video! There will also be artsy stuff you can give to friends and family (or keep), some ""goodnight singing"" sessions on skype, house concerts and a Champagne dinner! Plenty of ways to have fun, connect and share music!
(Top left
(Bottom

And the perks are designed so that you will get them no matter what! (The difference is merely HOW the album will be released. If I can get the help needed to pay for PR.)

Help me deliver this baby! I will be so proud of seeing & hearing it being played on radio stations, getting reviews and connecting with more people all over the world! And hopefully you will be proud too, knowing you have helped me get there!! :-)
Why support me?

I think the answer to that lies in the music. If you enjoy music that have roots in blues, rock and soul, music that have real drumkits and beautiful guitar solo's and vocals with sincerity and warmth - then I think you are going to love this album. This is a journey through the night with the light shimmering at the end of the tunnel in a medio tempo way. Inspirations are

First I made my demoes with Al Street (who arranged and produced this album with me) -  In the wee hours of the night, in his bathroom sized rehearsal space in industrial Gowanus (area in Brooklyn), while other bands where practising their heavy metal skills next door. And I loved every minute of it. After recording all the music for the tracks and the lead vocal in different studios in Brooklyn, I set up my own little ""recording"" session for my background vocalists at home. That took place in my bedroom closet since clothes absorb sound so well... Creativity will always find a way! There are so many steps and efforts in making an album and I appreciate every single penny and person who has and will contribute to the process!!

column1: For me, music is about connection. Connection to other people and to the Universe or God or exsistence or what you prefer to call it. I believe that music is a healing force and that it can help open up the doors to emotional chambers that have been sealed off for years or even decades. It can release the grief never processed or the joy we forgot to feel. It can remind us of who we really are.

This album deals with the feelings of despair, anger, longing & hope. I have written the songs from a personal experience of crash and burn. They have helped me reconnect to and transform some of the hardships of childhood and early adulthood. I hope that these songs can reach the people that need a friend in spirit. Someone who understands. I know, that is what I look for in music. I call it
column2: Empathy through music.    Risks & Challenges Nothing is certain. This is my first crowd funding campaign, and who knows what will happen day by day. I assure you that I will do my best to be present on-line during the campaign and physically run around in NYC to promote my campaign. Open mics, talking to people etc.

There is no doubt about Ben's commitment to serving others often ahead of himself.   This keen sense of awareness was evident in Ben from a very young age.  It would be typical of Ben to independently realizing that we were out of a grocery item, head out with his own money to source it.   I suspect that this was possibly also is response to the desire to fill in for his absent father.

Ben's independence and leadership skills further allowed him lead in professional choirs, and teach an array of music lessons while still in high school.  The post college years included the co-founding of the funk band YUKA and most recently, the youth-centred JAMSPACE MUSIC. 

As a community supporter Ben calls himself  to immediate action and is passionate about lending his skills to make difference to someone's life through music.  A testimony to this is his attention to special need and under-serviced youths in his teaching programs and most recently through the opportunity to assist in the directing of a choir at the REGENT PARK SCHOOL OF MUSIC.

Why am I campaigning?   Ben now strongly desires to continue to grow in his skills through reaching a higher level of education and working with  targeted mentors.   Splitting his focus with community support has given him incredible experience and contacts, however, has sacrificed a bit of focus on himself in this respect.   He definitely desires to seek higher level education and also support his latest business endeavour with JAMSPACE MUSIC.

If I could, I certainly would assist him through this very important transition.  Those of you who know Ben, know exactly where it's at.

 Believe it or not, $1000 is only enough for 10 private music lessons however,  I am asking for us to raise this in 1 month's time as a sign of our support.  Even $10 goes a very long way.  We can do  it with 100 people donating $10, 50 people donating $20, 20 people donating $50.  What ever you can do will make a difference.   Even before posting this, we have a $20 donation.... Thank you!   

Let's strive to get this done and maybe even surpass this very easy target towards $3000 for 30 years! What a concept!  Ben certainly deserves $100 for each of his years.  Let's see what we can do!

column3: />

column1: <ul>
•
<h3>A DIFFERENT KIND OF ELIXIR: <span style=""letter-spacing: 0px

We have many exciting perks in store for you: ranging from our digital download music bundles to physical copies of the EP, in the form of old school-cool, retro vinyls! Bianca has put together elemental Spirit Packs with her favourite, specially curated items to aid you in your meditation and wellness practice.

We are also collaborating with three visual artists from the Philippines: Nikki Valenzuela, who has rendered a surreal water colour painting inspired by the EP's namesake track, 'Elixir', Corina Borromeo, with her striking acrylic portrayal of our song 'Feathers', and designer Feanne Hontiveros Maurico, who has conjured up Full Moon Youth in ink.  And speaking of collaborating, this could be your chance to team up with us on your very own, exclusive YUZON track!

Swansea, Wales, is a place we hold dear (most of the EP was produced and recorded here at the BBC Studious), so for our MEGA PERK, we would like to have you pampered with a weekend getaway at The Coran, Luxury Resort and Spa!
<div>
<i>...all this and more on the other side of the pledge rainbow
<div><span style=""font-size: 24px
<div>
<h3>The Impact<span style=""font-family: 'Benton Sans', Helvetica, sans-serif
<div>
<h3>Risks &amp

Over the course of one year we have been working hard to bring this EP into fruition, investing not just our own time and resources, but also of those around us that believe in us and our work. Thanks to technology and the internet, breaking into the music industry from the underground scene in this day and age is not as difficult as it used to be during the monopolistic reign of record labels, but it is no walk in the park either.

Aside from the expenses we've listed above, there are a lot of hidden costs for equipment and other factors, that are essential to actualising our vision. As independent artists, we understand that opportunity isn't something that will be handed to us on a silver platter, it is something we must create. We have poured our hearts and souls into this EP, which is what we hope will be the a solid foundation for a successful, sustainable music career.
We understand there will always be challenges to learn from along the way, but we are willing to give it all we've got, rise up above these trials and continue producing what we love.
We've written, recorded, mixed and mastered the songs in Elixir
column2: we just need the best possible avenue for our music to be heard, and it all begins with you :)

column1: They say ''it take a village to raise a child'', but these days it takes a whole community of social networks and forest of supportive people! With your much appreciated contribution, YUZON will be able to share it's unique light with the world, and hopefully inspire others to find and honour their own too.
<h3><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<h3><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<div>
Every post about the Full Moon Youth campaign is a valued contribution in itself. By raising your voice, you give us a chance to let our music be heard.
Feel free to share our video as much as you like: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fFd_pN3oa14
<div>

The Essence of the EP
Full Moon Youth is about growing into and embracing your own personal power.

I wrote it as an invitation and a challenge to step out of one's comfort zone and discover the adventure and treasures that await when you are fully activated, and living with as much presence as you can muster."" - Bianca Yuzon

column1: Out of the three tracks in our first indie-electronic EP titled Elixir, we chose Full Moon Youth to be the main single because we believe in it's message to inspire and empower others.
YUZON: THE AVATAR AND THE ALCHEMIST
Meet the Band
Full Moon Youth marks the beginning of a journey of awakening your soul’s true essence, whatever that may be. For YUZON, it's all about our music.
BIANCA YUZON (VOCALS, LYRICS)
Ever since I was a wee wolf pup I've always felt persistent tug, a stirring in my soul: and in the arts I found my home.
Singing, acting, writing and other forms of Divine expression--made themselves known in sublime succession.
Through the years this spark has been honed and has grown, it has blossomed (it burns!), with a voice of its own. (that tends to sound like mine
With the music (this journey), comes the urge to create--a gift I must share, for life will not wait.
Psyched to meet you :) Bianca here, your young spirit old-soul cosmic pal.
It has always been my absolute dream to be an international singer-songwriter, (writing for myself and others), which is something I've worked towards for as long as I can remember.
I am a firm believer in heeding our soul's call, and answering it by giving it everything we've got to shape our destiny, but I also know that this isn't something we can achieve without help.

I believe there is a greater purpose to every occurrence and there is no such thing as a 'mere coincidence': the fact that you have somehow landed on this page strikes me as a good sign that our destiny paths were meant to intertwine in a meaningful way. If you are reading this now, Thank You for welcoming us into your present reality, and for your positive energy :)
Let us all celebrate our own inner truth, let us dare, let us dance!
This is our Full Moon Youth.

This band is a collaborative effort drawing influence and experience from across continents. Experimenting with pop music to offer something different from you're use to. Contributions to this campaign will give us the platform to share more music and performances with you, to develop a wider following so that we can pursue our ambition to complete an Album.

We are also collaborating with three visual artists from the Philippines: Nikki Valenzuela, who has rendered a surreal water colour painting inspired by the EP's namesake track, 'Elixir', Corina Borromeo, with her striking acrylic portrayal of our song 'Feathers', and designer Feanne Hontiveros Maurico, who has conjured up Full Moon Youth in ink.  And speaking of collaborating, this could be your chance to team up with us on your very own, exclusive YUZON track!

Swansea, Wales, is a place we hold dear (most of the EP was produced and recorded here at the BBC Studious), so for our MEGA PERK, we would like to have you pampered with a weekend getaway at The Coran, Luxury Resort and Spa!

Hi everyone! My name is Gerald Morgan. I am a singer-songwriter, arranger, composer, multi-instrumentalist (saxophone, flute, harmonica, EWI, piano, organ, auxiliary percussion), poet and actor born and raised in Memphis, Tn. I hold a bachelor's degree in music education and jazz education from Jackson State University in Jackson, Ms. I am currently in my seventh year of teaching.

I have been doing music for most of my life. In my early years I spent them scuffing the floors moonwalking and breakdancing all over the house and singing every Michael Jackson song that I could get my hands on. I wish I could still breakdance, maybe soon. I was in the choir in elementary school, marching band in middle school, high school and college. Jazz band in middle school high school and college. I starting singing in the church choir in my teens and I sang in our vocal jazz ensemble in college. If you cut me, my blood would probably drip on beat lol.

If you plant a seed into my campaign I believe what will grow from it will be an artistic career for the history books if I play my cards right. I have acted in a couple of plays and recently had a small role in my first independent film. I have performed in different cities with different groups but never as a solo artist. Who knows
column2:
with your help I could end up on your radio, an arena in your home town, on the small screen and the big screen. It's all about that first step.

Thank you for your support.

Selci Earth Person EP - Release day October 16th @ The Goodwill

Hello all bee you tea full people! I have spent the last year working hard on my album, Earth Person. There has been a significant amount of contribution from a variety of skilled artists in the creation of this work. Currently, I am in last stages of development and need some help to get the last bit done and support all the amazing people who have helped me make it happen. Here is a break down of where the funds are going.

Mastering: $350
Recording/Editing: $300
Graphic design: $150
Patch and album artwork: $400
Contributing musicians: $300
T-shirts: $100
Music videos: $400
————————————-
Total: $2000.00


This breakdown is a ‘sort-of-ideal but not unattainable’ goal. Ideally I would like to make more than the goal because then more money can go to all the contributing artists- this would obviously be better. Many people involved have offered their services for free or very little - which is amazing. However I really want to pay these folks what they are worth. Support Art!!! If the goal is not reached

A. Some folks may not get paid or very little

B. I lose more money out of my own pocket, already spent a bunch and broke as hell >
column2:
_~

This album means so much to me and I look forward to getting it into the ether. It shares multidimensional thoughts about human existence and planet earth. The amount of help I have received to create this album is off the chain and I want to support all the inspiring folks that have shared their time, energy and magic with me to bring this thing to new heights.

You can check out the perks, I am offering a lot! Free entry to the show, Ep’s, patches and t-shirts with designs by Troy Benoit and Gabrielle Funk.

Troy: https://www.facebook.com/Troy.Benoit.Art.Tattoos?fref=ts
Gabrielle: http://gabriellewmfunk.squarespace.com/index/


I understand that funds are tight for all of us. If you still want to help then make some noise for this campaign. Send it out on FB and to your rich uncle who likes the arts.

So Much Love Love Love and gratitude for your time checking out this page. See you at The Goodwill on Oct 16 for the EP release featuring, Ingrid Gatin, WATG Steve, Envoy, G-ma Feel Good, FC Coconut, Nereo II, Nicola Baldwin, Yofidelic and Rachelle Bourget. (Music, Dj’s, beats, hip-hop and contemporary dance, live art and film)
   Yours truly,
Selci CellSea SellSee <

WHAT IS THE LIFTOFF?

 I'm Billy Lord... I'm sort of a ""Rocky"" story for the unemployed... I lost my job and my ""American Dream"" in 2009, and found my true calling, a year later, in music. A relative newcomer to writing, singing and playing, I set out on a motorcycle with a guitar strapped to my back, and played my way across the country, writing songs for an album, funded by a 2013 Indiegogo campaign, that was released in May 2015.

That album, National Anthem, sparked a powder keg of a year in 2015. The single, Steal the Evening Sky broke into the Top 40 on the Country Charts (New Music Weekly) and spent four consecutive weeks at #1 on The Iceman's Top 40 New Country Artist Chart. The album has been selected for Grammy nomination consideration in three categories. And, buzz from the album has secured headlining shows across the country as well as opening slots for several major headlining acts to be announced soon.

In July, I was hand selected as one of the flagship artists for Nashville's Smokeshow Entertainment. With Smokeshow's recording, booking and marketing reach, I made the decision to move to Nashville and jump head first into the deep waters of the Nashville music scene. An incredible group of musicians, all from the RI, Massachusetts area, have committed to take this leap with me, and we are prepared to work hard on developing the songs for the new album and becoming the best live band in Nashville, and then the country.

With two stadium shows already booked and two demos for the new album already done, there is buzz throughout the industry  that a breakthrough is imminent. We just need one big push to get us across the finish line... That's where you, the believers since day one, come in to help one last time. Let's lift off. To the moon and back...
WHAT WE NEED... WHERE THE MONEY WILL GO

- The Album!!! With 18 songs already written for the new album, we will begin studio time as soon as we hit Nashville, and have access to some of the best producers in Nashville and will be recording in Sony's Nashville Studios. This is an expense where we absolutely cannot cut costs as we have in the past, where we've made good recordings, but not amazing recordings... the kind that will get us the radio play we need to support our touring efforts and take us to the top. We estimate studio costs at a minimum of $20,000 and likely more, but we are hopeful our touring revenues will help cover our needs going forward. $20,000

- The Move!!! A band of 6 are moving to Nashville to commit full-time to this dream! We need a BIG Uhaul, a lot of gas for that Uhaul, gas for the three other cars coming to Nashville, and tolls etc... We estimate our moving cost $3,000

column7: > merchandise!! We are fortunate to have the best design team in the business, Richards and Southern, redesigning my logo and branding. That means cool new t shirts, truckers caps, tanks, and posters are coming soon. Yes, it's revenue for us, but we need to pay for stock and design up front! $2,000

column1: - Travel / Touring expense!!! Our new management team is starting to book us stadium gigs across the country. We already have two on our schedule, starting November. We will need to get the band to those gigs!. $3,500

- Web Design!!! We have an amazing new web designer who has designed a mock up of my new website.. It's incredible and we want to pay him to get it done so we have an efficient portal for our fans to see our tour info and and support us through merch sales! $1,000

- Equipment!!! We have all spend every cent we have personally to buy the equipment we need to put on a world class show. We are still in need of new mics, an in ear monitor, PA equipment and at least one bigger amp. $1,000
THE IMPACT

The impact of your donation is ENORMOUS. I believe... and so do those in the know..., that your donation can make a dream come true. Priceless. 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

 I've known the odds since day one, just four short years ago. And I've been able to beat the odds time and again. And, I have deeper faith than ever. This is the greatest of odds yet, but with your support, this band and I have the one chance we need. No matter what, we won't let you down!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Of all people, I know times are tough. If you can't afford to donate, please pass our campaign on to someone who may. Share it on your social media and by word of mouth. And, thank you all for believing since day one and riding along!
